author: {'steamid': '76561198136647171', 'num_games_owned': 7345, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 395, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1712236895}
review:
[h1]Burrito congelado=Arma arrojadiza
Burrito caliente=Revive[/h1]
Hylics es en lo que destaca es en la personalidad que rodea todo su universo. Visualmente utiliza el surrealismo y el estilo Memphis 80/90 con unas animaciones que parecen hechas con plastilina.

Su apartado sonoro con sus punteos de guitarra y la vestimenta de sus personajes  daría el pego como mascotas de un grupo de rock.

Aunque en mecánicas sea un JRPG de toda la vida pero simplificado y facilillo, todo está hecho de forma psicodélica y humorística. 

Es un juego corto y barato para jugar 1 o 2 días sin pasarlo mal. Aunque no está traducido [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3211403345]hay una traducción no oficial que te puede ayudar[/url].

[u][b]Pros[/b][/u]:
✅Apartado visual muy original y con personalidad
✅Situaciones graciosas y psicodélicas
✅Precio

[u][b]Contras[/b][/u]:
❌No está traducido
❌Mecánicas simples y sin historia

Nota: [b]7,5/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197961017729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3428, 'playtime_forever': 1130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1130, 'playtime_at_review': 1130, 'last_played': 1711501124}
review:
I (generally) have the same dream every night when the blanket of cannabis fog (which follows me around like Pigpen) is thin enough for me to remember what happens. I'm in some amalgamation of the schools I've been too, in a hospital-with-atrium type configuration, but also sort of like the Black Mesa Hazard Course.

Hopefully, if it's the fun variant of the script, I get romp around a sort of fucked up computer lab with lots of old kit, but that's a side quest usually. There are other people in the building, but I'm trying to be coy and avoid them noticing me, because there is a room (often way up in the corner or near the roof of the building) that I'm trying to get to. Upon discovery, there is a 50 percent chance I'm in there to manipulate some scary kind of power or SCADA equipment running Windows 2000 that I glean is connected to (or represents) The Internet... OR I'm there to encounter some kind of hole or pipe made out of flesh in the floor (think anus/colon) that I must jump through like Mario to get underneath.

I believe the first scenario to be simply my brain nagging me about not completing some kind of technical objective years and years ago that I've long since forgotten about, while the latter seems to be some Freudian urge to return to my mother's birth canal.

author: {'steamid': '76561199660877307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 261, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1711923135}

author: {'steamid': '76561198080781507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 88, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1711909225}
review:
[b]Overall: [/b] 5/10

Hylics, as told by the author, more than a game, it is an art experience. And it it too artsy at best to be understood or enjoyed. Luckily, it is short, though you still need to 100% it to have a chance at beating the endgame boss.

[b]Music: [/b] 6/10

It's interesting and you will be fond of it after a while. Plus, it has some solid sound effects.

[b]Visuals: [/b] 8/10

The best aspect of the game, it strives for something different, and succeeds at it. 

[b]Gameplay: [/b] 3/10
 
It is a light RPG with very tedious and repetitive gameplay aspects. You are encouraged to kill everything and die, to have a chance at winning the game. That's basically it, there is no more to the game.

[b]Story: [/b] 1/10

Pretty much non-existent. You do things just because you have to do something in the game; not because the story demands it, nor tells you to, nor the protagonist has any aspiration.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354546903', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 330, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1711849715}
review:
gosto de história bem explicada, crescimento de personagem e construção de mundo bem feita. e eu acho que não tem nada disso aqui, pelo menos eu não entendi nada. dito isso, hylics brilha na parte subjetiva, a arte, os assets, a trilha sonora, esse negócio é muito lindo.

todos os personagens são muito expressivos e carismáticos, apesar de não ter uma troca entre eles e o caracter design do wayne (o principal) é muito massa, a vontade de tatuar ele é muito grande e... eu acho que vai ficar no campo das ideias.

a batalha final é desnecessariamente difícil e desbalanceada e é o único momento que vc tem que pensar um pouquinho e entender os padrões do chefe, mas não foi impossível.

author: {'steamid': '76561198800691542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1710777706}
review: An incredibly engaging game for a world that makes no sense. Going into this I worried the non sequitur story would make me feel detached from the world and characters but I could not be more wrong. The couple hours I spend wandering the wastes has left me feeling a sense of fondness for the society found in the archipelago. A must play for RPG fans especially ones who enjoyed Yume Nikki and Earthbound which this takes clear inspiration from.

author: {'steamid': '76561199200738573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1707080729}
review: Hylics is one of the most inventive, industry defining, immaculately crafted and creative pieces of media in recent memory. The soundtrack is abstract and moving, and I've never quite heard anything like it. The gameplay is captivating and engaging, the level design is well thought out, and saying the dialogue is amazingly written would be an understatement. By the end of the game I was honestly in tears from the sheer beauty of the poetry that is Hylics dialogue and narration. A true testament to what can be achieved within even the deepest bowels of capitalism, truly an experience everyone should experience at least once. Frozen burrito.

author: {'steamid': '76561199029643344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 960, 'last_played': 1709824019}
review:
他の人は4時間で終わると言っているけど、自分は１６時間かかりました。
グラフィック以外は普通のRPG。日本語化パッチを当てて遊びました。
翻訳された日本語だからかはわからないけど、意味深な要素を詰め込むだけ詰め込んで、それらに対しての答えを作中で用意していないように思った。
内容も古いRPGって感じで、熱中できる要素もあったけど、取り返しのつかない重要な要素があったり、謎解きが面倒くさかったりといった悪いRPGの要素があるので、気軽に遊ぶにはちょっと難しいかも。

author: {'steamid': '76561199581110588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1708877365}
review: In a single, badly written sentence: Hylics surreal little RPG that seems to be about one thing above all- vibes. The groovy music, the strange little NPCs, and the absolutely bonkers artistic vision of the experience make it stand out from the other RPGs I've played recently. It's got its own look and sound, and the sameness of the RPG gameplay-loop is broken up in unusual ways: random NPC dialogue that's funny and obscure, combat animations that are probably my actual favorite part of the game, and companions that I really liked for how little we find out about them. I'll replay the game at some point to see if anything is different, and I'll absolutely be getting the sequel. I really think this is an indie RPG that more people will talk about over time. For as crazy and deep the symbolism and artwork of the game are, the thing that also stands out is the heart put into it. I appreciated having the experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130191590', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1708196282}
review:
Dude, I'm not even going to try to analyze what might be going on here philosophically, probably something something idealism, something something existentialism, it's too much for me. 

What I can say though is that Hylics is probably one of my favorite RPGs now. The core gameplay loop is reminiscent, likely inspired by Mother 1, with an extremely surreal and cryptic narrative to go along with it. I'd probably say that it's more about being enveloped in the world and focusing on things superficially since the narrative gives off a sense of ephemerality, playing out like a dream or a drug trip, where continuity is optional. 

This game has the most unique and bizarre visual style I've probably ever seen, somehow being even more insane than something like LSD dream emulator, or Hypnospace Outlaw. I can only describe it as being a mix between paranoid schizophrenia, and 1980's retro-futurism similar to the look of Max Headroom and Mac Tonight; whilst incorporating elements of biomorphic claymation. I don't even understand why but I really fw this style, and it gives the game such a uniquely authentic, though, almost a bit unsettling feeling. This game is also pretty funny, the sometimes extremely exaggerated character animations, like just Wayne walking can constantly remind you of this, not even mentioning the tendency to subvert conventional RPG tropes and kinda just make fun of them.   

I love Hylics, Hylics is a fantastic game, and genuinely a great piece of artistic expression, to anyone who is a fan of JRPGs and or surrealism this game must be experienced. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198178999977', 'num_games_owned': 800, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1708343772}
review:
《Hylics》以其超现实主义的游戏风格在一些小众圈子里被人所称道。任何人上来肯定会被这黏土动画风格的画面所吸引，但一旦上手之后就会发现整个游戏充斥着各种莫名其妙的敌人，由AI生成的毫无逻辑的对话文本，如果自己开荒玩的话，整个游戏的流程会让人完全摸不着头脑。

游戏系统上则完全是JRPG的回合制战斗模式，不过游戏一开始的难度会非常高，你操作的wayne几乎谁都打不过，这就引出了游戏的死亡机制，游戏并不会真正的结束，每一次死亡都可以让玩家使用从敌人身上掉落的肉块和地图上探索得到的水杯之类的消耗道具永久提升自己的HP和MP的上限，这使得游戏的死亡完全变成了一种升级的机会而不是失败。

总结：
一代的流程非常短，我在看攻略的情况下2个小时就通关了本作，如果不看攻略自己探索的话3个小时左右也能通关。这种电波系的游戏必然带着一定的实验性质，在游玩的过程中不必拘泥于游戏试图表达什么内容，只需要享受游戏所传达的氛围就可以了。

author: {'steamid': '76561199074955657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1707016314}
review:
It's less polished and less fleshed out than [i]Hylics 2[/i], yes. But for how much I'd heard this described as a quirky little oddity or throwaway prankster experiment in comparison to its sequel, I was surprised at just how rich and enjoyable a gaming experience it wound up being.

It does, however, lean much further into being a parody of the JRPG genre (while at the same time toying with the genre's mechanics in genuinely interesting and creative ways). Lindroth seems to take a sort of impish, anarchic glee in "breaking" the genre's fundamental systems or rendering them pointless and absurd.

Near the end of the game, for instance, you walk into a room, open some chests, and are suddenly given what for all intents and purposes amounts to an infinite amount of money — a completely random, unearned, hilariously disproportionate "reward" for doing basically nothing at all. The game's biggest laugh-out-loud moment for me occurs when you defeat the final boss, upon which you're again given "999999 BUCKS" (which you now have no reason to spend), as well as "A HOT DOG," and are informed that you've gained "999999 EXP" and that all of your party members have now reached "LEVEL 63." Neither experience nor levels have been mentioned at all in the game prior to this moment.

The implicit message seems to be: none of this matters! You didn't play this game because you want to crunch numbers¹ or to fight repetitive battles until your avatar is as souped up and powerful as possible. You played it so that you could have the experience of being a weird little yellow guy with a moon for a head, wandering around a dithered 8-bit clay world, squashing vegetables, petting cats, watching trippy animations, and listening to NPCs with goofy walk cycles recite gobbledygook flavor text. And on that front? [i]Hylics[/i] delivers.

I can't wait for [i]Hylics 3[/i].


¹[i]For an example of weird JRPG parody that goes the opposite direction and leans waaaaay into the number crunching, check out the games of [url=https://cannibalinteractive.itch.io/]Damien Crawford![/url][/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198063524486', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1072, 'last_played': 1707618708}
review:
Short & Sweet.

Trippy and bizarre Turn-Based RPG. Hylics has some goofy graphics and even stranger dialogue. I don't play RPGs very much, but this one caught my eye from its presentation alone. It's a short RPG that can be completed in 1-3 sittings, but with its short length, its good at keeping you entertained. The use of claymation sets it apart from many other RPG Maker titles that if you're a sucker for more artsy and abstract games, this one's for you. Hylics isn't super unique in its combat or mechanics, but it's uniqueness shines with it's colorful choice in words for stats and other game-type lingo.

In a nutshell, Hylics is a neat little Turn-based Role Playing Game that's got aesthetics that I haven't seen since a game like Neverhood, but with the most trippiest visuals to ever be concocted. Would recommend to those who like claymation, stoner-rock music, and those who just like surreal stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163651354', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1707449324}
review:
[h1][b] Hylics [/b][/h1]
Gra która z każdej strony bombarduje nas stylem. Abstrakcyjny lecz dobrze zbudowany świat w którym można się zatracić, piękne animacje wykorzystujące claymation oraz video capture robią wrażenie. To wszystko w akompaniamencie świetnej, wręcz psychodelicznej muzyki. Jest to chyba pierwsza gra z gatunku JPRG w która grałem i z początku nie byłem pewien czy mi się spodoba to to nie moje klimaty ale jestem pozytywnie zaskoczony. Walki były ciekawe, wymagały taktyki oraz wiedzy odnośnie umiejętności naszych i przeciwników. Jeśli chodzi o fabułę to niestety wiele się nie dowiemy, mamy pokonać głównego antagonistę i na tym się kończy. O automatycznie generowanych tekstach dowiedziałem się dopiero przy pisaniu tej recenzji i teraz ma sens to że większość nie miała sensu. Ciekawy zabieg artystyczny ale mam wrażenie że zadziałał na niekorzyść gry. Dużo czasu spędziłem na szukaniu znaczenia wielu tekstów które dodatkowo były napisane dość trudnym angielskim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077226180', 'num_games_owned': 714, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1706985894}
review: Los RPG no se me han dado muy bien, no han sido de mi particular gusto dentro de los videojuegos, sin embargo este juego me ha resultado agradable de jugar. Me costó entender al principio la mecánica por lo expresado antes, no estoy familiarizado con este tipo de juegos. Pero me alegra haberle dado una oportunidad, ya que el arte y la música lo es todo, el gameplay se vuelve sencillo pero no importa. Lo que quieres es ver mas cosas, hay mucha imaginación en esto y se nota. Tuve que colocar un parche para tenerlo en español, por que es abstracto hasta en los diálogos y los textos. Es corto, pero resultó ser una experiencia muy placentera de jugar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198801439192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1705971426}
review:
62/100

(+3 for starting something great and innovative (the Hylics series). Afaik Hylics 2 has much greater productional value - in case you asked).

The gameplay have some serious shortages, there are bugs as well (so be sure to save from time to time). The game (especially the team UI) looks like as if it was made in RPG maker, which doesn't really fit the setting and takes from overall experience, imo. Fact that some dialogues are randomly generated and other are fixed, feels kind of weird, but I take that as something neutral - because it may only be me. The setting is indeed r e a l l y surrealistic, but I honestly hoped for something simulating psychedelic experience a little better though. Some songs are lacking... but the other tracks (if not most of them) are just absolutely [i][b]M A J E S T I C[/b][/i] and top tier. Hence, that's my rating.

author: {'steamid': '76561199261099341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1706476887}
review:
Coming from Hylics 2, this is a pretty good game. It doesn't have quite the same amount of content as compared to its sequel, but it's still a quick & fun game to play through in an afternoon.

It follows the exact same RPG / gameplay tropes as the sequel, so if you're coming from Hylics 2 & aren't sure if this game will hold up, I'd recommend giving it a try. It doesn't take too long to complete, anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198452485817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1706662714}
review: I recommend this game but I can't help but feel really disappointed by it as a whole honestly. The game tries to set a certain aesthetic that feels really cool and the music is excellent for a game this small but besides that I don't really like this game at all. The characters don't need to be interesting but I don't like how every character feels so copy and pasted with minimal stat differences and the item + move overlap really hurts the combat. The combat isn't even that interesting with most fights being obviously very easy or will be easy once you come back after 20 minutes or so. Another problem I have is the over world is really clunky to travel and it lacks anything interesting to do half the time. Out of the 3 hours it took me to finish the game a solid hour was spent just trying to back track to get the old moves for my allies which really got annoying after the 4th ally. Besides getting the tokens the game is a very strict straight line with almost nothing to do besides go for the final boss. As a whole I want to like this game but it feels like it doesn't have enough content for me to ever replay.

review:
I LOVE THIS GAME SO MUCH RRAAAUUUGHHHH

Hylics is a really fun experience!  Everything is designed so intricately and looks so interesting and weird, and the soundtrack compliments it so well.  The RPG turn-based style combat is basic, but it doesn't need to be anything more than that, as the game isn't *about* combat.  I think it works perfectly well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027453870', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1700853314}
review:
A simple yet perfectly surreal RPG. 

Hylics is a RPGMaker Game created by artist Mason Lindroth. It follows the story of Wayne as he journeys to dethrone, Gibby, King of the Moon, with the help of his friends. With that he sets forth in this bizarre and clay build world as he fights enemies, gains meat, probably dies a lot, and makes his way up to Gibby. It's a short RPG for a cheap price that stands out wonderful with it's unique artstyle, aesthetics, and music. 

Gameplay of Hylics is basically your average RPGmaker romp. Spawn in a overworld, explore, fight and kill enemies, and figure out how to progress the story. Hylics however, does make some attempts to stand out with unique quirks to the combat and exploration. Examples include learning new powers through TVs throughout the world, collecting meat from your enemies when they die, and most notably going to the afterlife when you die where you can take the aforementioned meat and convert it into more max health to your party! From there the game follows a pretty standard RPG flow. Battles are turned based, overworld travel is done in 4 directions with a handful of locations to explore. But gameplay alone isn't what Hylics is best known for. 

Style Wise, Hylics is utterly fantastic. Mason Lindroth's clay sculpting style shines well throughout the game, thanks to most of the graphics being photo-scanned images of objects and characters in his style. It creates a insanely surreal, chaotic, yet alluring aesthetic that keeps you excited what visually insane enemies or locations you'll see next. This style even bleeds into the battle system, with all attacks presented with pixelated stopmotion hand gestures and surreal imagery for the special attacks and item usage. This is all wrapped together with the soundtrack with also ties in with the aesthetic with a lot of surf rock-esque and other unusual tunes that fit extremely well with what's going on screen. Even if they do sound somewhat unprofessional which adds to the experience in a way. 

Overall, Hylics is a pretty basic RPG game that's held up with a incredible visual style. The claymation used for practically everything is truely unqiue compared to other games that use the same medium. Furthermore the playtime of roughly 3 hours is well work the price of just 3$, basically the equal price of a small snack for a fairly unique experience. But if finishing the game left you wanting more of that amazing artstyle, never fear as a sequel released a few years later with Hylics 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561199518442196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1706092745}

review:
[i]"Thine behaviour's skeleton can mercifully exalt
and radiance sort of caress a product!!"[/i]

I don't know what I played here, nor do I know how to write about it. What I do know is I enjoyed this surreal pastel claymation RPG and that it's much cheaper than doing drugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015651530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1703815454}
review:
If someone had played Hylics, and they wanted to do mushrooms, and they asked me what mushrooms were like, I would tell that person that mushrooms are like Hylics.

It's a 2-ish hour game with some fun mechanics and a bunch of nonsense. It's not particularly challenging, which is a plus for it.

I can easily see myself replaying it to show it off, replaying it over a rainy afternoon, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198320361048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1695653432}
review:
With my interest for weird ass games, I was naturally very intrigued by this title. But unfortunately, it doesn't contain enough game to make me enjoy exploring the weird ass. 

To be honest, it feels just like barebones surface level rpg systems draped in an air of quirkiness as a selling point. 
Which I find sad because the game does interesting things visually, and in some of the text too. But I just couldn't bring myself to continue playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110448585', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1709248075}
review: What a fucking game. it took about 4 hours for me to beat and my only complaint is that its way too short. The first thing that stuck me was the music, the mixes of experimental rock, drone, indie rock, and many other noisy and werid-esque genres fit this game perfectly and im so happy to see those genres finally be used in a game that really fits it. The claymation art is also done extremely well and just adds to the all of the oddities that this game came with. As someone who has loved JPRGS nearly their whole life, this game managed to accomplish much more in just 4 hours than most AAA RPG's aren't. I can tell just from one playthrough how much love and passion was put into this project and I am going to try my best to buy and play Hylics 2 ASAP. An amazing showing of surreal art with extremely well done RPG mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198803028322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1704620978}
review:
Este juego tiene una estética muy única combinada con un estilo audiovisual extraterrestre.
Los gráficos son muy bonitos y diferentes en cuanto a otros juegos de RPG Maker como este, ya que están hechos de modelos de plastilina digitalizados. La música se me hace muy entretenida escucharla.

El juego tiene una forma muy artística y poética de expresar las cosas, lo cual es un factor que me encanta.

Eso sí, necesitas un alto nivel de inglés para entender este juego, ya que hay unas cuantas palabras que con un nivel de inglés medio-alto no te habrán sonado de nada.

Además es bastante corto, pero sé que vale la pena jugarlo al menos una vez.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004605645', 'num_games_owned': 671, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1704641301}
review:
[h1]Кислотный трип за 1$[/h1]

Пластилин доступен людям с самого детства, а его гибкость позволяет создавать самые невероятные вещи. Порой его используют для разработки видеоигр, добавляя причудливости их визуальному стилю. Именно так поступил Мейсон Линдрот, разработчик-одиночка, автор интерактивной арт-инсталляция под названием Hylics. Эта игра — своеобразная JRPG в сюрреалистичном стиле,с гипнотическими спецэффектами и по-хорошему нелепыми персонажи. Тех, кто осмелится отправиться в столь крышесносящее приключение, ждет одна из лучших игр на базе RPG Maker. 

[h2]Что курил автор?[/h2]

Один из главных козырей игры — её визуал. В ней все персонажи и локации выполнены из пластилина, приводимого в движение при помощи stop-motion анимации. Техника, которая зарекомендовала себя ещё давным давно (вспомним Neverhood, Skullmonkeys, детище 1С «Операция "Пластилин"»), позволяет создавать удивительные и причудливые картины, но автор Hylics решил зайти ещё дальше —  такого уровня сюрреализма в играх нужно ещё поискать. Все эти необычные, если не безумные, формы и сочетания цветов могут оттолкнуть неподготовленного зрителя, но после 10-20 минут игры начинаешь замечать своеобразную гармонию всего происходящего на экране. 

Отдельной похвалы заслуживают анимации, которые происходят в момент, когда один из участников команды использует свои способности или достаёт какой-то расходник из кармана. Будь то спасение напарника при помощи буррито, хтонические заклинания или попытка вырастить растения перед врагом —  наблюдать за происходящим одно удовольствие. В целом в анимациях нет ничего странного для обитателей того мира, в котором происходят эти действия.

[h2]Контролируемый хаос[/h2]

Подача сюжета недалеко ушла от визуала - большинство предложений игры генерируются случайным набором синонимов из интернета. Не поймите меня неправильно, цельный сюжет есть, но чтобы его выцепить, нужно быть или гением, или безумцем. Вот например одна из фраз, которую я встретил по ходу своего прохождения:

[i]But every pain is a modified being!
And every passion is like fatal pain[/i]

На первый взгляд бессмыслица, но если копнуть глубже, то можно увидеть, что в ней скрывается одна из основных механик Hylics —  здесь нет типичного экрана «[b]GAME OVER[/b]», после смерти вас отправляет в некое подобие загробной жизни, где вы можете усилить себя, построить несколько замков из песка и выбрать точку своего возрождения. В этой игре смерть не отбрасывает вас назад, а лишь делает сильнее. 

Сопровождают буйство красок психоделические гитарные мелодии и риффы, проще говоря примитивистская электроника. Большего от саунда игры требовать и не хочется, тем более, что по ходу прохождения вы можете помузицировать вместе со своими спутниками в одной из локаций. 

[h2]Стоит ли?[/h2]

Как только вы попадёте в мир Hylics, вы абсолютно ничего не поймёте, и в этом нет ничего страшного —  смыслы этого творения столь же пластичны, как и материал, из которого оно было создано. В процессе изучения мира вам придется делать всякое: копаться в мусорных баках, разгадывать нехитрые головоломки, изучать новые способности при помощи телевизора и приобретать ключи от космического корабля. Стилистически игра по-настоящему самобытна, в то же время механически она достаточно проста для своего жанра, но это ни в коем случае не является недостатком — благодаря подобному сочетанию она и западает в душу. Рекомендую всем любителям оригинального визуального стиля и атмосферы.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029646187', 'num_games_owned': 756, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1704610086}
review: THIS VESSEL AND SUCH! Good surrealist game with decent jrpg elements that can feel tense at times. Combat mechanics are basic and involve health (named flesh) and mana (named will) management with simple shop-keeping and inventory management. Story progression stays pretty linear. Very short playtime, but an extremely unique experience for somebody wanting something stylistically new and abstract. Overall, feels like a clay fever dream that has the the emotion and interpretation you get when you stare at a Salvador Dalí painting for too long while on copious amount of drugs obviously. The only normal part of this game has to do with the fact that the protagonist's name is Wayne (not the acclaimed Wayne Brady unfortunately).

author: {'steamid': '76561199252837824', 'num_games_owned': 60, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1704595723}
review:
Para quem veio pelo vídeo do Tropia, acho que não vou falar muita coisa nova. O jogo tem uma base firme no surrealismo, simplesmente sendo uma brisa do início até o fim. Como eu adoro essas neuras sem pé nem cabeça, me senti atraído. Dito isso, minha experiência com HYLICS foi OK. Eu realmente gostei do jogo ser bem curtinho (levei 4 horas e meia para terminar TUDO), das músicas e dos cenários brisados, das magias com um nome doido, dos combates e de você poder salvar praticamente a hora que quiser... e foi isso. Quanto á exploração, achei NEUTRA, não fedendo nem cheirando. EU achei HYLICS um jogo bem padrão de rpg (com um diferencial nas mecânicas aqui e ali, claro), porque realmente senti que seu diferencial é o surrealismo intenso do jogo, porque fora isso, não achei nada de mais. O que digo é que talvez você não veja muita novidade fora a temática maluca, e foi isso que me fez gostar mais do jogo, porque a sensação de se tornar meio massante não me pegou. 

Duas coisas que me incomodaram:
-Você precisa ir em todas as televisões que fez contato anteriormente para adquirir as magias para os novos companheiros. Por mim, todos os companheiros já ganhavam essas magias.
-Eu não vou levar este ponto muito em consideração pelo tempo de duração do jogo, mas enfim: não achei a party tão carismática. Gosto dos nomes dos personagens, amei o visual da Somsnosa, mas vai ficar por isso mesmo. O resto dos personagens (um pouco com exceção do Wayne, só pelo cabeção de lua dele) parecem só uns bichos genéricos que você encontra por aí e mata. O Wayne pra mim parece um pouco  também, mas ainda se salva, como eu disse, pela cabeça de lua. Os personagens não tem lá muitos diálogos, então não me apeguei muito (eu gosto quando o Wayne nega comprar coisas dos vendedores e é chamado de mão de vaca KKKKKKKKKKK). 

Novamente, acho que, pelo tempo do jogo, os problemas que EU tive realmente não foram um incômodo. Eu gostei da experiência. Espero que HYLICS 2 me surpreenda de alguma forma.

author: {'steamid': '76561198799358899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1710828396}
review: i really love hylics, its a unique yet short but sweet game. out of all the absurdity, you can find some sort of meaning if you delve deep enough into it. encouraging you to die and be reborn stronger is a really interesting concept that i like to see in games. the teammates are cool, each one unique, and though their dialogue may be limited, it opens up a lot of opportunities for the player to assume how a character might actually be. i never thought being vague and mysterious would be appealing, but it allows for more room for imagination. hylics is definitely a unique experience that you wont regret playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198995206413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1704515993}
review:
Un juego genial. No necesita tener coherencia para tener sentido. Aunque la bizarra forma de hablar de los npcs no te de muchas pistas para avanzar en la historia, nunca estarás perdido; la estructura del juego permite progresar sin dificultades.
Aunque no es un juego particularmente difícil, es divertido resolver los puzzles del juego y hacer estrategias para el combate.
Realmente no es como ningún otro juego que he jugado; el arte y los gráficos son de otro mundo, se sienten tan reales, pero a la vez no. Es algo bizarro e increíble, este juego es una experiencia que le recomiendo a cualquier amante de los juegos de rpg maker.

review:
"Lysergic acid diethylamide, commonly known as LSD (from German Lysergsäure-diethylamid), and known colloquially as acid or lucy is a potent psychedelic drug. Effects typically include intensified thoughts, emotions, and sensory perception. At sufficiently high dosages LSD manifests primarily mental, visual, and auditory hallucinations. Dilated pupils, increased blood pressure, and increased body temperature are typical. Effects typically begin within half an hour and can last for up to 20 hours (although on average, experiences last 8–12 hours). LSD is also capable of causing mystical experiences and ego dissolution. It is used mainly as a recreational drug or for spiritual reasons."

Unfortunately, this game only lasts about 2 to 3 hours, but otherwise it's about the same.

author: {'steamid': '76561199184161169', 'num_games_owned': 550, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1703805636}
review:
if Salvador Dalí created a claymation game back in 90s it would have been this.


Jokes aside, this game is simply an experience - one of those that somehow gets you sunk in for hours until you realize the game is over. Did you understand anything? aside from using a horse as a weapon, probably yeah but also no. You probably wish the game was a bit longer. Why though? most of the text is just randomly generated on the go and straight up gibberish to an extent.

I can't express how much I enjoyed this game and I have no clue how this game went under my radar for so long, it was released in 2015. Not implying it's a masterpiece, but the soundtrack and Wayne constantly melting in front of my face will live rent-free in my head until I melt down and decide to crash on the couch in the afterlife.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174576179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1703716096}
review: "So after beating it in 2.5 hours I'm going to recommend hylics its only 1.5$ on steam right now. Music isn't anything to write home about, story is your typical lsd dream and its a rpg maker game but the visuals and aesthetics alone are really fun and engaging and I feel like it might be right up your alley. There's a hylics 2 I'm excited to try one day, its such a vibe of a game and although it doesn't give you any tutorial if you have 2 braincells you'll slowly piece together where you're supposed to go and what to do by exploring. I heavily suggest you don't get a guide for the game and just experience it yourself. Solid 8/10." - Review I wrote for my friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203869232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1703482456}
review: Hylics is by far the most out-there RPG I have ever played, with absurdist, incomprehensible dialogue in addition to emotive instrumentals and an inimitable art-style derived from stop motion. The game is cheap, doesn't take long to finish, but will leave a massive impression on any player. I highly recommend Hylics, just be ready to bust out a guide during some of its more obtuse moments.

review:
As a super-fan of psychedelic music, atmosphere, and games that take a day to beat, this is one of my favorites of all time.
For an RPG that looks like you're gonna get stuck majority through playing, that has not happened once, even with the NPC dialogue and environment you're given.
1$ for a 3 hour RPG seems too cheap for an experience this great.

review:
Hylics is similar to other rpgs like final fantasy, but more surreal, and expriements with how you get stronger.
I really like the asthetic's of this game, with the fantastical lccation's to the more lax yet strange music, it helps this game stand out. I was also able to figure out most of the required paths, though I had to look up where to get more paper cups to get more will points(I don't remember if the game tells you where you can get an infinite supply). It's also very short, so it doesn't over stay it's welcome. Consider trying this game if you are looking for something more abnormal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123769103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1702772190}
review: Esse jogo é uma bad trip total. A história? não entendi, mas senti durante o jogo que tinha um propósito, mesmo sem saber dizer até agora qual. Preso nessa viagem análoga ao uso de entorpecentes me peguei tentando entender o contexto através da comunicação com a população local. Contudo, me deparei com um obstáculo: poucos NPCs falam algo que faz sentido, mas quando fazem, é mágico. Imerso nesse insano mundo feito de massinha a última coisa que esperava encontrar era um sistema de RPG coerente e, vai por mim, é a única coisa que vai fazer sua mente se manter estável durante essa experiência surreal. Vai na fé, se você nunca usou drogas, esse jogo será uma experiência, caso contrário, você se sentirá em casa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025689227', 'num_games_owned': 940, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1702776038}
review:
Клёвая артхаусная "навроде JRPG", с изумительным выразительным ладом и необычным потусторонним духом. С точки зрения играния всё ладно - занятно проходить, нескучно, мир очень продуман, нету случайных боёв и нудокача, сами бои умеренно заставляют думать, игра короткая и ёмкая, хорошо звучит и выглядит, в ней приятно находиться и изучать мир. Я прошёл не спеша за 5 часов и весьма доволен. Ну, сюжет не понятен до конца (понятен в общих чертах), но тут объяснения от поклонников в помощь - да и не в повествовании здесь мякотка. Забавно, кстати, что часть неписей говорит случайно созданными предложениями (точнее, частично случайными) - это прикольно, не припомню где ещё видал такое.

Ещё запомнилось занятное устройство прокачки - после боя дают предметы, которые можно использовать для прокачки здоровья лишь если умрёшь, то есть не сразу. В общем, можно усилиться только после смерти, то есть когда возникает необходимость - ведь убили же. Ну а всякую ману и другие показатели можно лишь нахождением особых предметов и снаряжением усилить. То есть игра старается отойти от задротства в цифирках, но при этом сохраняет равновесие сложности. Прикольно. Также славно, что заклинания выучиваются чтением особых "телевизоров", которые надо найти в мире игры. То есть один из моих любимых подходов к изучению заклинаний - исследовательский, а не задротский.

Все недостатки игры - технические, во многом из-за движка. Тут в нутре сидит RPG Maker, хотя его опознать было непросто. Нету поддержки игровода (точнее она как бы есть, но на деле ничего не работает - у меня самый обычный игровод от Xbox 360, с ним игра не завелась). Работает игра либо в малюсеньком окне 640 на 480, либо в полном экране - в большом окне не запустить никак. Нету достижений и карточек - тоже недостаток. На этом пожалуй всё!

Короче, клёвая, ёмкая, самобытная и недлинная игра, советую всем любителям необычных, свежих и продуманных разработок.

author: {'steamid': '76561198390511790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1702815299}
review:
I really couldn’t care less for the JRPG elements. The game is a pleasure, it’s super beautiful. Recommend 100% without hesitation just for the art direction and the atmosphere.

It does feel a little imbalanced sometimes however, with walls that suddenly break, but not in a very satisfactory way. A few bugs and the keying of F12/screenshot key that actually stops the party made me lose an hour of play. I can’t wait to test the second one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042181078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1701399359}
review:
Here's what you'll actually be doing in Hylics: There is a world and there is you, so you get to it. The game doesn't hold your hand. You find friends, find dungeons, defeat their bosses, and do inexplicable things that do actually amount to changes in the gameplay and sometimes do nothing at all. For instance, you find water coolers but need paper cups to use them. Both are few and far between, You also need a companion who knows how to operate the "ancient" device. But when you drink from them your MP permanently goes up. You can also make sandcastles on a beach while the red waves crash nearby and can trample on them when you go to leave, and that is all about you do on the level. You will also die a lot because the afterlife is a level. It's where you deposit the "meat" you've earned off of dead enemies in order to increase your HP. You will visit it often because you will be dying a lot. Combat is tough, until you learn where to go first, and there are mobs you need to avoid touching that insta-kill you. 

The game is this: you play, you die, you teleport back to a nearby location, and try again. Stop at a shop, talk to some weirdos... eventually, you figure out how to kill the baddie and then you win.

But the vibe the whole time is to just "hang out." I spend the first ten minutes just wandering around the map without a purpose because I wasn't given one. You just spawn into your house and the game's like "alright now do your thing." But I wasn't bored. The music and the visuals just jam together. They're very well done. The writing is intentionally esoteric and sometimes funny, but a lot of NPCs use randomly generated dialogue that don't mean anything to enhance the weirdness of the "recreational program" vibe. Likewise the plot is kinda just there so you can do weird things. It's not very dramatic. The combat is also... okay. Skip Battle Animations in the options if you get frustrated. But Hylics lasts three hours. It does not overstay any of its elements.

In general playing the game reminds me of using my brother's computer to play Morrowind when I was like six. I had no idea what I was doing or what anything meant, but I roamed around and had a lot of fun. The idea of a "recreation program" was still alien. Being ported into a whole world and just let loose. Today, those memories feel like a dream. Hylics is definitely dream-like, but it's also tight and fun, and surprising. Just play it. It's worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042473131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1695623910}
review:
[h1] 脳みそ探検RPG [/h1]
このゲームを一言で表現すると、そうなる。
主人公の月っぽい奴が冒険するこの世界は、基本的に脳みそがベースにデザインされているように見える。
住民が喋っていることはなんとほとんど自動生成で、[b]言ってることは意味不明。マジで解読不可能。[/b]
なので、あまり深く考えないで話がわかりそうなやつの言っていることだけヒントに先に進む。

本作の特徴を大きく３つ挙げると
・戦闘中に繰り出した技によってBGMが変化する（どんどん音が増えていく）
・死ぬことでステータスを強化するステージに行ける
・独特の世界観とビジュアルが織りなす脳みそのハーモニー

主人公の月っぽい奴の目的は圧政で住民を苦しめているお空のラスボスをぶっ倒してロックに人生ぶち上げること。
死ぬとこれでもかと険しい表情でドロリと骨以外が融解する。
最初は奇抜なビジュアルと独特の世界観に圧倒されるが、プレイしている間に実はオーソドックスなコマンドバトルRPGであることが理解できる。
作中で全く説明がなされていないが、本作は各地でスキルや仲間を獲得したり、死ぬことで行けるフィールドにて自身を強化することができるシステムだ。なので、死ぬことをあまり恐れなくてよい。おあえつらい向きに即死ギミックも盛りだくさんだから。

正直に申し上げると、このゲームってめっちゃ[b]マイナー[/b]だと思う。
2015年度のマイナー・ゲーム・オブ・ザ・イヤーはこれだと個人的には思っている。
でも、この作品でしか摂取できない栄養があるのは確かだった。音楽もめっちゃ独特だからね。
もし、「RPGツクール製で奇抜なビジュアルのゲーム探しているんだよね」って人がいたら、これをすすめればいいと思う。

author: {'steamid': '76561198325223160', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1704798249}

author: {'steamid': '76561198257563401', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1700202333}
review:
Hylics is something that I believe is meant to be experienced. It's so weird and unique. I've never played anything quite like it and can almost guarantee you haven't either. This is one of those games where the visual style interested me far more than the game play. 

I've never been the biggest fan of turn based rpg's. Hylics takes that same game play and shifts it slightly. Going beyond just renaming the menu items like many "quirky" rpg's do. There's a lot going on during combat, although at the same time there is also very little. What I mean by that is there are many animations that play during combat. There are animations for basic attacks, magic, items, and there's even one for when you die. Each one is interesting to watch as the clay figures onscreen morph into strange shapes. These add a layer of complexity to the fights where there isn't really any. Without them, it's your basic press A and menu combat system. Not bad, but not always interesting. 

Interesting is exactly what Hylics is. You don't have to look far to find all the weird stuff going on in the game. Visually, everything is made of clay or is drawn in. Nothing is quite normal. Some things are completely divorced from our reality, only being comprehensible in game. As such, there is no shortage of interesting things going on at all times. The characters are all super strange and vary from being relatively normal people to unhinged strangers that recite poetry as their main method of speaking. Story wise this is how things go. The game follows a set of acts that show you how far you've come. Each one gives you some more schizo rambling that explains what is going on. The only really comprehensible thing being that Gibby is up in his moon tower doing... something. 

Hylics moves slowly, but not too slowly. It's well paced, relatively short, and is very sweet. Worth the price and worth the few hours of time it'll take you to complete. If you're a fan of weird, psychedelic games then definitely check this one out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069598692', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1700196880}

The atmosphere is just amazing and the art style & music are absolutely GORGEOUS. It really shows the impeccable and hard work they put in the game, Lindroth and Salamone outdid themselves in this. I really hope to see more of them!

review: This game is weird and jank, but in a charming and good way. The RPG Maker bullshit adds a lot of charm to the entire package, and I love the way it looks (even if it's super crusty). The battle animations are probably my favorite part of the game though; watching anyone use an item or a special attack is so deeply hypnotizing. Just know that the game is super damn short though, I could have beat it in one sitting very easily. Also expect to die a lot

author: {'steamid': '76561198268019858', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1705620347}
review:
A very charming and quirky RPG. There's not really a lot of story other than go find Gibby, King of the Moon and stop whatever he's doing. Most NPC dialogue is very cryptic (certain phrases are randomly generated I think), but some will give you a pretty clear hint as to what you gotta do to progress. I can't say if it's difficult? I'm not very familiar with RPG games as a whole, but dying is something you can use to gain more health (or "flesh" if you want to be game accurate). There was a section outside of battle I died a ton, but otherwise, I got through mostly unscathed once I figured out a comfortable control scheme.
The art style is definitely what drew me to Hylics, it has this wonderful claymation x pixel art combination which adds to it's dreamy, surreal look, accompanied by soft psychedelic guitar strums and lonely little synths which come and go.
Anything bad? No, my only gripe is no other window options and I could not for the life of me get any fullscreen options to work, but it is a game under £3, released in 2015, so unless you're completely opposed to playing a game in a little 640x480 window, there's honestly not anything I can say to deter someone from playing this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347305081', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1663804993}
review:
Quem busca um pouco de surrealismo certamente esta sendo corroído vivo pela quentinha e deliciosa normalidade. Cores cintilantes, acordes inquietantes, seres delirantes... Que maravilha.

 Hylics é o rivotril numa noite de insônica, nos fornecendo um pouquinho da tão amada desordem de pensamentos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198373145402', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1698860911}
review:
When it comes to arthouse projects in gaming Hylics is essentially the standard. Weird but not alienating, charming but not annoying, colorful but not blinding, the game hits the spot just right and delivers more or less what you would expect by looking at the screenshots on the steam page. It's not particularly difficult either, providing the player with a good amount of stuff from the beginning and a linear and progressive growth in your power, with the only notable spike at the end really.
Despite how cryptic the dialogues can be they still manage to show the personality of the characters, and the main cast especially is delightfully weird and charming.
Very good experience, will play the sequel. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198079130855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1698716652}
review:
The first ten minutes of Hylics had me amazed and filled with questions.
The next hour made me incredibly frustrated. This game gives you very little direction on what to do, and figuring out what to do without any sort of pointers or walkthrough is very difficult. Maybe it's because I don't play many JRPGs, but I struggled heavily at the start. It took me 45 minutes of playtime to win my first battle.
The rest of my playtime involved me experiencing an incredible game with fun mechanics. The sheer exploration factor of this strange world is immense for a game that's objectively short. The game's combat becomes far easier to control once you begin finding your party members and more television screens to obtain your powers.
Hylics is the weirdest game I have ever played thus far, and I cannot wait to try out the sequel. While I do wish the beginning of the game was more forgiving and gave me more of an explanation (it doesn't even explain the controls to you, for the most part), it becomes a very enjoyable experience when you get a grip in this surreal world you're in. This game is a must-play for any fan of RPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985672769', 'num_games_owned': 1824, 'num_reviews': 468, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1697657363}
review:
Random Scuffed Games #73
https://twitch.tv/ditodesign

Vorgeschlagen von: Megapunguina

Zunächst einmal, waren wir natürlich darauf eingestellt, dass das hier ein Fiebertraum wird.
Allerdings finde ich, sollten doch einige essenzielle Dinge in einem Spiel erklärt werden bzw. irgendwie ersichtlich sein, warum man wie und wohin man überhaupt muss. Hier wird man finde ich leider etwas alleine gelassen und es gibt auch keine wirkliche Hintergrund Geschichte. Klar, alles wirkt sehr absurd und surreal, aber ehrlich gesagt fühlt es sich ein bisschen "auf krampf" an? Es hat etwas von einem Tourned Based JRPG wie Pokemon, nur dass das Kampfsystem für mich wenig intuitiv und scheinbar unmöglich scheint. Der Gegner Wombo-Combo Happy Feeted mich weg, während ich auch nur einmal versuche anzugreifen oder eine Spezialattacke zu Zünden. 
Klar, es ist Visuell mindestens interessant gestaltet, aber irgendenwie fehlt mir hier der Spielspaß - wenn ich Kunst ansehen möchte, die ich nicht verstehe - gehe ich in die Pinakothek der Moderne und schaue mir Joseph Beuys an.

Ratings:
Dito: 3/5
Chat: 1.3/5
Gesamt: 2.15/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198077662248', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1697464776}
review:
When I say that I love the fact that RPG Maker is such a niche program that it attracts bizarrely unique and creative individuals, this is the PRIME example of what I mean when I say that. This ga- "recreational program", is fucking dripping with such a unique flavor of your typical RPG story.

It was an absolute joy once I figured out what to do in the intro, though a friend had to tell me because I'm a bit impatient. Having to go back and get moves from televisions to reteach them to later partners got a bit annoying, but in general I really liked this game's approach to RPG combat. To be honest, the idea of everyone having the same moves through the TVs was really cool, especially since it gave me incentive to see which moves were applied best with which character. Simply "leveling up" by taking consumables to water coolers + a "flesh grinder" to boost MP (Will) and HP (Flesh) respectively seemed weird at first, but was great in the long run because I wound up not feeling the need to grind very much. (For the record, I don't mind grinding in most instances, but I know it's a deterrent to some folk out there. That's why I included that comment.) So long as you kill the enemies in an area, and yes they stay dead, you'll have enough Flesh and Will to take on the final boss, Gibby.

Can't wait to get my hands on Hylics 2 dude, this was a blast.

review: Узнала об этой игре от друга, которого недавно обрела. Она согрела мне сердечко своей простой графикой, сюрреалистичностью, её необычным музыкальным сопровождением. Каждый раз приходилось продумывать новую тактику боя, стратегии против Гибби и его статуй. Сама по себе она простая, именно этим игра и западает в душу. Я получила удовольствие за эти 8 часов моей жизни, узнавая что-то новое для себя qwq

author: {'steamid': '76561199039545466', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1630672164}
review:
别去思考这游戏要表达什么，沉浸在果汁与肉块的荣耀中吧！！！（别忘了玉米饼）
画风很有个性，总之是对上了我的电波，我本人还是很欣赏这种个人风格浓厚的游戏啦。其实剧情就是很传统的打倒大魔王王道故事，不过没有全副武装的主角，漂亮的法师妹妹，温柔的牧师姐姐，豪爽的战士大叔啥的。取而代之的是一个牛角包脑袋，虫群女王（索姆斯诺萨超可爱的！），奇怪头型的考古学家和一个会放远古臭气的黑暗骑士。
但如果你追求一段迷幻的游戏之旅而且你喜欢ARPG的话，这款游戏绝对适合你！
黄昏中冉冉升起的果冻带来的感觉就像一氧化氮一样啊！！！！！！！！！！！

review: I can't describe with words the feeling I had playing with game, it all feels so odd, like a trip to another realm where you don't belong, there's a story but you can't understand it, also with the enemies, the NPCs, the world, you don't even know what your character motivations, the random text obviously plays a big role there (tbh I didn't know that it was random text and I tried, unsucessfully, to understand what's going on which made the inmersion even better), but I enjoyed this odd feeling, I highly recommend this game if you want a weird and different experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049183341', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1693145682}
review:
Hylics es un [b]estrambótico JRPG[/b] muy cortito hecho en RPG Maker que destaca principalmente por su peculiar apartado visual que [b]mezcla arte abstracto con plastilina[/b].

La trama es simple: Gibby, el rey de la luna, se está pasando de listo, y Wayne, protagonista de esta historia, debe pararle los pies. Así de simple y directa.

La primera media hora es dura porque [b]no te enteras de nada[/b]. No sabes adónde tienes que ir y no entiendes a nadie (el 95% de los diálogos con los PNJ [b]consisten en texto autogenerado de forma aleatoria[/b]). Es curioso, pero da vibras a cuando jugabas a un JRPG de chico y no te enterabas de nada porque muy probablemente estuviera en inglés, así que hablabas con todo el mundo y lo tocabas todo hasta dar con la tecla.

Una vez descubres hacia donde debes ir y te haces con el sistema de progresión ([b]que consiste en morir, viajar al más allá y allí meter carne en una picadora[/b]), la experiencia se vuelve [b]bastante «cómoda»[/b] (dentro de lo surrealista y desconcertante de su mundo).

Lo único que no me ha gustado de su progresión es que tanto las habilidades (que me parece superoriginal que las aprendas viéndolas en una tele) como los vasos de agua [b]no se comparten para todos los integrantes[/b]. Es decir, si aprendes una habilidad y te bebes un vaso de agua con Wayne, el resto de personajes que se irán uniendo a nuestro grupo tendrán que ver otra vez la misma tele y perderán la mejora de voluntad para siempre.

Las habilidades que he comentado cuentan con [b]animaciones en primera persona[/b] muy originales y elaboradas haciendo uso del «[b]stop-motion[/b]». La de la dinamita es la cúspide del humor.

No quiero hablaros más sobre los tres actos en los que desarrolla este [b]viaje psicotrópico de 3-4h de duración[/b] (según lo mucho que os perdáis o exploréis) porque prefiero que lo descubráis por vosotros mismos, pero os aseguro que es una [b]experiencia audovisual tan abstracta e incomprensible como única[/b]. Lo de quedarme embobado intentando descifrar lo que se muestra en pantalla mientras suena de fondo temas que generan tanta tranquilidad como inquietud, [b]no me lo ha dado ningún JRPG[/b].

No es un juego para todo el mundo, pero [b]es una de las experiencias más únicas que he vivido en un JRPG[/b].

[hr][/hr]
Si preferís jugarlo en pantalla completa en vez de dejaros la vista con la ventana de resolución 640x480 en la que solo se ejecuta por defecto este juego, echadle un vistazo a mi guía:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2999551427

author: {'steamid': '76561197993525646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1692285462}
review:
하이릭스는 초현실적인 분위기가 강한 RPG 게임입니다. 제작자의 기묘한 아트와 시적인 대사들이 굉장히 많이 나오는 게임인데요.  
그런데, 직접 사서 한 번 10분 해보면 '이 게임이 재미가 있냐..? 아니 이게 게임이긴 한거냐?' 하는 소리가 나올수 있습니다.
그 이유는 이 게임은 평범하고 편안한 진행 방식의 RPG게임의 요소를 전면적으로 부정하기 때문입니다.

[1. 전혀 이해못하겠는 스토리 도입부] 
뭔일이 일어난 건지 모르고 여행의 목적도 거의 이해 못했습니다. 그냥 갈 수 있는 곳에 가고 싸울수 있는 놈과 싸워보는 식으로 여행이 진행됩니다.  (사실 지금도 주인공 목적 확실히 이해 못함) 퀘스트 표시 같은 것도 없기 때문에 플레이어는 혼자서 길을 정해서 떠나야합니다. 게임에서 먼저 여기를 가봐라, 이곳은 어디서 뭘 하면 된다라고 설명해주는 경우가 없습니다.

[2. 헷갈리는 그래픽]
처음 시작해보면 뭐가 적이고 뭐가 NPC인지도 모릅니다. 뭐가 상호작용 가능한 오브제고 뭐가 상호작용 불가능한 오브제인지 모릅니다. 게임 시스템을 UI나 튜토리얼보다는 NPC에게 말을 걸어서 배울수 있기 때문에,  플레이어는 처음 적이든 엔피시든 그냥 벽이든 뭐든지 치고박고 스페이스부터 박습니다. 초기에는 플레이어는 경험과 NPC 대화를 읽어보며 게임을 플레이해야합니다.

[3. 특이한 전투, 방어 시스템]
주인공은 처음 디버프기만 가지고 있고 후에 배우는 기술들도 디버프류가 많습니다. 데미지를 제대로 줄수 있는 기술들은 게임 초기에는 주어지지않습니다. 이런 상황에 비해, 처음 만날수 있는 적들이 무진장 쎄기 때문에 여러번 죽고, 설상가상으로 닿으면 플레이어를 즉사시키는 몬스터가 있어서 처음에 진행이 난감합니다. 처음 만날수 있는 적들이 그냥 쎈것 뿐만 아니라 강한 디버프도 잘 걸기 때문에, 초반 전투 시간이 길어지고 지루해집니다. 상점에서 구할수 있는 방어구 또한 이걸 착용하면 저걸 착용 못하고 하는 식으로 조건이 빡빡하기 때문에 방어구 선택장에서 최적화를 눌렀더니 더 스텟이 구려져보이는 상황이 나옵니다. 그렇기 때문에 처음에는 방어구가 크게 도움이 안된다고 느낄수도 있습니다.

여기까지 적으면 이거 개망작 아니냐? 할 수 있는데요.
놀랍게도 이게 이 게임의 처음 보이는 단점이자 특별한 장점입니다.

[1. 전혀 이해못하겠는 스토리 도입부] 때문에 플레이어는 맵을 탐험하며 자신의 목적을 찾아나갑니다. 알수없는 세계에 떨어진 플레이어는 이 세계에서 자신이 할 수 있는 행동등을 필사적으로 체크하기 시작하고, NPC의 대사 하나하나, 퍼즐의 힌트 하나하나를 주의깊게 보게 됩니다. 그 사이서 나오는 조크나 재미들을 즐기면서, 플레이어는 게임을 해독하며 게임내 초현실적인 세계의 논리를 배워나갑니다. 그리고 혼자서 배운 논리를 가지고 게임의 장해물들을 해결하게 됩니다. (꽤 이 과정이 쾌감 있음)

[2. 헷갈리는 그래픽] 때문에 뭐가 적인지 엔피시인지도 모르겠으니까, 무대포로 덤벼들게 되고 그런 자세가 게임의 시스템을 경험으로 배우게 합니다. 게임의 세계를 배우며 익히는 초기 단계를 지나치면 플레이어는 적, 엔피시, 맵 등을 점차 잘 구분하게 됩니다. (좀 신기함) 플레이 초기에는 하나하나의 힌트가 굉장히 절실하기 때문에 게임에서 나오는 모든 문자들을 집중하여 읽게 됩니다. 그 과정에서 게임의 몰입도와 이해도가 높아지게 됩니다.

[3. 특이한 전투, 방어 시스템]때문에 플레이어는 최대한 어떻게 싸워야하는지 이득인지를 생각하게 되고, 초약골 플레이어는 익숙하지 않은 이 디버프기를 가지고 어떻게 강한 적들을 싸워 이길수 있을지 전략을 세우게 됩니다. 이 과정에서 플레이어는 무페널티로 갈 수 있는 저승(공식명칭 잊어버림)을 최대한 활용하여 강해지게 됩니다. 각 방어구는 빡빡하고 복잡한 장비 조건을 가지고 있지만 이것을 이용하는 것으로 플레이어가 파티내의 캐릭터들에게 어떤 역활을 시킬것인가를 정해줄수 있고, 적들이 거는 디버프들을 피해 전투의 큰 이득을 볼수 있게 됩니다. 처음 익히기엔 불편하고 낯선 시스템일수는 있지만 익히면 게임의 난이도를 크게 조절할수 있습니다.

하이릭스는 이렇게 단점이자 장점을 가진 게임입니다. 모든 점이 게임에 얼마나 집중하고 활용하는가에 따라서 플레이어의 진행을 막는 단점이 되기도 하고 플레이어가 게임에 빠져들게 하는 장점이 되기도 하지요.
 
진짜 장점이라고 하기 힘든 단점이 살짝 있긴 합니다.....
주인공 걷는 애니메이션이 조금 특이하고 맵에서 나오는 엔피시 대부분이 통과해서 걸을수 있는 게 아니라서, 
맵에서 이동할때 발이 턱턱 걸려서 조작감이 나쁘게 느껴집니다.

그래도 특별한 게임플레이를 원하시면 추천합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262559835', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1692247484}
review:
[h1] 初見プレイのインパクトよ [/h1]
ビジュアル以外の情報一切入れないで日本語化だけして遊んでみました。
NPCの会話が自動生成らしく、めちゃめちゃカオスな感じの世界観が始終続きます。
人によっては「きも！」となりそうな感じのビジュアルですが...
逆に癖になってくるので、とりあえずクリア？まで遊べました。
これだけだとゲーム部分の評価がないので一応書いておきます。

[h1] 戦闘について [/h1]
戦闘は初見30分くらいまで結構むずいかも。敵の攻撃が痛いし対策しないと状態異常で行動不能。
ただ、パターンというか一度敵の行動がわかってしまえば対処は楽。
逆に戦闘が単純なので数で押されるとつらいですが...
死ぬと終わりではなく、別ワールドへ飛ばされてゲーム継続かつ救済要素多めなので詰むことはないかも。

[h1] ビジュアルに惹かれたら買い [/h1]
僕はビジュアルに惹かれて買ってしまいましたが、正解でした。
自動生成の会話も面白いし見てるだけでなんかハマる。
言語化難しいですけど、かなり独特なゲームなので刺さる人にはめちゃめちゃ刺さると思います。
実質ゲームオーバーがないので、RPGというよりはADVに近いかもですね。
手軽に謎世界観味わいたい方は価格も安いのでぜひ遊んでみては。

author: {'steamid': '76561198076831263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1691911827}
review:
생각보다 아스트랄한 느낌의 RPG게임인데 생각보다 재미있었다. 난이도 자체는 초반만 뺴면 후반엔 그냥 죽어서 아이템을 아낄수도 있고, 막판 모아둔 돈으로 최종전 이전까지 최종무장까지 무난하게 맞출수 있어, 토큰만 제외하면 3~4시간이면 클리어가 가능하다.
후속작 2도 있으니, 관심있는 사람은 사서 플레이해도 좋을거같다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281988441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1648915483}
review:
É difícil falar desse jogo, já que ele me provoca sentimentos bastante conflitantes. Primeiramente, devo dizer que, embora tenha colocado uma análise positiva, eu não gostei da experiência. Explico os motivos a seguir.

Para causar toda a comoção que ele inevitavelmente provoca em seus jogadores, Hylics usa elementos relativamente fáceis de identificar. O horror surrealista é o mais evidente e me parece desde o início selecionado como a base de tudo. Em seguida, percebe-se que o criador decidiu adicionar a psicodelia, que pode ser vista de forma muito explícita nos fundos coloridos das batalhas, por exemplo. Finalmente, para criar os personagens e os cenários que povoariam essa atmosfera perturbadora, Mason, o criador, escolheu uma porção de influências dos anos 80 e 90, como certas artes 3D, jogos e a televisão da época. Hylics é muito semelhante: colorido e luminoso, mas ao mesmo tempo muito artificial. Consideravelmente nítido, mas com imagens cheias de ruído e serrilhados. Não me surpreende nem um pouco que Mason tenha 35 anos no momento dessa análise e tenha vivenciado tudo isso durante sua infância.

Com essa seleção de elementos e influências, aliados à técnica naturalmente pouco fluida do stop-motion, o resultado é como uma bad trip de ácido após uma maratona de Castelo Rá-Tim-Bum, O Exterminador do Futuro e filmes do Wallace e Gromit: profundamente perturbador embora repleto de características que nos parecem familiares. Nesse sentido, o jogo com certeza cumpre o seu objetivo de gerar desconforto e chocar e as imagens são muito bem produzidas, formando um todo perfeitamente coeso que transmite o sentimento desejado de forma cirúrgica.

Por que, então, digo que não gostei do jogo? Primeiramente, porque não se extrai nada de Hylics. Não há uma mensagem, não há interpretação clara, não há nada que possa ser apreciado quando se desvia a atenção da forma e se parte para o conteúdo. E isso em um jogo que claramente tem o propósito de se vender como artístico. Com isso, o jogo acaba lembrando certas "obras de arte" pretensiosas e irritantes que tentam se vender como super profundas por serem abstratas mas que, quando avaliadas com um olho mais crítico, não significam nada e são completamente aleatórias. Veja bem, isso não se aplica a todas as obras da arte abstrata. Longe disso, afinal existiram inúmeros grandes artistas dessa escola. Entretanto, o caráter abstrato dela permite que se façam porcarias que nada tem de bom, mas que acabam causando frisson porque "e se tiverem um significado?". Hylics me evoca o mesmo sentimento.

Em segundo lugar, depois que você percebe as influências dos anos 80 e 90, o efeito do jogo fica mais fraco e chega até a parecer meio "barato". É óbvio, afinal, que você terá um resultado perturbador se misturar um monte de coisas perturbadoras que já existiam. E não se trata de uma percepção de estranheza nova, tampouco: já faz anos que a internet está repleta de pessoas revivendo vários comerciais, computações gráficas e jogos dessas décadas e destacando o quanto eles eram desconfortáveis, especialmente a partir de um ponto de vista dos dias de hoje. O terror analógico é outra demonstração desse fenômeno. Com essa percepção, o efeito novidade de Hylics se dissolve e o seu estilo como um todo perde impacto, pois percebe-se que ele, no fundo, não inova de qualquer forma relevante.

Finalmente, também não gostei do jogo por um motivo bastante simples: exatamente por ele ser desconfortável. Isso pareceria bobo se, conforme expliquei nos motivos anteriores, houvesse algum conteúdo ou alguma inovação estilística na obra. Entretanto, o desconforto todo que ela causa sai de graça e realmente fica parecendo que se trata de uma bobagem feita com o único intuito de chocar, como um adolescente rebelde e arrogante que entrega um desenho tenebroso para a professora na aula de artes do ensino médio. Isso é muito cansativo depois que já se teve algum contato com obras que fazem esse tipo de coisa e, infelizmente, acho que é o caso aqui.

Mas por que, então, eu recomendo o jogo? Porque ele é visualmente impactante e serve como uma introdução interessante para os elementos e influências que o compõem -- mas só se você tiver um interesse verdadeiro em entender essas estéticas, ou isso também não servirá de nada. Se você é mais sensível e se incomoda com esse tipo de representação perturbadora, porém, acho que nem por esses motivos a experiência vale a pena. Em suma, portanto, o jogo pode até valer a pena, mas definitivamente não é algo que será produtivo para todos.

author: {'steamid': '76561199095042754', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1698410664}
review: melancholy seethes through this game, quietly seeping its way into my skin and mind as i play it. every aspect of the game, its art direction, its music, its characters, its mechanics, specifically makes me feel like ive entered a volatile world that i have been to before in another life. and yet, i feel a deep calmness when i walk around the sullen overworld as wayne, wandering with my little ragtag band. hylics is rich and wonderfully vibrant, teeming with personality and strangeness. i spent 20 minutes alone strumming my guitar on the stage. its rough around the edges but the roughness is beautiful. this is now one of my favorite video games. im looking forward to picking up hylics 2 in the future!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039513986', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1691526857}

I hate turnbased games but this was thankfully weird, forgiving and non-tedious in such a way that I could tolerate it.
Can recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393900827', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 984, 'last_played': 1691510903}
review: Im too sober to be playing this

author: {'steamid': '76561198267446971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1702692560}
review: while this game might be short, mason lindroth's claymation world is an experience you won't forget. in a strange world whose inhabitants speak in mars volta-style gibberish -- dried the sleep of nursery slits -- our moon-headed hero wayne joins an archaeologist, an ancient knight, and his girlfriend to defeat the moon king gibby. they learn magic gestures from tv's and meet many strange monsters along the way. and if they die, they end up in the afterlife and can easily return through a portal. if you get a kick out of surrealism or listen to mars volta or just want a one-of-a-kind experience then this game is a good pick for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114653401', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1691468104}
review: It's hard to not love a game with this much personality. The OST by Mason Lindroth is fantastic and completely sells the surreal experience. You don't need a deep plot or complicated mechanics to make a good SNES-era RPG Maker game with "light jrpg mechanics", you can forgo sensible dialogue or a consistent naming convention entirely if you have immaculate presentation like Hylics does. Can't wait to play the sequel.

review:
a genuinely surreal masterpiece, hylics is strange and unique. The world feels foreign and tinged with danger, while still managing to be almost cozy. Spend some time with it, be enthralled by the style, the music, the tone. 

 If you're more mechanic-driven in your games, it might not do a lot for you, but if you're able to enjoy a game for the experience then it's definitely one you shouldn't miss.

review: It's been a while since a game has left me baffled with giddy inspiration. Everything about this blew me away, and I just completed it. What a fucking amazing experience. Genuinely one of the most creative, charming, and captivating games I've ever played. RPGs can lose my attention really fast but this one made it effortless to enjoy the world, upgrades, and battles, never straying from its clarity and always having a clear objective. This is golden and way under priced from where it should be. 3 dollars is a steal for this masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561199199654726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1691029414}
review: Everything about this game is so absurd in all the right ways and there isn't really any other game like it. All of the art and animations look extremely uncanny in a way that heavily distinguishes it from other RPG games, the music is so weird and otherworldly yet still somehow works extremely well, and basically all of the dialogue is AI-generated gibberish that is hilarious to read through. 10/10, It's something everyone should experience at least once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120418312', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 32, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1712005220}
review: Hylics is a wonderfully weird little adventure that relishes in its nonsense and literally oozes style. It's a very ooze-y style. Though it may lack polish, the clear talent and heart on display is more than enough to make up for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199378873758', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1690405855}
review:
If you came here expecting a review for Hylics, you’ve come to the wrong place. Here’s the recipe for some delicious and nutritious Double Chocolate Weed Brownies instead!

Cannabutter:
1/2 cup (113 grams) unsalted butter
1 gram quality cannabis flower

Weed brownies:
1/4 cup (21 grams) natural cocoa powder, plus more for the pan
Cannabutter (above)
1/2 cup (100 grams) chopped dark chocolate
1 1/4 cups (250 grams) granulated sugar
1 tablespoon molasses
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/4 teaspoon kosher salt
2 large eggs
3/4 cup (90 grams) all-purpose flour
1/2 cup (57 grams) chopped toasted nuts (optional)

Directions
Make the cannabutter, following the quantities listed above.
Butter an 8x8-inch pan, then dust with cocoa. Heat the oven to 350°F (177°C).
In a bain marie (or in the microwave in 10-second intervals), melt the cannabutter and dark chocolate. Remove the bowl from the heat, then add the sugar, molasses, vanilla, and salt.
Add one egg at a time, mixing well after each. Beat for about 5 minutes, until a 5-second ribbon forms on the top of the batter when you lift the whisk. Stir in the chopped nuts (if you’re using them). Sift or whisk the flour with the cocoa powder, then add to the chocolate mixture. Combine just until the flour disappears (don’t overmix).
Pour the batter into the pan and place in the center of the oven. Bake for about 25 minutes, until a glossy top forms and starts to crack. Keep an eye on the edges, they will firm up first. To check, insert a toothpick near the corner—it should have a few moist crumbs.
Let cool on a wire rack for at least 10 minutes before cutting into 16 brownies. (If you’d like—and if your pan isn’t glass—you can plunge the pan into cold water immediately out of the oven. The temperature shock achieves a chewy crust while maintaining the gooey center)
Store the brownies in an airtight container for up to a week. For longer storage, cut and freeze the brownies, then warm up in the microwave or oven before serving.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054696078', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1689539529}
review:
Short, sweet, weird and funny in its own way. At every turn you are given the resources to progress, though some parts are tricky and require outsmarting the AI. There was effectively no need to grind due to the progression design and some humorous plot contrivances. You are expected to die at some points, in fact there is a region inaccessible without dying (a few times).

Probably not for everyone, it just depends on your taste. I could see the odd, esoteric language to be off-putting to some. The obscure, difficult-to-parse dialog is part of the experience though, and I'm pretty sure some of the word choice has been deliberately ran through a thesaurus several times to make it more confusing and alien. If you enjoy things that are obtuse and unabashedly "in their own world", you will enjoy this. All the RPG elements and UI are easy enough to understand, albeit with, uh, nonstandard names for everything.

Great experience overall. Couldn't make it fullscreen though, so I'd have to take off a point or two for that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010741814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1683840926}

author: {'steamid': '76561199177544415', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1689178619}
review:
Hylics is a destructive game, a tough pill to swallow, and it's going to be my answer whenever the debate of "games as art" comes around.
 Every time that Hylics is brought up, the main topic usually becomes its surreal, colorful, and yet eerie design, the random poetic nature of the NPC's, which resembles a type of surrealist poem/game, called the "Exquisite Corpse", and the bizarre, almost hallucinogenic, aesthetic. However, the game is much more than a gorgeous piece. 
 Just as surrealism is an attack on art, Hylics is an attack on games. 
 It's not an unprecedented experience, many of its characteristics resemble some well established functions of gaming, its story is not something never before seen, and is, overall, pretty simplistic, but it's in its ordinary gameplay that lies its uniqueness. 
 The turn based system doesn't bring nothing new to the table, but it still manages to feel somewhat different and entertaining, the lack of grind is a refreshing air to the gameplay, it doesn't really impose any exploration upon you and, most of the time, it's also not very rewarding ([spoiler]Apart from recruiting the rest of the Party[/spoiler]), some of its mechanics are somewhat counter-intuitive at first, such as the death and after-life relation, which is not only penalty-free, but also is encouraged sometimes, and the stats, that are pretty much a mystery to know what each of them does, since their names don't mean nothing obvious, but are just weird substitutions for the standard RPGmaker's stats.
 All of the jesting with the gameplay mechanics brings  great insight into how video games are a form-free media, and pushes the boundaries of what modern industry gaming/art has become.
 It's indeed a recreational program more than a video game, and it's a master at that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198816881084', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1689077723}
review:
被画风吸引进来，明白机制之后战斗就变得爽快了，然后一路打通关了！
评分9/10，游戏体验是逐步上升的。
三编：写给初次接触本系列的路人朋友：Hylics是一款画面风格荒诞独特的回合制RPG游戏。2代战斗比1代难，而且不容易驯服自己的双腿，想入坑建议从1代开始。1代谜语人对话仅蕴含少量剧情；2代正常说人话延续1代剧情，且对1代人们为什么说谜语做了一定的解释。
二编：玩完Hylics2回来编辑一下，游戏内与一般npc对话看不懂没有关系，因为是剧情的原因导致对话是晦涩诗歌的形式。这种混沌的对话结合画风其实也是游戏的一种风格。
剧情，刚开始感觉不知所云，好吧其实直到结局也没明白，因为对话的英文选词好晦涩，一段话10个词要查6个词这样的晦涩，而且就算查明白了每个词的意思，拼起来也几乎没有形成可理解的含义。大概剧情也就看懂了30%，一句话总结就是你作为英雄要终结独裁者的暴政。（好在续作终于舍得说人话了，谢天谢地！）
但是不影响游玩！玩法主要是回合制RPG，看电视可以学习技能（剧情里似乎提到了电视，但是我没看懂），刚开始谁都打不过，但是死三次之后会给一个强力武器，然后就可以闯出一片天地了。完整小队一共四人，集齐第四位队友之后除了死亡雕像之外什么都不怕了。打最后boss之前要集齐三张券去小岛上学习终极技能，然后就轻轻松松了。Somsnosa超飒！
结局有点子好笑。
Hylics第2部已经出了！由平面变成了3D（2.5D？）风格。如果玩过这一作感觉还可以的话可以去看看。
