author: {'steamid': '76561198202416340', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1688596104}
review:
Hylics isn't a particularly long or in-depth experience, but its one i value regardless. The art style is obviously the main draw of this title, and what it's known for, but i found the strange, minimalistic soundtrack very evocative also when paired with the other-wordly screens and settings they accompany. Hylics might mean something - there are parts of the seemingly randomly-generated dialogue or aspects of the implied post-human environment that feel like they could be about something, but for me, the main delight of a world as strange and aesthetically interesting as that of Hylics' isn't to know the precise details of its history and lore, but instead to simply absorb its weirdness in the short time the game gives us with it. 

It was always very striking  and fascinating to me when a moment in the game, through its visuals and (heavily underrated!) soundtrack rather than dialogue or description, would communicate an emotion that felt very human despite how far Hylics feels from human. I mean, Wayne (the yellow-headed main character) and their friends play in a band, even if their music is peculiar by our standards.  Maybe it's not that deep, but that's kind of what the game means to me personally, regardless of if that's what it's actually about.

By RPG standards, Hylics is quite short, and it's not particularly expensive either, if you think it's cool to look at, I'd buy it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994729181', 'num_games_owned': 658, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1688577122}
review:
I'm not going to thumbs down a $1.50 game that's functional and has a neat art style and off kilter jams. It does that and it's obvious someone had a very specific idea and executed on it just fine.

After the vibe wears off it feels like you're listening to a drunk friend pitch a business plan for hours, the random text doesn't help. The gameplay is essentially nonexistent.

I was expecting something between Lisa and the Norwood Suite and got neither.

"Hylics is a recreational program with light JRPG elements" sums it up just fine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198980284439', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1688296327}
review:
Давно хотел опробовать эту игру, летом как раз появилось время чтобы играть в игры. Несмотря на то, что игра стоит копейки(79 рублей), я всё же решил подождать летней распродажи, чтобы сэкономить, в итоге сэкономил аж 40 рублей. Чёрт побери, это лучшая трата 40 рублей в моей жизни, они полностью окупились. Попробую вас окунуть в этот пластилиновый мир сюрреализма.

[h1] Сюжет [/h1]

Да, в этой игре как ни странно есть сюжет, хоть он и простой. А суть его в том, что главному герою - Уэйну, нужно одолеть короля луны Гибби, из-за которого якобы в игре все бессвязно говорят(да, одна из фишек игры - это рандомно генерируемые диалоги, довольно забавно). В целом это весь сюжет игры, слишком просто? Да, слишком просто, но как по мне не в сюжете вся соль игры, а в её оформлении, музыке и отчасти геймплее, речь о всех этих аспектах будет ниже.

[h1] Геймплей [/h1]

Hylics - это классическая JRPG, с тем отличием, что здесь нет системы прогрессии и враги заново не спавнятся, что делает эту игру чуточку проще для большинства игроков. На первых порах игра покажется довольно сложной, ибо одному справиться с противниками очень сложно, и вот ещё одна фишка игры: вы после смерти не откатываетесь на последнее сохранение и вас не выкидывают в главное меню, вы попадаете в так называемое "загробье", где вы можете полежать на диванчике чтобы себе всё восполнить, и перерубить в мясорубке мясо врагов, чтобы увеличить ваше максимальное количество здоровья. В общем советую найти себе напарников, и вот тогда уже можно будет фармить деньги и предметы в игре, чтобы дальше жить было проще. Кстати напарников в игре всего 3 - Dedusmuln(археолог, который интересуется пластиковыми стаканчиками, которые вам понадобятся чтобы пить воду из бойлеров, чтобы пополнить себе ману, ой, то есть "Волю"), Somsnosa(подруга главного героя, которая может без проблем раздавливать мелких жучков в игре) и Pongorma(рыцарь, который может уничтожать "бродячих черепов", противников, которые без этого напарника будут вас ваншотать). Способности в игре можно изучать взаимодействуя с телевизорами, смотреть на анимации использования этих способок кстати одно удовольствие.

[h1] Графика [/h1]

Графика выполнена в пластилиновом стиле, а разработчик оживил пластилиновых персонажей с помощью stop-motion анимации, именно графика в этой игре мне запала в душу, в особенности из-за музыки которая играет в игре, кстати о ней.

[h1] Музыка [/h1] 

Если честно, музыка в игре хоть и неплоха, но лично мне не особо запомнилась, только пару треков добавил себе в плейлист, но всё же музыка хорошо дополняет этот пластилиновый мир.

[h1] Итог [/h1]

Если вы не знаете куда потратить 79(или 39, если вы читаете этот обзор во время распродажи) рублей, потратьтесь на эту игру, не пожалеете, особенно если вам нравится жанр JRPG и/или в целом игры на рпг мейкере.

review: This game reminds me of Salvation Mountain an art project in the Californian Desert, for some reason, this is a good thing as the artwork for this game is great. Aside from that the game is very tight and its really hard to miss content, so if you like to do everything a game has to offer this game is satisfying in that regard. The fact it has no achievements is also nice, its a very chill game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089669597', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1708723809}
review:
What an amazing game! An unique use of the claymation art style and animation, coupled with surprisingly fun gameplay!

I don't usually like turn-based combat, but this game did it right and the battles were somewhat challenging, requiring me to be strategic in order to beat 'em.

Looking forward to Hylics 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561199040624429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1687798915}
review:
A fun, psychedelic rpg.
 Simple, strange and yet holding something very special.
It´s unique artistic vision, from it's gorgeous claymation
to it's captivating music, molds together in an immersive experience that 
every indie lover shouldn't let pass and pretty easy to grasp and play.
 Mystic, unique, beautiful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071550356', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1706255597}
review: This game has singlehandedly changed my life forever. Upon opening Hylics for the first time a few months back at a friend's house we were intrigued with what befell us, but far too confused to understand what was being shown to us. A few weeks after this first encounter, we decided to restart and this time it truly clicked. The artstyle. The lo-fi, forboding soundtrack, the Earthbound-esque gameplay.. I liked this game a lot! So we went on through, finding everything we could, talking to every person we could, emptying landscapes, finding every hidden imagery in sight, and looking up what the dialogue meant. This game has dialogue like no other, with a very verbose catalogue intentionally thrown your way. It is quite an enlightening journey. It may even leave you otensibly adrift.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041632113', 'num_games_owned': 1342, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1687474595}
review:
think im gettin near the end of this game, but just wanted to say its been really fun so far

the turn based rpg portion is pretty standard across the board and i have felt most fights are smooth sailing with not much preperation, aside from the beginning and a few enemies here and there.

the highlight is the art style which i'd assume was obvious to anyone lookin into hylics. its just fun to explore to look at the world, the rooms, and characters you interact with. the dialogue is nonsense but i feel like it adds to the experience of just exploring this place. im excited to wrap up this game and move on to the sequel!

review: Very strange and unique-looking little RPG. There's not much to the story, and what little there is gets buried under the NPCs' dialogue, which is mostly gibberish, and the game itself isn't particularly challenging or strategically deep, but that's not what you'll want to play this for. You want to play it for the absolutely stellar and bizarre art style and the strange atmosphere. I can honestly say I've never played a game quite like Hylics.

I very much enjoy the use of claymation too, it's absolutely one of my favorite things to see in video games and media in general. I had already bought the second game before finishing this one, and I can't wait to play it. Thank you Mr. Lindroth for the program :]

author: {'steamid': '76561199453251041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1687737733}
review: Hylics has to be the most strangest and wackiest game I have ever played! It is if you drugged Earthbound with about 50 benadryl's and dunked it in a bath of acid! You play as a weird lookin' space dude named Wayne and you set of on a journey to stop the tyrant leader of the planet! Along the way, you encounter three party members to help aid in your quest to stop the menacing "Gibby"! With strange encounters, and indecipherable lines of dialogue, there is much fun to be had! The game has no tutorial and expects you to learn on your own with no babying or anything so don't get turned off if you find it to hard, you will learn with the dialogue you share between the NPC's of the world and interactions you have! It is a very unique game and it is a joy to play, I highly recommend you pick up this masterpiece!

review: It's a visceral homunculus life sim in clay. It's a simple rpg at it's core. the music blends everything you're looking at together well, even if it's grating. I got the feeling that everything being clay and meat looking is how a homunculus creature recognizes the world. try drawing any of the environments from memory with all it's lumps and bumps. Sick visuals!

review: This was probably the weirdest 4 hours I've ever spent. I don't regret any of it, but dear god, I am very confused. Combat isn't the most unique thing, but the art, story (which is more like an acid trip than anything coherent), and overall feel more than make up for it. Would recommend to anyone looking for a unique hidden gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198364354205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1685237701}
review:
It's such a unique surreal game, unfortunately the game often focuses too much on it's rpg maker default combat, when what makes it shine really is the art style and world exploration. If we are going for such experimental storytelling and visuals, why not apply the same for the combat mechanic? Or just go all out and drop combat completely...
Some other rpg maker games don't even have combat (to the moon, one shot...) I have no explanation for why this game went for it. Maybe it was trying to be subversive on it's rpg turn based adventure idea, It kind of works, but judging by how far it went into it's nonsensical surreal ambitions, i'm not sure if making a coment on it's game conventions should be the focuse here...

It's still just so damn unique, i cant help but recommend it (it's also so short, almost like a movie, which i think is great for this type of game)

author: {'steamid': '76561198009810921', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1684718677}
review:
Hylics is very intentionally very weird. That much is obvious from first glance. The admittedly overused random text generation had me unconsciously avoiding NPCs as well as completely unable to stop myself from trying to squeeze meaning out of what I knew were an arbitrary arrangement of words. Their goal accomplished, I suspect.

Despite being just as irrationally designed, I did find the characters endearing. They instantly grew on me. Which is good, because that's about all the time they had to do so. I don't think I could tell you anything real about them either. That, again, did appear to be the aim. 

The “light JRPG elements” were equally inscrutable. A number of stats didn't seem to have any effect on anything. Was 'Cooking' cut content, did it have some effect on combat I didn't notice, or was it just another random word in a random place? I'll never know and I doubt I'll ever know how I feel about that. 

What I do know is that I enjoyed wandering around this little bite-sized world. Exploration was probably the only part of this game that followed a logical progression... even if the individual pieces scattered about it didn't exactly act in expected ways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272119564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1674363637}
review:
Before I give my review I just have to get this off my chest. I'm not necessarily the biggest turn based RPG fan. I don't hate the genre but I often find myself dropping them way more often than I'd like to admit. I get bored by the combat or find it repetitive in most cases. With that being said, I absolutely love Hylics.

Hylics is a turned based RPG with claymation graphics and an early computer game feel. It's very surreal with it's visual style and even gameplay mechanics. It takes around 3 hours to complete but I decided to try and get the most of the game and it took me about 5 hours. It's been a while since I last played the game so I apologize for some details not feeling as if they are fleshed out.

The only thing that I found very annoying with this game was its controls. When I first started playing this game I started it on my desktop. I have a 60% keyboard but the game only uses the arrow keys when it comes to movement. I could use the FN key so I can use my arrow keys on different keys but I decided not to because it's a little annoying since to use anything else I need to stop using the FN key. In a menu you could change the controls yet it's not within the game itself, it's within a command menu within the engine. I just played this game on my laptop one day while at my parents, my laptop has arrow keys so that was settled. I think that a menu within the game where you could just change the overall controls would have been nice. I get that it's to make it feel like an older computer game but still this modern inclusion would have been nice.

I'm not gonna even try to figure out this story's overall deep meaning but I can try to give a rough explanation of what happens. In short, you play as Wayne and you go and collect other people in your party. You kill a bunch of guys to get more powerful and then you face off this guy then you win. I am still trying to keep a little secretive so you can see how surreal this game is but still that's the best way I can describe it.

Now in more detail there is more to the story, but the dialog from the NPCs and the text you read is very mysterious and (again) surreal. I think that there is something deeper in here and I don't think it's mysterious for the sake of just being different. Everything else in this game is very detailed in how it presents its tone so I guess just give a YouTube deep dive a watch (Which is something I should do also) if you want to understand the story. I know it's a little lazy to just say that and not try and understand the story myself but if you play the game you know what I mean.

When I first started my journey with Wayne when I walked to a TV and learned a new move. I then walked into a town, I looked around then touched a big floating gem. I walked into a new area and died instantly from some enemy, I did not stand a chance at all. I got ascended into some heavenly dimension and saw a meat grinder which said I could get powerful if I gave it meat. I saw the same gem from before, I hit it and went into a big portal that took me back to the town...... also I got a frozen burrito.

So much was put onto me, the weird yet interesting designs of the characters that were clearly toys that had clay molds attached to them. Every time I attacked these big white hands would appear to make a symbol before a funny noise would happen and the attack landed. The music was as chill yet very grainy and jagged, it was messy yet it fit the world so much and I couldn't help but love it. The world of Hylics feels so unique and I loved everything about the style and designs of the world and sounds. It reminded me a bit of Earthbound and The Neverhood.

I eventually got another party member and killed my first guy. I got meat from it along with some other items. I eventually died but then after going to the heavenly dimension again I grinded the meat and both my party members were now stronger. With this, getting more party members and activating more gems this is your gameplay loop. 

Also when you kill someone they stay dead. Instead of grinding for power you must cherish it once you get it. I made a mistake though, when I killed every enemy in the game then went back to get the last party member he was VERY under powered since I use all my meat on everyone else. I like this because the power of your members is from your actions instead of grinding useless enemies. Instead of it having this artificial way of feeling like you are growing where your character is stronger but the enemies also grow in strength Hylics enemies stay the same in all areas. You getting the meat and grinding it for power makes you really feel like you're growing as a team. Enemies that were very hard to fight turn manageable then turn laughably easy. Then new enemies in areas that weren't available before are now at a bigger strength level. Do you want to use your meat to get on their level or do you think you want to power through them with careful usage of your items and abilities? That's why I like this system, instead of mindless menus to go through to pick the attack with the bigger number or pick the attack that is essentially scissors to the enemy's paper Hylics abilities and attacks from both enemies and the player makes me feel like I actually have to think about my next actions.

I know this review doesn't feel like a review but just me gossiping about this game I love. But that is exactly it. I don't feel as if I should explain what makes Hylics good in this review. It's hard. That's why all I can say is if the game's style looks cool to you then play it, if you're on the fence then again play it. I think this is such a unique game with it's style that I think even if you don't think you'll like it you should try it out. Since I can't really give you a good review, then find out yourself why I and so many other fell in love with this game.

Look, I'm just gonna leave this review with this. A frozen burrito can be used as a weapon within combat, BUT if you microwave the burrito then it can be used as health. This is a real mechanic in the game. Why?... Hylics.

review:
Clay

EDIT: This is nearly my favorite game of all time. The soundtracks, the abstract clay art, character design, abuse of random adjective generator, they are all mixed together like the ingredients of a cake and make this wonderful, peaceful, calming, masterpiece. Ruins, my favorite track in Hylics, reminds me of a time when I was younger, but I can't call back to exactly when it was. That, and the abstract clay art, just remind me of myself, like the game was meant for me somehow. The fanart of Soms is questionable though. (11/18/2023, 12:53 PM)

review: "Surrealist Claymation RPG maker game" would probably be the easiest way to describe it but, like a frozen burito, you'll have to manifest "jelly" in the mirror to really palpitate. This game uses all the right words and the whole game feels like you're dreaming that you and your friends are on a quest to get kebab at 2:30 AM while buzzed. In a good way. Just let the cool characters take you along through their pastel world, enjoy the afterlife's open-door policy, try to decipher the randomized dialogue and as always, kill Giby.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067505253', 'num_games_owned': 1754, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1686682836}
review:
A Surreal and Enigmatic Masterpiece - Hylics Review

Rating: ★★★★★

Hylics, a surreal and unconventional indie RPG, is a mesmerizing experience that defies traditional gaming norms. With its unique claymation visuals, experimental gameplay mechanics, and cryptic narrative, it stands as a truly remarkable and unforgettable work of art.

From the moment you enter the strange and abstract world of Hylics, you are immersed in a visually stunning realm crafted entirely out of clay. The handcrafted characters, environments, and animations create an otherworldly atmosphere that is simultaneously eerie and beautiful. The game's dreamlike aesthetic, combined with a hauntingly atmospheric soundtrack, draws you into its bizarre and captivating universe.

The gameplay in Hylics is equally unconventional. It blends traditional RPG elements with innovative mechanics, offering a range of strange abilities and powers to uncover and utilize. The combat system, although simplistic in nature, is engaging and strategic, requiring players to experiment and discover the most effective ways to defeat bizarre enemies and bosses.

The true brilliance of Hylics lies in its enigmatic and abstract storytelling. The game presents a fragmented narrative that unfolds through cryptic dialogue, symbolic imagery, and unconventional storytelling techniques. The lack of explicit explanations and the reliance on player interpretation add to the game's mystique, inviting you to delve deep into its layers of meaning and symbolism.

Hylics is a game that embraces the concept of player agency and exploration. It encourages you to experiment, interact with the environment, and unravel its secrets at your own pace. The open-ended nature of the game allows for creative problem-solving and encourages players to think outside the box, leading to moments of discovery and awe.

While Hylics is a masterpiece in its own right, it may not be for everyone. Its surreal and abstract nature may not appeal to those seeking a straightforward or traditional gaming experience. The absence of clear objectives and the unconventional narrative structure may leave some players feeling disoriented or perplexed. However, for those who appreciate artistry, experimentation, and a willingness to embrace the unconventional, Hylics offers a one-of-a-kind journey into the depths of imagination.

In conclusion, Hylics is a mesmerizing and thought-provoking game that pushes the boundaries of what is considered normal in the gaming world. Its claymation visuals, experimental gameplay mechanics, and cryptic narrative create an immersive and unforgettable experience. If you are ready to embark on a surreal and introspective adventure that challenges your perception of gaming, Hylics is an absolute must-play that will leave an indelible mark on your gaming journey.

author: {'steamid': '76561198324293051', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1683315494}
review:
Пэкмэн на максималках но в стиле неверьвхудо

По игровке напоминает undertale, omori, earthbound, хотя по сути все они это JRPG, просто в разной обёртке в качестве атмосферы или музыки и о боже как же атмосфера из Hylics хороша.

Узнал я об этой игре пока медиашерил и случайно наткнулся на треки второй части. Я слушаю саунд от сюда уже больше год где бы не находился. Не каждый день как сумасшедший, но зайдя в душ и поставив на репит "That's a Big Stick" меня наполняет серотонин, абстрактная решимость и эстетика. Пусть уже и не от того что я eбaшу пластилиновых демонов бананами. В голове проскакивает кровавый вечерний пляж, мотылёк пролетающий напротив мясного дивана на фоне сюрриалистичных строений аля обложки молчат дома, но ещё раз в 10 страннее

Не знаю насчёт автора, но ещё причина по которой я обожаю эту игру моя лёгкая объектофилия. Простые предметы быта такие как бутылочка шампуня, хотдог, пластиковый стакан или банан порой выглядят очень уютно и волшебно. Хочу как нибудь пройти вторую часть, а потом запилить сюда русификатор.

Очень жаль что игра не сыскала популярности из за сюрриалистичности, тупорылое большинство казуалов... Пусть здесь и присутствуют абстрактные длинные фразеологизмы в диалогах которые только написать в переводчик заёбешься НО ПРИ ЭТОМ это не обязательно ибо почти не продвигает сюжет. Он к слову наипримитивнейший: вот злодей, мы его остановим. А что бы играть нужно бродить, открывать проходы в новые локации, лутаться да научиться накладывать безмолвие на крипов. Всё. Если у вас нет шизофрении и эпилепсии я максимально в недоумении почему вы ДО СИХ ПОР НЕ ПРОШЛИ ЭТУ ИГРУ ВСЕГО ЛИШЬ ЗА 80 РУБЛЕЙ? 

Разве лучше донатить эгоистичным трипл-эй компаниям которые на протяжении годов с минимальными усилиями разрабатывают игры для выкачивания денег нежели поддержать проект ИНДИ-разработчика который ощущается как свежий глоток воздуха дак ещё и зону комфорту расширит. Этот человек в одиночку написал музыку, запарился над графикой, стилем, анимациями, кодом игры и в итоге об этой игре никто не знает. Глупые казуалы, поиграли бы вы в квесты 90-ых!

author: {'steamid': '76561198378045628', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1687364799}
review: Загляните прямо в разум автора игры, почувствуйте нефильтрованный поток его фантазий и креативности. Отбросьте излишние размышления и не задавайте много вопросов, ибо ответов на них вы не получите. Расслабьтесь и окунитесь с головой в игру, которая запутает вас ровно настолько, насколько вы захотите, чтобы она вас запутала. Всё это в одном флаконе простого для освоения геймплея игры на RPG maker'е.

author: {'steamid': '76561199489380523', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1685377973}
review:
Hylics, assolutamente geniale.
10 e lode, se solo avessi scoperto questa gemma nascosta anni fa, lo avrei messo istantaneamente al primo posto nella mia lista di RPG.

Parliamo di Hylics, un gioco che può sembrare noioso (poiché RPG a turni) ma che nasconde tantissime qualità che non dovrebbero essere ignorate!
Partiamo dagli effetti visivi, sono stupendi, nessuna obiezione, ogni animazione è fancy.
La storyline è al di sopra dell'assurdo, gli NPC scritti con un random text generator è un tocco di classe.
Per quanto sia complesso il vocabolario utilizzato, la storia rimane godibile e lineare.
Parlando dei nemici o dei boss, davvero, per quanto mi sono rimasti in presso ve li saprei dire a memoria uno per uno. Ditemi se non è questo quello che dovrebbe causare un gioco.

Le OST, impeccabili ad essere buffe, ciò che mi colpisce è proprio come sono state composte, fatte da una persona inesperta, che probabilmente ha dato tutto se stesso per comporle.
Sono stato cosi colpito dalle colonne sonore che mi sono ritrovato ad ascoltarle anche dopo aver finito la mia prima partita.

Insomma, un giocone, l'ho finito al 100% e tentato una speedrun, ci rigiocherò per nostalgia in futuro.
Ora tocca ad Hylics 2.

Se dovessi dare un voto ad Hylics, sarebbe: 10/10

review: Hylics is a tough pill to swallow. The art is bizarre and psychodelic but also very memorable, the story... Well I can't say I understood any of it, if there even was one to begin with. The game is more of and experience as the creator says, and it is quite a strange one at that. I don't really know what to say about this, if you would like to have a few hours of a game that looks like this just because, this is it, if you are searching a game, this is not it.

review:
This is game is unlike anything I've played before. The art style, soundtrack and gameplay are unique and incredibly entertaining! Even the fact that the game sort of encourages you to die, is somehow fascinating to me. All the little puzzles, silly looking characters and simple, yet interesting plot, make this game worthwhile.
Easily one of the best games I've encountered!

review: Mn o jogo e curto, e mais uma esperiecia completamete estranha e doida, sao as horas mais estranhas da sua vida, mas vale a pena, pq a experiencia de jogar essa merda bizarra e surrealista, q o narrador com ctz recém saiu do manicomio, e o criador fumou mta verinha, mas admito, é um jogo otimo e uma experiencia indescritivel e surreal, estranha, mas surreal, bom apesar e seus defeitos, eu recomendo pra qualquer um ter a experiencia bizarra e boa de jogar hylics ( tbm gostei da gameplay em si, nn é tao boa qnt a de undertale, mas eu gostei, as animaçoes dos ataques sao incriveis, maconhadas e satisfatorias ).

author: {'steamid': '76561198354706503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1680216417}
review:
[Pt-br : En] Review.

 Hylics é uma viajem subjetiva por uma dimensão feita de massinha de modelar, criatividade e imaginação. Esse jogo fez meu amor por jogos de turno reascender em meu coração, digo isso por que jogos de turno acabaram se tornando cansativos pra mim, na maioria dos rpgs de turno sei perfeitamente o que esperar, quais os efeitos que uma magia de fogo vai gerar na tela, ou ao usar uma poção de cura o efeito visual que a mesma terá não  vai divergir muito de um jogo pra jogo, o que torna os combates repetitivos e monótonos e basicamente os mesmo, fazendo com que eu jogue certos rpgs somente pela história e personagens, e desse pouco valor ao gameplay. Eu já tinha Hylics na minha biblioteca por que gostei muito de tudo que vi no trailer do jogo, mas como disse, rpgs de turno geralmente saturam, mas oh mama mia, mama mia, mama mia, let me go Beelzebub has a devil put aside for me e o nome desse devil é Wayne. Esse jogo realmente é uma viagem visual e auditiva, se apoia muito pouco em texto, e muito em sua apresentação visual, e nunca deixa de ser compreensivo com o jogador, a morte não tem punição, você volta para um tipo de santuário onde pode transformar Meat pega ao derrotar inimigos em pontos de vida através de uma maquina, aqui você também irá encontrar cristais que servem como mecanismos de teletransporte para vários locais do jogo, ou seja se você morreu só lembrar da cor do cristal mais próximo do local onde deseja ir, ativar e entrar pelo portal, easy. O combate é muito satisfatório e as animações são esplêndidas nunca me canso de vê-las o modelos dos inimigos são muito surreais assim como os backgrounds e o mundo no geral, esse jogo fez eu ter fome de explorar, de ver cada sala, e de lutar com cada novo inimigo, obter suas magias e o mais legal, me deu vontade de usar cada um dos itens que eu peguei e ver que animação esse item especifico iria gerar na tela, um dos meus itens favoritos é a Dinamite. Hylics é uma aventura incrível e um jogo excelente, não consigo listar defeitos por que não foi com esses olhos que tentei me aprofundar na experiencia que esse jogo me apresentou, é um rpg de turnos surrealista que custa o valor de um salgado, não um triple AAA que é tipo um terço do meu salário e normalmente me promete algo que não entrega e me deixa triste, a esses eu ao meu ver cabe a crítica. Esse jogo foi uma experiencia surpreendente, simples e que vai morar no meu coração pelos anos que virão. 

En-

This game is a subjective journey through a dimension made of modeling clay, creativity and imagination. This game made my love for turn-based games reignite in my heart. I say this because turn-based games ended up becoming tiresome for me, in most turn-based rpgs I know perfectly well what to expect, what effects a fire spell will generate on the screen, or when using a healing potion the visual effect of it will not differ much from one game to another, which makes the combats repetitive and monotonous and basically the same, making me play certain rpgs just for the story and characters, and gave little value to the gameplay. I already had Hylics in my library because i really liked everything I saw in the game trailer, but like I said, turn rpgs usually saturate, but oh mama mia, mama mia, mama mia, let me go Beelzebub has a hell of a side for me and that devil's name is Wayne. This game really is a visual and auditory journey, it relies very little on text and a lot on its visual presentation, and it never fails to be understanding with the player, death has no punishment, you go back to a kind of sanctuary where you can transform Meat picks up when defeating enemies in life points through a machine, here you will also find crystals that serve as an exchange for teleportation to various places in the game, that is, if you died just remember the color of the crystal closest to the place where you want to go , activate and enter the portal, easy. The combat is very satisfactory and the animations are splendid I never get tired of watching them or the enemy models, they are very surreal as well as the backgrounds and the world in general, this game made me hungry to explore, to see each room, and from fighting each new enemy, getting new spells is the coolest thing, the game made me want to use each of the items i picked up and see what animation that specific item would generate on the screen, one of my favorite items is the Dynamite. Hylics is an incredible adventure and an excellent game i can't list any flaws because it wasn't with those eyes that i tried to delve into the experience that this game presented me with, it's a surrealistic turn-based rpg that costs the value of a vegetable, not a triple AAA, which is like a third of my salary and usually promises me something that doesn't deliver and makes me sad, I think these ones deserve the criticism. This game was an amazing and simple experience that will live in my heart for years to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561199004802297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1680205291}
review:
Hylics é uma experiência imersiva em um mundo de lógica própria, estética psicodélica e leves elementos de JRPG. O sistema de batalhas é simples, e não deve agradar às pessoas que chegam a este título buscando um JRPG complexo com mecânicas inovadoras. Pelo contrário, a simplicidade no sistema de jogo serve para não desviar o foco da surrealidade, dos diálogos non-sense e da estética criada com stop-motion, tudo atuando em consonância para tirar quem joga do planeta Terra por algumas horas e levar para uma realidade totalmente diferente de tudo. Ademais, as personagens da equipe são altamente cativantes, seja pela sucessão do Rei da Lua Gibby pelo protagonista Wayne (uma progressão das fases da lua?), seja pela misteriosa existência extra-planar de Somsnosa, o Cavaleiro do Terror Pongorma que se junta a você após séculos de exílio ou Dedusmuln, arqueologista de gênero não-binário que estuda artefatos da humanidade extinta como o copo de papel.

As seis horas que passei no mundo de Hylics foram o bastante para me obcecar pelo título, e comprar o segundo antes mesmo de saber se meu computador o rodaria. Por sorte, rodou!

author: {'steamid': '76561198981682683', 'num_games_owned': 16, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1679523275}
review:
краще що я купляла за 30 грн 

/плюси:
+ цікаві візуальні рішення - креативні анімації атак, персонажі; в деякі локації хотілось повертатись знову і знову просто щоб покраще їх роздивитись 
+ гра невибаглива, мій нещасний ноутбук потягнув
+ доступна ціна
+ саундтрек
+ сюр

/мінуси:
- місцями забагована але не критично, в більшості випадків допомагає перезапуск
- управління (хоча тут кому як)
- іноді неочевидно що робити (не забувайте вирішити головоломку перед дверима, не будьте як я)

/підводні камені:
українська мова відсутня, українізатора наскільки я знаю не існує. навіть з досить непоганим рівнем англійської доводилось гуглити деякі слова.. впринципі це несуттєво, тому що більшість діалогів у грі згенеровані рандомно і не несуть смислового навантаження (проте звучать красиво). не стала виносити це в мінус бо мені особисто було прикольно дізнаватись нове :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198068444897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1679670849}
review:
友人おすすめのゲームなので遊んでみました。

有志の方の日本語化MODを導入させて頂きましたが、日本語訳にされても意味がわからない。きちんと意味がわかる箇所があるので翻訳ミスとかではないらしい。詩的というには意味不明過ぎる奇怪なセリフを話すキャラクターが多く、まともなこと喋ってるキャラクターに会うと安心します。3時間ほどでクリアしましたが、このゲームが一体何なのか説明できない。「考えるな感じろ」を地でいく雰囲気ゲーム。

ただこの手の謎ゲーにありがちな不親切＆無駄に高難易度ということはなく、最初とラスボスに少し手こずるかなという程度。長さも一気に遊べるくらいなのが良いですね。値段も手頃ですし、ちょっと変な雰囲気のゲームをやりたい人にはおすすめします。

author: {'steamid': '76561198036691001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1691383131}

author: {'steamid': '76561197982225800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 319, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1679177836}
review:
I get it. It's a "surreal" experience first, with some RPG elements that happen to be layered on top, so I should be approaching it more as a walking simulator than anything else.

However, I can't play it because I have a phobia of 99% of RPG Maker games. I've played so many of them that even with a neat coat of paint like this game has, all RPG Maker games fundamentally feel the same to me, with their tileset-based overworld and their samey turn-based combat engine.

I may check out Hylics 2, but this is a skip for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083748092', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1678565184}
review:
A primera vista es un juego muy extraño donde controlas a un personaje con lunar y tienes que ir juntando objetos. Con mas profundidad te das cuenta que eres un personaje con cuernos y tienes que ir juntando objetos junto a compañeros de equipo... Para luchar con diferentes seres en un mundo unico, de mas surrealista.

La historia, bueno, no tiene comienzo ni fin, es una aventura donde te preguntaras ¿Que? cada 5 minutos, el sistema de batallas esta muy bien echo.

Si te gusta earthbound/ mother 2 este juego será 100% para ti.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155978227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1677199056}
review:
Sem dúvida esse jogo foram os 6,29 mais bem gastos em um jogo. Hylics me prendeu demais, principalmente pelo combate do jogo e pelo estilo visual. 
A impressão que eu tinha antes de jogar ele, era de que ele ia me dar dor de cabeça por conta do estilo gráfico dele, mas jogando tive a experiência oposta disso, é um jogo extremamente gostoso de jogar, a trilha sonora é incrivelmente boa, sinto como se eu tivesse dentro de um albúm do Pink Floyd, são bem relaxantes. A exploração dentro do jogo é ótima, sempre te recompensando com itens escondidos. Eu diria que ele tem uma proposta bem peculiar, diferente, tenta ser um jogo com uma experiência surrealista, e de fato consegue bem demais isso. Quanto a história do jogo, não é um ponto central nem forte dele, inclusive é bem curtinho, e mesmo assim, gostei demais de cada um dos personagens e de como cada um acaba tendo sua utilidade/função durante as batalhas em turno, batalhas essas que são extremamente desafiadoras e acredito que nesse quesito sim, é um grande ponto forte do jogo. Admito que virei fã e com certeza vou jogar o segundo jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198377716275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1677184826}
review:
bizarrisimo.
Tiene pistas de tener una historia pero son poco claras, solo seguís a Wayne en su "misión". (supongo que esto es a propósito, ya que es una historia bastante absurda, que me recuerda ligeramente a ENA) y hay bastantes momentos chistosos y sin sentido pero en un buen sentido.

Hablando del gameplay, es estrictamente un RPG por turnos, aunque también tiene bastantes puzzles.
Me parece uno de los mejores debido a que esta muy bien balanceado, y pese a que si hay que grindear de vez en cuando, para mi esto no llega a ser tan molesto como en otros juegos, porque es una manera de hacer el resto del juego mucho mas fácil en vez de tener que hacerlo estrictamente para avanzar, pero fácil hasta cierto punto, ya que ciertos enemigos o jefes te obligaran a pensar de manera estratégica.

Claramente lo que mas resalta del juego es su estilo de arte, siendo este una mezcla entre claymation, live action y animación la cual transmite nostalgia con una pizca de suspenso, igual que los diálogos que están escritos usando palabras complejas que a veces hacen parecer que los personajes saben algo que vos no, pero al final se entiende todo esto como el estilo.
me gusto bastante 8/10 👍

author: {'steamid': '76561198804293525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1677007745}
review:
Foi surreal a experiencia, a aventura com o Wayne e seus amigos foi muito divertida.  A exploração das ilhas é a melhor parte do jogo, sem dúvida.
Mesmo o tendo uma duração curta ele oferece muito conteúdo, eu consegui prolongar 5 horas sem problema algum, os personagens são cativantes demais, principalmente a Somnsnosa. 
Pontos que eu mais gostei: A história não faz o menor sentido, a boss fight do Gibo foi difícil pra CARALHO, trilha sonora e o visual dos personagens e NPCS foram bem criativos e alguns dão realmente medo.

É um dos meus jogos favoritos, comprem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279447370', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1676747914}
review: This game is just what the doctor ordered. It's hard to put into words, but if I had to say something about its genre, I'd say surreal/abstract. It's fairly short, so it doesn't overstay its welcome and at 3 dollars, it's well worth the purchase. The controls when walking can be a bit janked (knowing where corners are for example), but that's a small issue for an otherwise solid indie product. The fact that one person can make something this strange while AAA devs can't make anything halfway interesting or decent with six figure budgets is absurd to me. Then again, life itself is absurd. If you're in the mood for something quirky, strange, and way off the beaten path, you've gotta get yourself some Hylics. I'm about to grab the sequel myself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289877733', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1689976439}

author: {'steamid': '76561198267992624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1702360649}
review:
Simplesmente amei o jogo, posso dizer que entrou pro meu top 5 de jogos favoritos. A arte do jogo é incrível, a ost maravilhosa (algumas me causam até sensação de nostalgia, eu amo isso) e os personagens também são ótimos e até bem desenvolvidos mesmo não ocorrendo muito diálogo entre eles. Porém não posso dizer o mesmo da jogabilidade, algumas batalhas com monstros do mapa se tornam extremamente difíceis, principalmente no início do jogo quando temos apenas um personagem pra lutar com 2, 3 ou até 4 monstros; na batalha contra o Gibby, precisei voltar aos antigos mapas para matar todos os monstros e assim receber mais "meat" pra aumentar meu hp (que anteriormente não passava de 200) e isso foi bem cansativo. Também gostaria de sugerir que fizessem uma tradução para outros idiomas como português brasileiro, eu entendo inglês mas alguns diálogos foram um pouco difíceis de compreender pois haviam muitas palavras que eu não conhecia direito.
Enfim, o jogo é incrível, realmente recomendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279829067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1676151292}
review: This game took some time for me to get used to, but I would say it is one of my favorite games I've played in a while. Usually games made in "basic" rpgmaker manners like this have a bad rep, are written off because the gameplay gets stale. Hylic's gameplay is actually very fun for being what you could call "basic", and it's short enough to where it doesn't get stale. The visuals are what most people talk about and for a good reason, this game is art, quite literally. I even found myself 100%ing it BY ACCIDENT. It's hard at first but get's easier as you get more powerful, and you can sometimes get lost. Luckily that's circumvented by making dying something you want to do, returning you to a cozy hubworld with fast travel. I really appreciate that you can only increase your HP by killing enemies, not gaining XP of any kind. It's centered around equipable items which I find way more appealing and gets rid of grind. The music is weird but you find yourself grooving out to it heavily. Short and sweet is a good way to describe Hylics.

review: Always love a good RPG maker game (hyperfixation moment) and Hylics did not disappoint. review: You know that feeling in the early 90's when you fall asleep on the couch with the TV on Cartoon Network or MTV and wake up at an ungodly hour of the night to see something weird, nonsensical and somewhat unsettling on the same channel? This game is pretty much that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016756547', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1675652691}
review:
Underneath its striking claymation aesthetic, Hylics is a remarkably bare game. Like other RPG maker titles, combat is unexciting, and enemies tend to spam obnoxious moves that inflict status effects on you. This clumsy form of difficulty is gone the moment you acquire equipment making you immune to said effects, which is very early on. Fleeing from fights is also poorly handled as overworld enemies can trap you on the map, forcing you to fight them again. 

If you absolutely love the artstyle, give it a go but know that the game is roughly 4 hours in length. If you're curious about the story, just watch a playthrough.

review:
Ya lo habia jugado hace rato, queria revivir la secuencia. Una experiencia super unica a nivel artistico. No esperen algo limado ni mecanicas raras, hay 10 items locos y 5 equipamientos. Lo di vuelta en 4 horas y media, y bastante tranquilo la verdad. 

Arrancas no entendiendo nada, al rato seguis sin entender nada y para cuando terminas, entendes menos. Me encantó

author: {'steamid': '76561198252904253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1675181867}
review:
Esse jogo é uma experiência. Se quiser jogá-lo, vá de peito aberto e não queira muitas explicações. Fui com um pensamento fechado na primeira vez que joguei e não gostei, só pude apreciá-lo mudando minha cabeça, anos depois. Se busca um RPG pé no chão, esse jogo não é pra você, pois ele é justamente para te tirar do seu eixo.

O jogo conta com uma gameplay simples, ele é basicamente com RPG comum. Porém, ele tem a grande diferença de não possuir níveis: as melhorias dos personagens são obtidas por meio de itens, equips e por certas mecânicas do jogo. As diferentes habilidades são dadas por meio de TVs que vivem espalhadas pelo mundo do jogo, e são compartilhadas por todos os personagens. Isso é interessante em primeira vista, mas se torna chato ter de passar por todas as TVs toda vez que se consegue um novo personagem. Isso é amenizado com teleportes próximos a maioria delas. Uma outra mecânica interessante é a de aumentar o HP, que é feita colocando certos itens que dropam dos inimigos por um objeto que fica no Afterlife do jogo, podendo ser acessado só quando o player morre. Para evoluir, você é obrigado a perder! O sistema de aumentar MP também é feito com itens que você encontra sendo gastos em certos pontos especiais do mapa.
As batalhas são normais, os inimigos contam com todos os ataques padrões que geralmente existem em JRPGS. O que causa interesse é a estética extremamente surreal dos inimigos e as diferentes habilidades obtidas pelos personagens, que contam com um aspecto fundamental do jogo, a imprevisibilidade.
E os mapas, meu Deus, são de tirar o fôlego. São extremamente belos e surrealistas, mesmo aqueles mais vazios em interações possuem um visual arrebatador. As interações de Hylics são em grande parte feitas por meio de um gerador de texto aleatório, que cria frases sem sentido, ajudando na atmosfera. 

A história, bem, é quase nula. O jogo não te dá um sentido a seguir ou mesmo uma explicação do que ocorre durante a gameplay, você só supõe os lugares que deve seguir e vai seguindo. Isso pode parecer horrível para alguns, porém, pra mim isso combina com o resto. Além disso, não é tão difícil saber para onde ir, visto os caminhos limitados e a estrutura que segue a de um RPG padrão.

A experiência do jogo como um todo é mágica. É extremamente belo, suas músicas são ao mesmo tempo caóticas e pacíficas, e os cenários que constrói são fantásticos, e por vezes, bizarros. Mesmo sem uma narrativa, ele cria interesse a partir da simples vontade do jogador de ver mais desse mundo místico e onde que ele vai acabar. Uma narrativa de qualquer forma seria no mínimo desnecessária e no pior um empecilho pra isso que é o principal carisma do jogo, o non-sense.

Eu poderia dizer que esse jogo é um RPG comum só que sobre efeito de muita droga e um pouco de loucura que eu não ia estar errado, mas acho que ele vai além. Hylics é uma palavra que provém do grego e dentro da crença gnóstica é a pura matéria, sem alma. Hylics se mostra seguindo essa definição, sendo composto de belos cenários para os olhos que não possuem significado aparente por trás. Mas mesmo assim, o que eu senti com esse jogo foi uma experiência estranhamente espiritual; foi como ir a outro plano e depois voltar. É um jogo que possui suas falhas, mas que tentou e conseguiu fazer uma proposta bastante diferente dentro do mundo dos videogames. Recomendo a todos que tenham lido até aqui e que gostem de uma experiência diferente.

author: {'steamid': '76561199018691217', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1675710414}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078403549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 581, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1675438823}
review:
Hylics is one of few games which is more enjoyable when you watch someone else play rather playing it yourself. Hylics has amazing distinctive surreal art style and fairly good OST, but everything else is disappointing. For instance,
- The story barely exist with weak world building
- One dimensional character
- The combat has few interesting mechanic, but overall it's unbalanced and i find few enemy really annoying
- Decent amount grinding/exploration is needed or you won't able to beat the final boss.

I can't believe Hylics has 97%/Overwhelmingly Positive review when it has dull quality, even by RPGMaker standard. If you're looking for surreal game, consider Mothlight, Yume Nikki or Hello Charlotte instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005856238', 'num_games_owned': 1349, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1674095463}
review: A true gem of an RPG in the disguise of a bizarre and abstract world made of clay. The only downside to playing it is that you're going to have to use your arrow keys and Z/C - all my attempts to get this to work with a controller have not proven fruitful. It is worth it though, as you will find a solid few hours of fun starting out throwing cold burritos at coneheaded cultists with a new water cooler obsessed friend and graduating to exploring tunnels, warp facilities, tombs, and even the moon. There's a lot of goofy charm and playful gore in the art made even more soulful from the crunching into old-style pixelization. Battles aren't tedious if you search around for everything at your disposal and even death rewards you (there will be times you find yourself over your head, trust me.) If you love RPGs buy and play this at your earliest convenience, you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198431813628', 'num_games_owned': 17, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1687466936}

author: {'steamid': '76561198891086990', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1675302945}
review:
Hylics is an absolutely otherworldly experience, or that's at least the best way I can describe it, because the whole game feels just indescribable. However I say all of these things in a complimentary way. Hylics is an RPG Maker turn-based RPG, with a visual style that I've never seen utilized in a game before, or ever again since its release. The game has a surreal claymation art style that makes for a multitude of memorable scenes and moments from the game. Many of these moments feature imagery that's hard to decipher and/or understand, but somehow for some reason, I just can't take my gaze away from it. I'd say the games visuals is it's best component. But the game does other things incredibly well also. The game's combat system, although basic and nothing new, works well enough, feels fairly balanced, has great backgrounds, as well as beautifully animated battle animations, and creative enemy designs. The game also has a great soundtrack, with most of the game's soundtrack featuring a guitar as a reoccurring instrument. The soundtrack overall has a very mellow and calm feel, even for many of the battle soundtracks. The type of music usually ranges from relaxing, to eerie, and that's about it. But with the way everything in the game is animated and flowing, the consistent music type makes sense and fits quite effectively into this quirky world. As far as the story goes (I won't be spoiling it here, not like I can really explain the story anyway), it's really hard to rate, it more so seems like an element that is rated subjectively. Most of the game feels pretty linear, with plenty of optional hidden content, but there isn't much of a story to explain what's really going on, nor is there much mandatory dialogue in general. Pretty much all of the NPCs you interact with in the game seem to speak in riddles and metaphors that don't really make much sense (or at least to me). It doesn't help that their dialogue randomizes every time you talk to them anyway. You rarely even really interact with your fellow party members. It felt so weird to finish this game, because the ending came so abruptly. Oddly enough though, I like it. I personally think it adds to just how bizarre and surreal this game is perfectly, making this game feel like one of a kind.

I personally think the game is basically a masterpiece, however I will admit it does have a couple minor flaws. Number one being that at the very beginning of the game, it's not really clear what you're supposed to be doing or where you're supposed to be going. Number two, once you do figure out what you have to do, in order to do said things, you have to do a bit of grinding on the same couple types of enemies for gold and experience, which could take 20-35 minutes. That is not how you want to begin a game, as more casual players may not want to have to sit through a lot of the same thing over and over waiting for something new to happen right at the beginning of a game, as they're more likely to just quit. And my last issue with the game, is that the when you fight the final boss, their is such a large difficulty spike when you face them, it really comes out of nowhere, and it's quite jarring.

Overall though, these flaws feel so insignificant when compared to the rest of the game's pros, as well as it's unique charms. The visual style isn't for everybody, but it's still worth trying if you want to see something completely new. Also it should be illegal for a game of this quality to be sold at the price of only $2.99, so with that in mind, I heavily recommend at least trying it out once, even if  you don't like the visual style. Mason Lindroth, you have truly made something special, I hope you continue to pursue making this beautiful artwork, and if not, I simply wish you the best, and I thank you for making such an incredible game; And I can't wait to play and review this game's sequel.

I personally rate Hylics:
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198003655307', 'num_games_owned': 452, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1672413827}
review:
Hylics is a comfy psychedelic blanket and an absolute joy. If you are open to it, its wonderfully surreal visuals and texts tickle your brain in just the right way to create a meaningful and deep experience. It's weird and alien, but just aloof and strange enough that it never feels uncomfortable or scary.

One of the most visually creative and impressive games I have played in the last 10 years.

author: {'steamid': '76561199075374950', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1674356034}
review:
Meu deus... eu agradeço demais ao Tropia e ao Pedro Boh, que fizeram possível eu poder jogar isso, pq sério, que jogo indescritível, e incrível ao mesmo tempo-
A gameplay é bem como os rpgs clássicos, e uns famosos que vieram esses tempos (Como Omori), mas mesmo assim, o jeito descontraído que tem o menu, com "Coisas" é mt interessante, e os spells com animações de símbolos deixam o combate totalmente único, pelo menos eu nunca vi coisa como essa.
Os gráficos são puramente surrealistas, e mesmo sendo muito diferente de tudo que eu já vi, é lindo, único, como eu já disse acima.. é realmente esplêndido, a atmosfera como um todo me deu um conforto absurdo, as músicas não deixam ninguém tenso, e somado à animação e gráfico peculiar, trazem um ótimo sentimento, totalmente inexplicável, mas bom...
Além da trama principal (Eu gosto muito da ideia de que vc é jogado no mundo.. sem um texto explicando a cada minuto qual sua quest), o conteúdo secundário é bobo e bem divertido, a ilha da banda, além da civilização de areia (Com a qual eu passei um bom tempo construindo.. não pergunte), esses detalhes que mostram um carinho de quem fez o jogo

Enfim, é uma experiência imperdível, pra alguém que quer jogar jogos realmente interessantes, e que mexem cntg de algum jeito bom, te fazem se sentir bem, precisam ter Hylics, foram algumas das horas mais estranhas e legais que eu passei na Steam

review: It would take a man smarter than me to explain why this game is so good, but those first five minutes sucked me in and I just didn't wanna put it down. If you like games where you understand practically nothing then this is a gold mine. Music is fantastic, art is extremely unique and the hand animations make me feel like some kind of god. author: {'steamid': '76561198242344180', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1673941707}
review: A short little vibey project. Get corrosive, and extrude the government! Half the fun is in a short little RPG, the other is in just appreciating some fine claymation, borderline unheard of in video games outside of Clayfighter. It's more just for mood and style over a story or deep gameplay. But there is a little strategy. You can get clobbered with brainless attacking, but you still won't die much if you know anything about rpg's and basic logic. Randomly generated dialogue can be funny, and the music isn't quite "banging" but it fits the odd airs of this clay land.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111637288', 'num_games_owned': 880, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1672484075}
review:
[h2]Immersed In Strangeness[/h2]
Hylics struck me like an intention of regrettable situations. [i]Or something like that[/i].

If you're not sure what to play and want to try something kinda unique, go for Hylics. There's something in how basic, abstract ideas can create a memorable experience, even though by all means it isn't perfect. 

[h3]Acid, Obiquous, Abstract[/h3]
I would summarize Hylics with the words above. In a sense, everything is so strange that it cannot cease to interest in its structure. Weird, pastel-like palettes opposed to strong colors create a mix which I would describe as acid. Something cool to look at and contemplate. Well, the whole game's purpose [i]is[/i] to cause interest in everything you see. 

Of course, these architectures are not normal by any means. You'll find yourself surrounded with gooey, rough interiors and toy-like creatures with different colors and even stranger names. In this sense, its world-building capacities are pretty high and keep you invested. 

This unites with how abstract some ideas are. Sometimes, your surroundings will be just a collection of "ordered chaos". You may find it difficult to orient yourself inside some areas, but I think that it's a wanted effect.

[h3]The Hands \ The RPG \ The Core[/h3]
I find it interesting when a developer tries to put a spin on some design choices which, for most games, are common. In Hylics you'll battle in an RPG scenario, even though most battles will be fairly simple. This means that you'll have skills, HP and MP (which here are called Flesh and Will). 

The interesting design choice is the use of "videos" to illustrate skills. Each technique will have its own "handmade" animation, and I've liked the choice. It surely is cheaper to do and delivers!

Core gameplay mantains common RPG elements. You can find equipment and accessories, even though they aren't really numerous and for the most part you'll rely on defeating enemies in order to "level up".

[h3]Leveling Up[/h3]
Another interesting take on a common mechanic is the leveling system. In Hylics you won't level up; instead, you'll need to die in order to increase your stats. It sounds silly, and sometimes it is, but when you defeat enemies you'll gain pieces of meat which, when ground in the afterlife, grant you more Flesh points. So, strangely enough, you'll experience a strange [i]loot and death[/i] gameplay, which would be normal for a roguelike, but in a classic RPG environment it surely sounds odd.

Sometimes, though, it can be a little frustrating to navigate these two worlds. The developer did improvements to this mechanic in Hylics 2, which I'll be covering in the next weeks. 

[h2]Go[/h2]
I think Hylics is something we all need every now and then. Something where there seems to be no sense in anything whatsoever, and where we can abstract from the common themes we find everywhere. It doesn't shine in some aspects, and it lacks polishing, but I can oversee this since it's been developed by one person and it clearly was a first attempt to do something big. Again, Hylics 2 improves many things.

Overall, I would recommend it.

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/bodolovsello/recommended/]My reviews[/url]
[url=https://www.youtube.com/@bottolo]My youtube channel[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198018239232', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1679719094}
review:
夢～

はい。39℃のお風呂のようなゲームです。
温くて心地良くてそのまま眠ってしまいそうな…そして微妙に覚醒したまま奇妙な夢を見てはっと目が覚める
これは現実…あれこれやらなきゃいけないことがある…
でももう一度お布団に入って今はおやすみなさい……
現実逃避にぜひ。意外とゲーム部分もしっかりしています（DEDUSMULNとSOMSNOSAとPONGORMAを仲間にしてホットドッグ100個買えばラスボスも粉砕できるので安心です）

音楽
私は音楽のジャンルについてよく知らないのですが
HylicsのBGMはなんかこうお風呂みたいな感じで（2回目）めっちゃ良いです
クリアしても何回も浸れる…

総評
音楽◎
良い夢……

review: Hylics is a very fun and memorable experience, and a great deal for the price point. The unique and creative visuals are very swag, and, dare I say it, I'd even so far as to say it's a little based. It's quite short, and the only complaint I could make is that I loved it so much I wanted even more of it, which is a pretty good testament to it's quality, I'd say. I've enjoyed it enough to replay it multiple times. The soundtrack is also very rockin'. Definitely one of the games of all time. I would definitely recommend buying Hylics.

review:
Un juego muy entretenido pero corto. Si te duele el codo, compratelo en oferta
La verdad es que me gustó muchisimo, pero es porque 1) soy fan del arte experimental 2) soy fan de las joyitas de rpg maker de la decada del 2010, so... 
Todos hablan de los graficos asi que no tengo mucho que añadir :u 
plastilina, pixeleado, uso de muñecas y de object heads, colores extravagantes, musica grunge, dialogo randomizado
Realmente no tiene una historia, lo que se disfruta es la experiencia sensorial. Los combates especialmente, usen los specials porque son los chidos
tremenda joya ngl

author: {'steamid': '76561198364196966', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1691631197}
review: I don't often write reviews for anything, but I feel the need to leave one for this. Hylics is such an engaging experience, especially after what was, for me, a disappointing year of games. From the get-go, I fell in love with the style and execution of this riff on JRPGs-- the music, the animations, the nonsense. It feels inexplicably perfect, and encourages and rewards habits that would typically be punished in other games. It is so non-linear and every single unorthodox approach feels like it is acknowledged. The fun of this comes from wandering with a little ragtag troupe of friends, and it really captures that feeling. I know it is about the art being showcased in the game, but that charm oozes into absolutely everything. This is definitely my favorite game of the year, and if you get the chance or have a dollar to spare, check it out. ( presses spacebar while facing you to coerce you to buy this ) 🌘

author: {'steamid': '76561198195470485', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1671892510}
review:
Hylics artses all over the place to a degree I've never before seen in a JRPG-style project. The avant-garde craziness encompasses just about every aspect of the game, from its visuals to its soundscape to its randomly generated (yet thematically on-point) NPC banter, and it does so mostly in ways that I find aggressively unappetizing--like, the graphically meat-based economy and skin-meltin' gags would probably be at very bottom of a list of what I would ever like to see put on film/in games/in life. 

But, by gum, do I ever respect the craftsmanship and creativity on display here. That something this wild is possible in this engine makes the all-too-common no-effort asset flips look that much worse by comparison. All the art--even the body/food horror material that I have to look away from--is brilliantly done, from the sprites to the environments to the iconic finger-snappin' attack animation, and the whole thing just oozes atmosphere. One of the most impressive and one-of-a-kind RM projects ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198861764322', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1678787222}
review:
Attachant, perturbant et vraiment putain de drôle. Hylics est un grand OUI de ma part!

Pour commencer ce jeu est assez simple dans son histoire et dans son gameplay, avec quand même quelques petites particularités:
Vous incarnez Wayne, un... gars avec un croissant de lune comme tête, qui du jour au lendemain, décide d'aller tuer Gibby, le roi de la lune, qui apparemment est un tyran maléfique. (lui a la forme de sa tête ressemblant étrangement à une lune "gibbeuse" d'ailleur)

Et le gameplay, sous la forme d'un bon vieux RPG maker simple et efficace, vous propose donc d'aller explorer le petit monde de Wayne à la recherche de ressources, d'attaques spéciales et d'acolytes pour aller démonter Gibby vers la fin du jeu. J'aimerais quand même noter quelque chose qui m'a surprise quand j'ai commencé à jouer: dans ce jeu, vous ne gagner pas de niveaux! Vous gagnez de la "viande" en tuant des ennemis, que vous convertissez en HP dans "l'Afterlife", un endroit où vous allez à chaque fois que vous mourrez, d'où vous pouvez aussi vous téléporter. Je trouve ça juste original et drôle.

Ce qui m'a réellement touchée dans ce jeu, c'est indéniablement l'ambiance unique qui lui vaux sa petite réputation. Hylics est fait presque entièrement en pâte à modeler!!! Je n'avais vraiment jamais rien vus de pareil dans un jeu vidéo, et je peux vous dire que Mason Lindroth est bon. Je me suis retrouvée à appuyer sur des boutons, utiliser des certaines attaques en combat et marcher en rond, juste parce que j'adore l'animation en stop-motion de ces actions.
Les couleurs, l'animation, la musique bizarre, le texte poétique et fou généré au hasard par les NPCs et l'humour sont mes aspects préférés de ce jeu, et je pense que c'est la raison principale pour laquelle il pourrait en intéresser certains.

Pour le prix que c'est, Hylics est une petite aventure courte qui vaut vraiment la peine si vous êtes interessé(e) par le coté artistique. En tous cas, moi, j'ai adoré et j'ai hâte de jouer au deuxième opus!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050408748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1075, 'last_played': 1662544361}
review: In a word, esoteric, in more words, a funky little fever dream of a game that I highly recommend viewing a guide or similar help beforehand. Playing this game feels like when something is too far in the distance to see what it is, and you just keep staring and staring in hopes your brain can make sense of what your eyes are giving it. It doesn't ever make sense, but it's good fun to keep trying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182731018', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 263, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1698016869}
review:
[i]Hylics is a vibe. [/i]

You know what, as nonsensical and wacky as this game appears, mechanically speaking, it is your run-of-the-mill RPG/JRPG game. Probably the easier one of those genres I've played, so anyone who is a fan of those types of games would be familiar with it, even if it looks like it came from a very enlightening lucid dream that I'm not gonna lie, I'm kind of jealous. 

The main difficulty that came was the final boss (which I was lucky enough to defeat first try with a few close calls), navigating through the platform as you can get stuck a couple of times, and finally, trying to figure out what to do next. Most of the game is spoken in gibberish with a few that makes sense to help you understand the mechanics and what to do, but I advise you to not try not to spend too much time decoding them, most of the time they're like this: 

[i]''Lament your prison''. 
''Why must thine flabby teeth gather invisibly? actually, the jelly doth suffer thine chemical''.
''This prison begs the domicile yet texturized biscuit can invisibly dance vacuum''.
''Hideous vacuum-memories doth manifest the like, spirit''.
''Medium blue fly moon up wonders for weather''.[/i]

And these were a few I got from Hylics gibberish generator site because I'm too lazy to come up with my own one (except for that last one), still, it may be difficult to know what to do so I don't blame you if you look up a guide or a walkthrough. 

Anyone interested in the site I'm talking about, look up 'Hylics word randomizer' or look up the same link below: 
[url]https://perchance.org/5r6x8a3hol[/url]

And yes, that's basically the language.

I'm a little frustrated it had taken me this long to find and play this, Hylics is everything I wanted in video games, something refreshing and a one-of-a-lifetime experience. The hand gesture attack animation is so satisfying and fluid to witness, this is one of those unique cases I never check to see if there were skip options, I mean finger-clicking as a basic attack is such a cool idea. Let's not forget my admiration for these weird retro shapes and sizes, the retro claymation style is so inspiring, you can't tell me Wayne (the moon face dude) doesn't look like a chad and funky in that leather outfit. Lastly, I could only make up a phase describing this chill soundtrack as an old-west dreamerfolk, the base of it is spot on. 

If you don't see me owning Hylics 2 and 3 or reviewing them on Steam, that's because I'm planning on owning both of them on Itch so the developer can get more cut off my money. They truly deceive it for their creativity and for being out there with their concept, I'm excited to see their vision come to life as long as they can keep making a masterpiece like this game. 

[i]P.S. Don't be like me and worry about dying, actually, it is advisable to die to earn more meat (HP). [/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198044672408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1623893373}
review:
Hylics is a strange yet inviting game. The bizarre characters and setting remove any hard categorization into sci-fi or fantasy. You'll play a hero with crescent moon for a head, meet sages of technology, and fight amorphous meat monsters in parallel dimensions. The game rarely explains any instance to you, leaving the lore for your amusement. All this is tracked to psychedelic, lo-fi rock tracks by Chuck Salamone. The musical arrangements imprinted familiarity on this alien setting. The OST is a major highlight for me. 

Combat is turn-based and assumes the party's perspective a la Earthbound. Fighting feels like running errands at its worse, which is an unfortunate trope of the genre. The presentation is the breadwinner here. The claymation enemies fidget on their side, your party snaps spells, and the backgrounds melt between grocery parking lots and colorful blobs. The forgiving death penalty eases combat's tensions, allowing players to enjoy the visual styles of Mason Lindroth. 

The overall difficulty is between easy and medium. You might hit a wall when the game throws a new enemy type at you, but you can figure their weaknesses in minutes. Between the difficulty and death penalty, some players might crave a more intense challenge. However, Hylics doesn't need to be challenging to be laudable. This game is a trippy stroll through a lovingly crafted fiction, and I haven't found another work to challenge Hylic's weirdness.

review:
Behind the very appealing aesthetics, there's nothing. This seems to be intentional, down to the clunky settings and poor controls.

Those who are fascinated by the art direction will surely love it, but those looking for a game (even a walking adventure) are better off with a lot of other games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198973711916', 'num_games_owned': 673, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1668811588}
review:
It's really hard to think of a single review that explains this game completely so here are many reviews i thought about:
1. Hylics feels like a human game that was adapted for an other-worldly alien audience in mind.
2. Playing Hylics is like playing a normal rpg. But in a language that you don't speak. so you go everywhere, touching everything, trying every option until something works and then you don't think too much about it after that.
3. Hylics is the best sand castle building simulator out there.
4. Hylics is an art exhibition show coded with a rpg game on top of it.
5. Hylics is a game from a parallel universe where killing, dying, butchering things you kill and watching TV is good.

and the most boring one:
6. Hylics is not just a surrealistic game, but a game about surrealist art. I don't think this is a game that can or should be explained. Every experience will be different, every npc text will be different(since it's randomly created) and every idea about what the game is about, will be different. You might not like that and want a concise and absolute answer to this game but I think that is what this game is about. What [strike] surrealist [/strike] art is all about. Being creative, sometimes circumlocutory and something that will grab your attention no matter if it is in a positive (gorgeous, realistic paintings of people or environments) or negative way (dadaism).

tl;dr: it's an old but interesting rpg. Buy it if you feel like it or play the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198800805493', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1668390793}
review: Not many games can be as memorable as Hylics. Everything from visuals to music is unique and bizarre, yet it never became overbearing to the point of becoming uninteresting and looking like it was trying too hard. In addition, the gameplay never became stale. Animations were so enjoyable to see and once I figured out the strategy, fights were never too easy or too hard. If you have even a passing interest in turn-based RPGs, I'd give Hylics a glowing recommendation.
