author: {'steamid': '76561198399332164', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1665693468}
review:
Devo ammettere che stupidamente ho odiato gli RPG per gran parte della mia vita, ed ero restio dal giocare Hylics per questo motivo.
Dopo 20 minuti di gioco me ne sono innamorato, sarà stato per il surrealismo e l'astrattismo che permea tutto il gioco, forse per la musica cervellotica e quasi senza senso che si sente anche con qualche ripetizione (una delle poche pecche, seppur molto varia).
Io non saprei cosa dire di Hylics in tutta sincerità; è fatto bene? non come tanti altri del suo genere, OVVIAMENTE si premia l'originalità in questo caso.
Vale i suoi 3 euro per 2-3 ore di gioco? Secondo me si, almeno per provarlo prima di trarre conclusioni affrettate.
Detto ciò, io vado ad acquistare il secondo capitolo, ho aspettative molto alte adesso, rispetto almeno al primo capitolo.

author: {'steamid': '76561199146620173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1665259926}
review:
What a beautiful game for such a cheap price. Hylics is as indie as they come, such uniqueness that hasn't been captured in any other game. The characters are charming, it's silly, and it's wormed into my heart. 
The music is nothing professional, compared to Hylics 2, but it's still so pleasant to listen to. I heard people describe Hylics as a playable album cover, and I couldn't have agreed better. 

The visuals, animations, music, and overall gameplay is fun and worth it in the end. If you're considering getting / playing Hylics, I beg you to give it a chance, and try out the second game too! While not as cheap, it's still fairly priced. Hylics is a wonderful game series with plenty of love behind it, and I think it deserves more love from the indie game community on a whole.

author: {'steamid': '76561198306236838', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1665177193}

author: {'steamid': '76561198058098059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1665221138}
review: "Hylics is a recreational program with light JRPG elements." This is probably one of the most succinct blurbs a game has about itself. It kills time, it doesn't take long to finish, it costs less than underwear and has some real entertaining aesthetics to serve up for recreation. The main characters are kind of forgettable, but has their own little understated significance. I really love that one of the characters is just sat in their room with a gloomy cloud over their head because death-skulls has overrun the basement. Very relatable, in a way too hung over on a Sunday to do anything about it kind of way. Just life getting you down, everything looks strange and wobbly, people saying randomly generated nonsense, nobody knows why, nobody seem that bothered. And somewhere in the world sits an asshat with a gibbous moon for a face, making everything shit in some unspecified way. And you gather a loose collection of people and beat their face into orbit. I really like how you just walk into enemies by the end and they automatically fall over and die. So a light recreational program with light JRPG elements just about sums it up. Buy it, let it entertain you for a while, and have a good hung over Sunday. I certainly did, with Hylics as an entertainment aid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106511544', 'num_games_owned': 1627, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1664750021}
review:
[b]Sights & Sounds[/b]
- Great artstyle; highly surreal all around
- The music is very understated and strange, as you'd probably expect

[b]Story & Vibes[/b]
- I'll be real honest, I'm not sure what the plot is. You go around fighting baddies, solving puzzles, and recruiting friends, then the game just kinda ends
- It kinda feels like a deconstruction of the JRPG genre. I think what I've come to understand is that when you strip this style of game down to the barest of bones and its tropes, it seems a little silly and bland
- The game messes with you in that way. Everything felt like a weird critique of the genre. Do you take it seriously and at face value? Or do you revel in the joke that goes on a little long?
- The game isn't really ever unsettling, just bizarre

[b]Playability & Replayability[/b]
- It's a JRPG-style game with very bare-bones mechanics
- The puzzles aren't too difficult
- I'm not sure there's much of a reason to replay the game

[b]Overall Impressions & Performance[/b]
- The game made me think about JRPG metanarratives, but in the end, I don't really think I had any fun. Is that the point?
- It ran okay on the Steam Deck outside of three crashing incidents. Be sure to save often if you're playing it on that plaform

[b]Final Verdict[/b]
- [b]6/10[/b]. I dunno, maybe the joke is just going over my head. It's cheap and works on the Steam Deck, so pick it up if you like genre critiques. I really did enjoy the art style, at least, even if the game itself felt tedious

author: {'steamid': '76561199144388780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1688780263}
review:
before we start let me get one thing straight: if this game weren't so cheap,
i probably wouldn't recommend it. the gameplay is unbalanced, and controller
support is weird, and it's kind of inconvenient to get into fullscreen, but those
are really the only objective flaws.
    i freaking love this game.
the art style is awesome,
the surreal nature of this game makes for some really funny scenarios,
and i found a warm burrito in the toilet.
    personally the music isn't really for me, but it definitely works to set the
tone of the game, and some of the tracks grew on me.

overall, this game is more than the sum of its parts, and at 3 dollars, there's
really no reason not to give it a shot at least. I will never play this game again,
but whoo boy was it an experience

[h1] 3.5 out of 5 [/h1]
this is a great reason to play hylics 2,
which fixed all the problems i have with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177914742', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1662079893}
review:
Astonishingly bizarre.

A game worth going into while baked out of your mind. I guarantee that not a single aspect of this game can be predicted. You will be caught off guard, and it will confuse you to no end. This is what makes Hylics such a good game.

I love RPGs with attention to detail. The little things matter, and in Hylics, NOTHING really matters in the end, but the journey feels extremely memorable. You'll be left by the end with a feeling of "Wait, I did it?" Bewilderment shall never leave your mind, yet you won't forget the incredible journey it took to get here. 

A genuine, absolute 10/10 from me. And if the only gripe you have with this game is that its too short, surely the sequel shall fulfill that niche.

review: This Game... or well should i really call it an experience, is quite worthwhile. It has an interesting artstyle, weird music, and even weirder dialogue (gotta love rng which doesn't make your life hell). The main flaw i see is the battle system which is far too easy to cheese in my opinion, another flaw some might find is that there's absolutely no direction in this game, but on the other side, the world is small and all major places looking different making traversing a breeze (altrough it is definitely a kind of an exploration game). For an cheap ass game the time of play (i 100% finished it in something above 3 hours) is good. I Reccomend, as long you are a fan of weird indie games

review:
Just by my profile picture you can imagine what I think about this game so I'll keep it simple.
Hylics is a masterpiece. Although the gameplay is quite simple and doesn't innovate much, the game just gives you this unreplicable feeling.
It's so creative! A word that can't describe most new AAA games! The music just oozes passion and the artstyle is fantastic!
although it can take about 3-5 hours to finish, it's the best 3-5 hours I've ever had in any game!
this game is a must-buy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198137291196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1660546371}
review:
I could feel my brain tying itself into knots like a rope of plasticine after the first thirty minutes. 10/10 would play again

only two bad points about it in my opinion. Firstly, it's possible, late in the game, to softlock yourself such that you can't complete the game. [spoiler] If you aren't careful about where you send yourself in the airship and where you leave your boat, you can end up stranded on the main island after going through the warp gate in the maze. If you've already killed all the enemies accessible from there by then, you're stuck, because you can't even die. [/spoiler]

Secondly, one of the late-game puzzles was really irritating. [spoiler] The deadly statues maze omfg never again. doesn't help that you can only use the arrow keys to control. [/spoiler] I dunno maybe it's just me

author: {'steamid': '76561199036747372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1658430472}
review:
Some time ago, Spotify recommended me a curious track from a game called Hylics 2. Intrigued, I looked the game up, saw the visuals, and immediately bought both parts.

Having played several hours of the first game, I can confirm that the description given on the official page is correct: it is, indeed, a recreational program with RPG elements. Would be hard to give it any other classification. Hylics is a “game” based mostly on the spectacular psychedelic artwork, amusing world inhabited with absurd characters who often talk gibberish, and a funny take on turn-based battles. There is no plot (at least not that I have noticed) and no particular goal, other than roam this world, discovering bizarre locations and having a couple of new weirdos join your party. 

I have found myself coming back to this little thing after work, when I was too tired to do any serious gaming but still wanted to play something. I think this is one of those pieces of media I didn’t think I needed till I found it. And when I did, it felt like it was exactly what I was looking for all this time.

If you are in for a weird but charming experience of playing a not-quite-game, while enjoying amazing eclectic visuals and cool (albeit repetitive at times) soundtrack, Hylics is worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198434342176', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1660156314}
review:
Это было странно. Мне понравилось. 9/10
Графон - норм; стиль: пластилин и немного графики
Музыка - норм;
Геймплей - норм;
Сюжет и лор - странный
---
Если купили игру и застопорились на начале как я: [spoiler] 
1. умрите три раза в игре чтоб получить [b]супер топор(30 урона) у рыбы в мире смерти[/b]. 
2. В верху в городе есть [b]зеленый чел с рогами - он может стать помощником, если найти ему закопанный артефакт[/b]. 
3. Также внизу в лабиринте, если пойти в монолит, то можно попасть в другое измерение. Там в [b]левом углу карты[/b] есть проход к синей девке. За ее домом есть проход в подвал с перчатками.[b] Отдайте их ей и она станет помощником.[/b]
[b]Откройте 2 помощников как можно скорее, чтоб не искать заново телевизоры [/b]  
4. Во втором акте на среднем острове есть дом с последним челиком. Выучите у его телевизора массовое умение и победите его. [b]Он станет третим помощником[/b] [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198215903665', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1659978247}
review:
Это был опыт. Предыдущее предложение является единственным однозначным заявлением насчет данной игры. Много в данном случае говорить бессмысленно, поэтому коротенько и по делу распишу основные приколы: 
Арт-стайл - БОУБИ БУИ 
Музыка - Стронг Буба 
Сюжет - %$%^&*^%$ (Не имеет дыхательности) 
Про геймплей можно чуть-чуть поподробнее. В совокупности, он ок, однако тут снова эстетика спасает по большей части. Эксплоринг - классный, ощущения недопонимания есть всю игру, мне это понравилось. Боевка - на троечку. Анимации атак очень хороши, но сами бои абсолютно не требует каких-то тактических манипуляций и поэтому становятся очень скучными. А вот всякие BRIMBABABOIUYT фишечки мне очень зашли. Это надо самому испытать, чтобы понять. 
В целом, можно охарактеризовать проект как что-то очень близкое к искусству, но с оговорками. Мне такое нравится. Если нужны новые впечатления, то в Hylics стоит нырнуть. Ставлю очень твердую 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198007540184', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1661574080}
review:
This game's main selling point is its art style. It shouldn't be underestimated how much new life can be breathed into an old genre like the JRPG simply by removing the pixels and replacing them with something that looks closer to traditional art, with its accompanying physical mediums. I found it bold and striking - simply having curvy vermiform structures that have clearly been hand-made in a videogame really feels freeing, somehow.  

In its gameplay, [i]Hylics[/i] feels like a strange shadow version of the classic JRPGs, the best example I can think of being [i]Final Fantasy IV[/i] on the Super Nintendo. You have your overworld, with multiple means of transportation; your underworld; and both games finish with a trip to the moon. There's obviously a healthy dose of [i]Earthbound[/i] in there too, with the emphasis on music, psychedelic battle backgrounds, and everyday foodstuffs servicing as health-recovery items.

Arguably, the battle and levelling system [i]Hylics[/i] uses is better than many of the older JRPGs. While perhaps more rudimentary (this is only a 2 to 4 hour game after all, and many battles can be avoided,) I commend the game for making every special attack, accessed from the TVs scattered around the realm, [b]viable[/b] - sleep, poison, and confusion all have their uses, and you won't find important enemies immune to them as in so many other games. The idea that this is a "recreational program" rather than a fully fledged game is a slight undersell in my opinion, since care has been taken to make the battle system functional, and indeed more logical than some of the older examples I can think of. Yes, it is short, but the price point reflects that.

The random text generation was something I found very annoying and is my biggest gripe with the game, since it makes the game's dialogue a chore to sift through. Perhaps it is a throwback to the bad translation of the early JRPGs, where NPCs would give you strange and garbled advice. But rather than turn up interesting and open-ended statements, or the entertainingly bad Graveyard Ducks of yore, I found that whatever text generator was used just creates dialogue that the eye glosses over instinctively, since it is so inelegant. Grammatically, many of the statements make no sense, and rely on esoteric vocabulary that just sounds pretentious. But, since mentioning new words I learnt seems to be a weird trend in my reviews of late, I guess I should add "refulgent" and "pupigerous" to that list. 

There isn't a strong story to this game, it's mostly about the vibes. If [i]Undertale[/i] was Chaotic Good, and [i]LISA: The Painful[/i] Chaotic Evil, this is the Chaotic Neutral of the three. It's not about instilling hope or exploring despair. Deeper meaning can undoubtedly be read into the "events" of the game, and I was intrigued by a sequence where business types matter-of-factly extract massive piles of money by liquefying organic specimens in jars...but the game doesn't force anything on you. It's chilled out, surreal; the constant references to meat, flesh, and muscle are visceral, but since death holds no meaning, you don't feel especially threatened. There's definitely a stoner-aesthetic too, being revived by burritos and crashing on friends' couches to recover being just two examples. I think it's worth a quick playthrough, and I'm interested to play the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198210458560', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1659361771}
review: 嗑嗨了会做出一款什么游戏？迷幻类游戏讨论颇高的Hylics引起了很多关注，区别于常规游戏更像是作者一次结合游戏互动大胆的艺术尝试。粘土美术风格，ai随机生成的对话，光怪陆离的场景搭配丰富的酸性颜色，我的评价是“太酸了！”，非线性的叙事结构甚至于大部分时间都只是在地图上打怪逛风景学习技能，在这个过程中出现了这款游戏最为诗意的元素作为搭配，作者对于超现实主义元素的运用十分巧妙，ai随机生成的对话在你初次游玩时完全摸不着头脑这些家伙到底想说什么，但当你get或者说意识到了这个点后，这种感觉会像是一串电流在大脑中一闪而过变的诗意且浪漫，这也是为何超现实主义总是那么的迷人并拥有众多拥护者，同样让我想到国内一位出众的艺术家大悲宇宙所创作的蝴蝶系列，”混乱“的代码随机制造出独一无二的蝴蝶，有异曲同工之处。战斗系统的游戏性在我看来=0，基本完善但不出色，只是最基本的配置。讨论或者深挖Hylics到底说了一个怎样的故事，隐喻，是没有意义的，这只是一次颅内高潮的trip，猎奇的画面，文本时刻挑逗着你的潜意识。

author: {'steamid': '76561198348671302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1659432996}
review: No, I don't recommend it. Do you want an exciting story? None of that here. Do you want a polished fighting and leveling-up system? Sorry, the gameplay is awful. Get rid of the visuals (which look like digitalized clay artwork) and you have a hollow game with nothing to offer. Boring, non-sensical, and overrated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198965452685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1659345891}
review:
I love this game so much and it was so much fun to play!! 

The art/aesthetic of the game is so beautiful and unique, the same goes for the soundtrack. The environment, towns, and characters, have such cool designs and the music has a funky, nostalgic feel. (Someone called it psychedelic claymation and I think that is pretty accurate.)

I also love how this game created it's own entire world/reality, how things work, what is and isn't normal, and how life is for these characters. For example, death is not at all a bad thing. In fact, you need to continuously die during the game in order to increase your health points and teleport, it's a really interesting concept! 

I'm very excited to play the sequel!!

review: A solid RPG with a very surreal premise and incredibly well done art style, which is by far the best part of this game. It's like if you took the creative use of claymation from something like Gumby, and mixed it together with Salvador Dali level surrealism, with gameplay that's your average RPG Maker style, but that last part is made up for with the amount of charm the game has. I just started the sequel the other day, which is even more stellar, but Hylics 1 is definitely a wonderful little game that I will never forget.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000459938', 'num_games_owned': 1464, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1658623980}
review:
Very... Interesting. 

In short, it's a JRPG style game which is impressively unique in it's mechanics as well as it's surreal art, audio, & writing. JRPGs have fallen off for me because it tends to be grind heavy and often not very engaging. In this combat you have to pay attention and use your tools to prevail. There is no grinding because the quantity of possible battles is static. No random battles - you walk into the enemy. That slain group of enemies stays a seeping pile of meat & bones permanently. There is no "leveling up." You get power through other mechanics.

The start was worrying because I had no clue where to go, but luckily my options were limited and the game is set up to make you fail a few times before "powering up." Don't get frustrated by the first few deaths. Just pay attention to dialogue (potential fish blabbering) and push through. You power up quickly and death is often a blessing.

Hylics is a short game, but if you're looking for something interesting without a huge time sink check it out.

Also wtf is this writing dude? I felt like I was losing my mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070859674', 'num_games_owned': 1172, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1658439167}
review:
A visually stunning game with nonsensical humor, this is a simple and good RPG with a lot of secrets. Incredibly good plasticine physics in the animations, the hand gestures when you throw a skill are pretty and all in all it's a good trip.
Music is chill, nostalgic, and a little sad at times.
Gameplay wise it's simple but it delivers.
Story-wise, I have no idea what the f happened throughout the whole game.

My personal takeaway from this game is all its artistic aspects, fell in love with them.

Duration: Aprox 2.5 - 3 hours

author: {'steamid': '76561199247548025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1685302811}
review:
I have never seen or played a game quite like it (although I have yet to play Hylics 2...). I've been fond of intriguing RPGs since I first played Undertale and man- I loved Undertale, but Hylics is on a whole other level! The claymation style is unnerving yet beautiful and the soundtrack is fabulous (I really like the band room where your party can play music together). The combat style and animations are really cool, as is the the randomly generated poetic NPC dialogue.
All in all, although it didn't take me that long to complete, my absolute favourite game and a wonderful experience. And it's less than £2! Go play Hylics!

author: {'steamid': '76561198829704411', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1657825544}
review:
[h1]What the hell is this?[/h1]

It's a psychedelic surreal abstract acid trip fever dream roller coaster JRPG-style game that lets you throw burritos at enemies with poetic dialogues to puzzle your brain and also with the most experimental and unique art style that I found really impressive. 

[b][strike]Questions about what the hell is happening in this game will never be answered.[/strike][/b] 


[h1]Huh, is it worth to buy then?[/h1]

Hell yea, would you really say no to drugs? Especially on a discounted price! Even though the game is pretty much short (I finished this game in 4 hours, it depends on how you play it of course) it is still a fun and [i]enjoyable roller coaster ride except that the whole track is loop-the-loops[/i]. 
The only problem that I had in this game was that it runs on RPGMaker which in the first glance I do not find problem with the engine at all (or any biased reasons), but it lacks settings especially the resolution because you're forced to play it on 4:3 resolution even though you can fullscreen it, I suggest you to play it on a windowed mode only, or maybe use a third-party program.

Will definitely buy the sequel after I have some money

author: {'steamid': '76561198093368378', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1656323052}
review:
I was recommended this game by a friend, and boy am I glad I was (thanks Johnny!). I usually avoid RPGMaker games entirely, but this one doesn't have the same, generic style that most RPGMaker games do. Matter of fact, it's not like many games ever, and is as far from generic as you can be, which makes the entire thing a hell of a trip. Its closest analogue is Earthbound, which is a fair comparison given the gameplay, but really, this game is a 1 of 1. This isn't one of those games you play as your first video game ever. Hell, the more games you've played the more you'll probably like it. This is for the gamer that has seen all the tropes, beaten 100s if not 1000s of games, and just needs a little spark to remember that there is more to this whole gaming thing yet. And well, that's me. Hylics hits really hard, and I love it for it.

The artstyle and OST jump off the page. Game looks amazing, with a style entirely unique to itself. The best way to describe it is psychedelic claymation -- two words I never thought I'd see back to back. Apparently he made clay models and took pictures against a green screen to digitize and animate it. I highly doubt anything like this has been done before, and you can -feel- its commitment to its aesthetic. Hylics is worth playing just for its art; you feel like you're in a funky art exhibit that just happens to be a game. The OST is similarly inspired, and fits the game wonderfully. Every track is good; they're all perfect for this game. It hits every mark and just lets you escape into this whacky world.

But Hylics manages to take it a step further with maybe its boldest decision in a work of art filled with bold decisions: all of its text is auto-generated. You read that right. Every playthrough you'll get different names for cities and locations, hell save for a handful of NPCs, all dialogue will be spit out lines of wonderful, yet barely discernible gibberish. I am fascinated by this artistic choice, and even more fascinated that somehow it manages to have a story that makes a good bit of sense despite that. You'd think generated text would save a whole lot of work for the developer, and maybe it was simply a lazy decision, but it's far from it. Though the lines are randomized, there is some method to the madness, and it's clearly meticulously and thoughtfully curated to make interesting and weird combinations that do a hell of a job filling a vibe. If you're curious how it was made, I'm pretty sure this is accurate: https://perchance.org/5r6x8a3hol#edit. Great stuff, and something I -never- thought would work in a game. What a mad lad to even attempt this.

As for gameplay, it's indeed a light JRPG. You actually don't level up at all (just equip new gear to make you stronger), which means you interestingly have no incentive to fight at all. You spend most of your time navigating avoiding fights entirely (enemies are on the map so you just dodge them). Nothing in the combat is complicated or new, but plenty to keep you entertained through its short 4-5 hr runtime. I should mention that the first hour or so I was a bit lost and confused, and too weak to fight anything, but in the end I figured it out. Understanding the controls in what was a bit of an awkward launcher / setup took a bit getting used to but whatever, this isn't the type of game to hold your hand.

Overall, Hylics is a hell of a piece of art that it's hard to find faults in. It's endlessly intriguing, and one which doesn't shy away from what it wants to be. Brilliant game; can't wait to play the sequel (which looks amazing, by the way).

author: {'steamid': '76561198286605537', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1667258240}

author: {'steamid': '76561198118967207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1657503336}
review:
This game makes no sense, in a good way of course. With the random text generation, the intervals where you switch between characters, and the absolutely alien-like features of these abstract beings, there's very little in terms of a coherent plot. The game prides itself on this and makes every interaction feel like the fractured fragment of a year-long LSD trip. From the animations to the aesthetic of the land, it feels like you fell head first into a world painted by Kadinsky and hit every stick on the way down. The combat is average considering it's an RPG Maker game, but I think that's the most impressive part about all of this; The fact that this was made on RPG Maker of all engines.

It's not super deep, but in no way is it trying to be (I believe). It's a visually impressive game on a pretty specific engine and it's fun for what it is. I fully recommend it. It won't be a game you boot up often, but $3 (or less when on sale) for what's essentially what an alien would make if you told him the basics of an RPG, it's a hell of a journey.

review: Esse jogo é uma ótima experiência que vale muito a pena jogar e apesar de ser uma mecânica bem fácil de rpg de turnos ainda assim te mantém preso jogando para saber o que acontece no final. Gostei muito dos gráficos pois sou um grande fã de arte surrealista e estou até mesmo pensando em fazer um jogo com arte parecida. A música foi algo que realmente me atraiu muito a continuar jogando também pois assim que inicio o jogo já escuto uma bela música de menu principal que sinceramente me deixou muito calmo e o resto do jogo continua com essa vibe meio estranha mas calmante sendo reforçada pela música que sempre combina com os cenários ao redor do jogador.

author: {'steamid': '76561199048248495', 'num_games_owned': 18, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1693010614}
review: Cannot recommend this game enough. I typically don't enjoy RPGs just because they aren't really my thing, but I played this one all the way through. Not because the gameplay was anything too special, I found it very fun but on a technical level it's pretty similar to other RPGs. But imo you don't play Hylics for that. You play it for how fucking weird it is. The main characters are really fun (and weird) and I love their personalities. The art is incredible. (and weird) The music, for the most part, kicks ass. (and is weird) Only thing I'm not a fan of is how there were some parts were I had to kill myself to the weakest enemies because I loaded my save at the starting island, only the boat was just gone. Plus having to die just to level up your health can be annoying, but it isn't that big of a deal. Overall this game is a 10/10 for me, and I can't wait to check out Hylics 2 and whatever else Mason Lindroth might have in store.

author: {'steamid': '76561198998428290', 'num_games_owned': 18, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1656192154}
review:
Hylics  non è un gioco, è più un esperienza grafica spiazzante, io personalmente essendo un fan sfegatato di grafiche intrippanti e "storie" nonsense sto amando questo gioco, non riesco a dire perché ma questo gioco mi prende di più di giochi come i primi final fantasy e altri jrpg (genere che non apprezzo molto) ma penso che questo gioco debba essere giocato, ora devo finirlo e platinarlo.
Non credo sia adatto a tutti però è da provare
9/10 visto che non ha nessuna storia e non è particolarmente rivoluzionario, però la grafica e tutto quello che succede nel gioco riesce a bilanciare queste mancanze e addirittura a farlo diventare un gioco che considero molto buono.

review:
A pure fever dream RPG with humor and dialogue that's reminiscent of Pathologic, yet very nonsensical most of the time. I'd recommend it if you're open to bizarre games, especially since a lot of effort seemed to be put into Hylics. 

Overall, I have no idea how to wrap my head around what I played, but it was absolutely entertaining once I got the hang of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019479423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1656008101}
review:
Ughh... Where do I start?

In Hylics, you control Wayne in some adventures abroad his world, starting in the city of Snatenurpon or Irethroog or Qerspux or Caiedblevuhz........ In the firsts glances and dialogues, the game demonstrates some kind of surrealism and randomness into the story. As you go on, you might have the same feeling, which makes the adventure very curious at least.

The controls are very basics, since you mainly use the arrow keys and the space-bar. You just need to walk arround and use the space-bar to interact with NPCs and objects. Eventually you'll find some enemies to fight, and the combat has a simple turn-based style, where you use the arrows to select between spells, guard, regular attack and items.

But even though the game itself has a simple exploration and combat mechanic (which can be a little challenging in the firsts tries, but you'll get the ideas quickly), it actually works very well. You don't need more than that.

Also the soundtrack has EVERYTHING to do with the whole context of the game. It's great, and matches the artwork perfectly! It makes the game very entertaining and adds deepness into it. The atmosphere feels so right!

Honestly, there ain't much more to say about the game, since it's a bit hard to understand and explain the randomness and complexity of the whole story involving Wayne. But since it's a short experience (you might beat the whole game between 2~5 hours), I think everyone should give it a try. It's also surprisingly cheap for the content, so why not?!

I'm in love with this game. It's definitely one of the best I've played over the last few months. It was a very unique experience, and I don't think I ever felt like these playing a game. Very unusual, very original, very awesome! Let's go for Hylics 2 now! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198018600698', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1655079400}
review:
This game is really charming. Dying isn't frustrating, you can do superficial little tasks in the afterlife and it's a chance to upgrade your character, which almost makes it a bit like a Rogue-Lite? It's not, though. I just think it's interesting that Hylics is doing similar things to make death rewarding, so it's not as frustrating to fail and the player won't avoid difficult confrontations and opportunities to learn.

But seriously, what even is this game. It's like if Gumby and The Yellow Submarine had a baby and raised it in mortis ghost's OFF, and then ran it through a Shakespearean jargon translator. Ultimately the gameplay loop is pretty standard RPG stuff, so even with the abstract style which lends itself to unclear goals and lots of word salad, you'll probably still be able to make your way. I feel like it's the 90s and I'm out here playing an untranslated SNES JRPG that never got a localization, just moving forward on vibes and game design. Not in a bad way, though.

I'm pretty taken with the chapter break interludes, actually. It feels like Supermassive Games' thing with the Curator, where an omniscient narrator commentates on the story thus far? Which I would like to see more of in games for reasons I can't articulate.

Anyway. You will not understand this game, but you'll understand it anyway. And if you think you understand it no you don't yes you do.

The art slaps, and I like the goofy characters. Well worth the $3 or whatever it was.

On the point of OFF--just WHAT are these bizarre, abstract indie games with weird ambient music tapping INTO when they make the "elements" of the world stuff like plastic and meat? Is it the consumerism??? It must be the consumerism. Well done, indie devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198992524294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1654084291}
review:
7時間弱くらいでクリアしました。
ビジュアルがとても個性的で、シュルレアリスムの絵画の中に入り込んでキャラクター達を操作しているような感覚になります。
最初はなかなか勝手がわからなかったのですが、少しずつ世界観や操作の仕方などがわかってくるので（骨格は割と普通のRPG）、攻略サイトなどに頼らなくても大丈夫だと思います。
日本語MODを作ってくださる方がいたのでそれをあてて日本語でプレイでき、大変助かりました。
意味不明なセリフも多いですがおそらくそれは英語でもそうなのかな、と推察します。

会話の意味の通らなさとかぶっ飛んだ見た目から、どこか知らない遠い星の誰かが昼寝で見ている夢の情景とでも思えそうです。
ドラッグをキメて作ったのか？とも思いましたが、それだとここまでまとまりのあるものは作れないのかなあ、とも思いました。
続編もあるようなのでまた時間をおいてプレイしてみたいと思いました。

ここではないどこか。別世界を覗いてみたい、という欲求を満たしてくれます。

review:
very silly and pretty easy

get all your party members before using paper cups or tenderizing meat, you can get every party member except for pongorma at the very beginning before fighting anyone (and pongorma can be gotten literally right after the first miniboss)

play hylics 2 first, then come back to this to just see all the cool callbacks. its just $2 and i think its worth it if you just want that little bit of extra hylics content

review: Hylics is definitely one of those games that rejuvenated my hobby for vacuum collecting. Taking place in a post-human world, a homonculus skeleton's passion renders, but truth sort of stretches a theory placed in the clever symbolism and vast surrealism placed in our eyes like dancers in a weaponized ocean. I am looking forward to partaking in the noisome shining art of a vessel being-dirt that is the successor sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062146158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1651688680}
review:
Um jogo q surpreende por ser feito no RPG MAKER.
Sua Gameplay é simples, os combates são o basicão de JRPG, mas o tema surrealista, tanto no design qt na lore bizarra, torna-o extremamente único.
Duas outras coisas q eu tbm achei mt boas no jogo:
1 - sem batalhas aleatórias, podendo evitar QUASE todos os combates do jogo. Hj em dia é praticamente um JRPG ter isso, mas é bom notar.
2 - SEM NÍVEIS. Isso casa mt bem com a ideia de um jogo q vc pode evitar o combate. Não precisa de grinds absurdos pra continuar o jogo. Seu personagem só precisa de itens pra ficar mais forte e passar pelos desafios.

review: The imersion in this RPG seems like a puzzle to me. In general its a freaky coolest way to see how the strange things in our life can be normal if to be part of a reality like that too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016324311', 'num_games_owned': 585, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1650043343}
review:
[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
It's short, sweet and weird. Worth giving it a shot if you want a nice little JRPG or if you like the surreal themes but don't expect anything too deep or expansive.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
It's got what you expect from a JRPG combat system. Most of the progression is gear-based with enemies primarily dropping consumables or money. It's pretty well done for what it is, although the combat log does feel like it goes by a bit fast to tell what's going on in some fights. I should add it's definitely not a difficult game, and if you're fast enough you can finish it in three or four hours.

[h1]Story[/h1]
Uhhh… There is one maybe?

[h1]Visuals & Audio[/h1]
A look at the trailer is about all you need to know; you're in for an audiovisual trip that is a delight to go through. The world is wonderfully bizarre and even though I'm fairly sure there's no deeper meaning to many of the events in the game, they still manage to stay endearing between the crazy design of the world and its denizens, the animations and the unique art style.

[h1]Completion[/h1]
No achievements, but there are some optional sections you can miss out on. Nothing too crazy and you can always go back to finish anything you missed even after the end of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146577172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1649960709}
review: The absurdity of life is as waves gently crashing upon my cerebrum. The shores of my mind are gently licked by esoterica. Washed upon my subconscious is a drowned man. His name; God.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152138365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 861, 'last_played': 1649911520}

author: {'steamid': '76561198983220889', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1710877717}
review:
[h1] Hylics: o puro fruto do Surrealismo [/h1]

[h1] 🌯 - Introdução: [/h1]

  [b] Hylics é um RPG baseado em turnos desenvolvido inteiramente pelo artista e desenvolvedor Mason Lindroth, na engine RPG Maker VX Ace. [/b] Porém, Hylics é um jogo inovador. Descrito pelo próprio criador como um "software recreativo com elementos de JRPG", o jogo foge muito dos padrões de outros jogos feitos nesta engine, com um estilo de arte extremamente único e característico, construído com técnicas de stop motion (esculpido em massinha) e então digitalizado e animado. [i] Esta é definitivamente uma das experiências mais únicas que já tive com um jogo. [/i]

[h1] 🎨 - A Singularidade de Hylics: [/h1]

  [b] O jogo consegue ser único do início ao fim. [/b] No próprio menu você já é surpreendido com a trilha musical e o visual característico da obra. O que torna Hylics único não é exatamente a gameplay, que segue padrões bem característicos de outros RPGs, baseando-se em exploração e batalhas em turnos, mas sim toda a ambientação do mundo apresentado. 
  Hylics tem uma grande base no Surrealismo, um estilo artístico que busca fugir de representações tradicionais do físico e racional, utilizando-se assim da estética do subconsciente humano, tendo muito fundamento nos sonhos e pensamentos do homem e, como consequência disso, criando assim visuais únicos e indescritíveis que são amplamente abertos a subjetividade ou ausentes de um sentido exato. Mason Lindroth junta a estética surrealista com seu próprio estilo de arte, a stop motion, e cria assim uma obra com aparência impecável e muito característica.
  [i] Vale destacar a utilização peculiar de diálogos desconexos e randomizados, um tópico que entrarei em detalhes mais tarde. [/i]

[h1] 🎶 - A Música: [/h1]

 [i] * Nesse ponto, vale distinguir a trilha sonora do primeiro e do segundo jogo, mas como essa análise é focada em Hylics 1 darei preferência a sua trilha sonora. [/i]

 [b] O estilo único de Hylics não se prende somente aos visuais. [/b] O jogo também consegue ser característico por meio de sua trilha sonora, que sucede perfeitamente em passar a ambientação surrealista e fugaz da obra. [i] Através do uso de poucos instrumentos, músicas simples ou confusas e melodias incomuns, a experiência se torna ainda mais única. [/i]

[h1] 🎮 - A Gameplay: [/h1]

 [b] Hylics, mesmo que único, ainda segue o clássico sistema de explorações e batalhas dos RPGs baseados em turnos. [/b] Porém, com o toque único do estilo de Lindroth, o jogo conta com locais inusitados, diálogos desconexos e randomizados (porém de certa forma poéticos), personagens com design abstrato e segmentos que não fazem total sentido, como encontrar copos de papel para usar bebedouros que aumentam a sua mana, no jogo chamada de "Will" (vontade). 
  Apesar de um estilo tão incomum, o jogo ainda consegue ser muito divertido para fãs do gênero, com habilidades e efeitos muito criativos e bonitos de se observar e usar, e batalhas relativamente desafiadoras, além do sistema de aumentar sua vida matando inimigos. A história é simples e os personagens são simples, atribuindo maior subjetividade ao jogo. 
 [i] A exploração também é um ponto alto, com um mapa de ótimo tamanho e bastante segredos escondidos, como itens para coletar ou NPCs, além de, claro, as paisagens únicas da obra. [/i]

[h1] 🌙 - Personagens e a (breve) história: [/h1]

  [b] O conceito da história do jogo é bastante simples. [/b] Você é Wayne, um cara com uma cabeça em formato de Lua Minguante (Waning Moon em inglês, um belo de um trocadilho) que mora sozinho com alguns animais. 
  O objetivo de Wayne é matar o atual Rei da Lua, Gibby (Outro jogo de palavras, dessa vez com Gibbous Moon), e acabar com o seu reino.  Durante sua aventura, você enfrenta diversos inimigos, explora diversos lugares e reune sua equipe, composta por Wayne e 3 amigos (Dedusmuln, Somsnosa e Pongorma), cada um com as suas próprias características. [i] O resto, recomendo jogar por si mesmo para experienciar. [/i]

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

  [b] Hylics é uma obra única que só jogando para experienciar por completo. Recomendo muito, se despertar interesse em você, que dê uma olhada no jogo, é bem barato e é um daqueles jogos que você fica pensando sobre por um bom tempo. 
  Obrigado por ler até aqui, e lembre-se: Se encontrar um burrito em uma privada, use-o para reviver seus amigos :) [/b]

[h1] Nota Final é um 10/10 para aqueles que gostam de RPGs de Turno, e 8,5/10 para quem não é tão fã. [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198024311459', 'num_games_owned': 2716, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1648663917}
review:
Do not touch the ambulant skulls!
Or you will die.

Hylics is a goofy, avant-garde RPGMaker game that focuses more on experience and art rather than on traditional story-telling.  If you're looking for a deep storyline, I'm sure there's some sort of narrative woven into the meaty, "effulgent" fabric of the universe somewhere, but it is mostly obscured by the bizarre dialogue.

As far as mechanics are concerned, "leveling up" isn't really done in this game.  All of your power is obtained via consumables, equippables, and interacting with certain items in the world.  I enjoyed the experience since it diverged a bit from most RPGs I've played in recent years.

Time-wise, you can probably beat this in a few hours on your first playthrough.  If you feel like "mastering" things and playing again, it will likely go much faster for you.

Overall, I enjoyed the game.  Not the best thing I've ever played, but it was a fun experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561199140810751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1708408908}
review:
Diferente, Refrescante y sobre todo divertido.
Tengo una relación amor-odio con los RPG por las toneladas de texto con las que te suelen ahogar explicando su historia, personajes, y pues eso, EXPLICAR EL JUEGO.
Hylics tira todo eso por la ventana, La historia es simple, nada con que te puedas perder, pero lo suficiente para seguir jugando junto a sus visuales increibles, la unica pregunta valida que tendrás y que sí tendrás una respuesta en Hylics es
¿Se puede poner aún más extraño?

author: {'steamid': '76561198015084048', 'num_games_owned': 1155, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1625738834}
review:
One of the most artistic and psychedelic Rpgs to come out in ages. Mason Lindroth has not just created a wonderful RPG experience, but an artistic and insane visual experience that truly represents the term "Artistically Unique". Abstract in it's visuals and thought provoking storyline, Hylics is an experience moreover then just another RPG. I enjoyed the game for what it was and appreciated the time and effort put into the surreal and abstract artwork that went into it. Though this style of game design and abstract art/story is not for everyone, I dare say you should still give it a try. It is not to heavy handed with the verbiage and the artistic way in which the story is presented, but I must say that it is worth taking your time to enjoy it.

Notice I have used the words artistic and abstract a lot, well, because it is. Again, this style of art and storytelling is not for everyone, but it should at least be experienced once and this is one of the best mediums to do it in, a well structured RPG. As far as indie rpg games go, it is short enough that it is not overbearing, and well crafted enough to keep you engaged. I give it a 8 out of 10 for the quality of the work expressed here as well as the overall rpg experience that I got from it.

review:
Very cool graphics. The style looks almost like a painting saved in 16 color bitmap format. Downside is that the hitboxes are weird and some of the character animations are done rushed. (random pixels floating everywhere and ugly walk animations)
But even though the game is shitty it's also mega well done at the same time. I'm very curious about what kind of person could make something like this. The dialogues are mega odd too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198918259204', 'num_games_owned': 23, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1645260359}
review:
This is a really funky game, the moves make no sense the first time you play, but it's really fun if you love weird rpgs. Since the game is old, it's a pretty unbalanced game if you know what you're doing- that is, you can get rediculously overpowered if you understand the battle system. Likewise, on your first playthrough, it'll seem really grindy and like you're going nowhere. The afterlife will be your most visited area haha. I really like the afterlife system, it doesn't penalize death. 

Overall, a must play for odd game and rpg enthusiasts :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198223614576', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1700281746}

author: {'steamid': '76561199138360910', 'num_games_owned': 23, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1645138921}
review:
This game is very fun and graphically unique, I enjoyed it a lot. The music is pretty unique too and I have to say that I really love the title screen theme, I could just stare at the title screen for hours because of the music, another song that I like a lot is Messy Song for some reason.
Another cool thing is the way you increase your Flesh and Will, it's something I've never seen before in an RPG Maker game yet, makes grinding very fun actually.

Very impressive game for being made on RPG Maker VX Ace! Though it's pretty short and the final boss really just felt like another boss, it was more difficult tho, but I managed to beat it first try. It also has a very odd ending that didn't feel too good, last thing is that it was quite confusing to make progress, the game doesn't really tell you where to go most of the time so you have to figure out by yourself, but I'd put it on my favourite RPG Maker titles anyway, nice game!! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198062504568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1645089593}
review:
I was drawn in by the bizarre claymation and reviews, but came away feeling completely dull. 

Even after beating the game, I just don't understand the appeal. Everything about the game feels boring, almost by design; the music, the combat, the story, and the nonsensical dialogue do nothing to add to the game or the genre. 

If you're thinking about buying this game, watch just 30 seconds of gameplay, and imagine doing that for 4 hours.

As you can tell from other reviews, this game's only quality is having auto-generated text garbage for dialogue. I don't understand the appeal at all, I feel like I accidentally played a completely different game from everyone else here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198315833807', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1644282709}
review:
Important notes before I start the review: In order to run this game in fullscreen without issue, I suggest using a program called "Borderless Gaming". Here's the URL: https://sourceforge.net/projects/borderless-gaming.mirror/  Remember, make sure you always open the program and select "Hylics" in order to get the best fullscreen experience. That's it! Let's begin.

This game has you play as a strange, yellow, horned humanoid creature named Wayne who lives in a world just as bizarre as he is. You are tasked with travelling the world, collecting items, fighting enemies, recruiting allies to your group etc. Now, you might ask: "What exactly is the point of all this? What is the actual plot of this game?" The answer is very simply: I haven't a clue. Almost every character in this game speaks in a nonsensical fashion, not to mention the fact that the game's story (if you can even call it that) is also written in a similar gibberish way. You may think this is a bad thing, but honestly, I'd say it adds to the game's charm. Hylics is the kind of world you'd probably find yourself in if you got high. Just a few further examples of the game's insanity: cats that are just grown humanoids crawling on the ground, bugs basically just being wiggling piles of plasticine, the odd, distorted music that is often heard throughout the entire game etc. 

Now that I've talked quite a bit about the "plot" and world itself, let's get into gameplay. It's heavily inspired by JRPGs like Earthbound and Final Fantasy, therefore involves small characters walking in a line around the world map, occasionally fighting baddies in turn-based combat. Not to mention the numerous items, weapons, and armour that can be collected with different uses and stats. I'm not a huge fan of turn-based combat, but I thoroughly enjoyed it here. The fact that you can throw frozen burritos at enemies and also make them sick using spells is pretty damn fun. I also enjoyed upgrading Wayne and the others with different gear, seeing them become more and more powerful over time. 

As much whimsical fun as Hylics is, it still has some flaws. Firstly, it's pretty short. 6 hours may seem like a long playtime, but for an RPG it's very short. Another negative for me is the fact that I wasn't able to take any screenshots, which is a shame since there are many things in this game that I'd consider to be screenshot worthy. Other than that, I don't really have any other complaints. The game is cheap, doesn't take up much space, and gave me a good time. Can't really complain about that.

So, to conclude, Hylics is a wacky, short, and sweet little RPG which I wish was longer. Still, there is the sequel that I'll be sure to play some day. 

Final verdict: 9/10 "At last the mountain is castigate'd. Above zesty vacuums, Wayne is partially castigateing a radiance above furnaces."

author: {'steamid': '76561198046144477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1644217892}

author: {'steamid': '76561198150414067', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1644158555}
review:
Hylics - это Space Funeral на максималках, ни больше ни меньше. Сами посудите:

[i] 1. Графика. [/i]
Графику только слепой не выделит. Она очень здоровская, по-хорошему поехавшая и сильно запоминающаяся (мне еще напомнила Middens, которую я еще не осилила). Особенно сильно я кайфовала с графики скиллов (эти движения рук просто вау, так плавно и эстетично). Так вот, сравнивая ее с космопохоронами, могу точно сказать, что стиль - это основная фишка игры (хотя я не уверена, что идея игры как-то с ним связана ([i]потому что я вообще идею не уловила[/i])). 

[i] 2. Боевка. [/i]
Сначала мне показалась трудной, но я быстро освоилась и в итоге особых проблем с боями не имела. Сражаться приятно (хотя иногда устаешь от долгих анимаций скиллов, но их можно отключить, кажется), скиллов достаточно. Правда некоторыми я за всю игру воспользовалась пару раз всего. Вообще еще немного смущает то, что скиллы у всех героев пересекаются, и я уловить "классы" персонажей так в итоге и не смогла. (Но сделать троих дамагерами и Дедуса хиллером у меня успешно прокатило).

[i] 3. Сюжет. [/i]
Отсутствует???77знаквопроса. Нет, персонаж разговаривают ([i]иногда даже на понятном языке [/i]), но [b]ЧТО[/b] они говорят... непонятно. У меня в один момент возникло впечатление, что все реплики неписей генерируются нейросетью: слова понимаешь, а суть не улавливаешь. Короче, сюжет здесь на последнем месте, очень условное "дойди к злому злодею и дай ему по морде".

[i] 4. Музыка. [/i]
Приятная, идеально дополняет общую атмосферу. Ее включить вне игры, и сразу понятно, откуда она, ни с чем не спутаешь. Отдельная любовь трекам, которые звучат настолько по-шизоидному, что вызывают смех [i]и непроизвольные танцы[/i] [spoiler](В конце еще и самой побренчать на гитаре дали, вот там я зависла на время).[/spoiler]

[hr][/hr]

Но есть одна вещь, которая слегка омрачила мое прохождение. Мир в игре довольно открытый, грубо говоря, всегда есть определенное количество мест, которые ты можешь посетить. Так вот в один момент я поняла, что я исследовала ([i]казалось бы[/i]) все места, а сюжет стоит, а акты не меняются, ачевообщемнеделоть. Вот тут возникает проблема необходимости кататься заново по всем локациям, чтобы понять, что ты пропустил. [spoiler] (В итоге пришлось идти смотреть прохождение, где я в шоке узнала о том, что в локации со статуями есть 2 прохода!!!шок)[/spoiler]

В любом случае впечатление от игры очень положительное, я [b]очень[/b] люблю игры с RPG Maker, и очень рада, что такая красота на нем же сделана. Думаю, игра для меня в итоге где-то на уровне тех же космопохорон (а эту игру я обожаю).
   
[spoiler] Осуждаю автора за то, что во 2 части пересел с иглы RPG Maker на лицо Юнити. [/spoiler]
9\10

I would recommend this if you're looking for a short but indescribable unique RPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047129442', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1643781476}
review:
Inside of Hylics is a real story, trying to convey itself through the surrealistic fever dream of its world. It even drops some interactive title cards proudly proclaiming each "Act" of the tale.  Scripted, coherent dialogue and worldbuilding is cleverly woven in with automated word salad, where sometimes you cannot tell one from the other. The garbled sentences of their speech, however, impart enough occasional glimmers of structure that help to decipher what they want to say to you. It gives one the profound and immediate sense that what they are saying makes sense to them, in their world, and if we can't understand, that's on us. 

Theirs is a world of violence; a winding, melting, bleeding, greasy realm of meat, insects, clay, and feeling-microcosms. But amidst it all, there are signs of rules, and logic. One example; The world of Hylics is littered with Frozen Burritos, usable in battle only as projectiles, since they're, well, frozen. But if you put them into a microwave (of which scant few seem to exist, and may even be a 'lost technology'), it becomes a Warm Burrito, which you can use to revive a teammate. The few good foods which exist in Hylics' world - hotdogs, burritos, and juice boxes - are used in battle, accompanying animations treating them with near-religious reverence in their consumption.

The game presented moments of surprising thoughtfulness, such as being allowed to push a gasping fish on the beach back onto the nearby water, or novelty, like one area which seems to exist solely to let you do your own impromptu little interactive concert, to a small crowd of NPCs. 

Hylics also stands out in regard to its demand that you learn the meta of its combat as soon as possible. Although death is of little consequence - you are in fact rewarded for dying at least a few times - making progress in its first half is genuinely harrowing, as the abominable creatures roaming around will take no pity on poor Wayne, and kill him quite effortlessly. On top of this, the game's gear and "economy" are practically parodies of traditional tropes; the first armor Wayne can acquire is the toilet paper in his bathroom (and you might be surprised how long that's all he has to wear), and money is tough to scrape together at first... only for the game to toss in an optional lab midway, where you can quite casually pick up hundreds of thousands of dollars, astronomically more than anything in the game is worth. 

For a game spanning just 2-3 hours, I was further impressed at the number of ways the game lets you tailor your playstyle. If you would rather turtle behind high DEF, armor exists that gives you real defense, but locks all your other gear slots off. If you want to be a mage, Parasite Crystals give you more MP in exchange for less health. You can equip special 'tendons'  that allow for you to equip double weapons. You can also buy numerous pet foods around the game world, and offer to them to various critters in and around Wayne's house, in exchange for unique equipment. He even has a garden, which you can plunder freely for healing items, and they will grow back over time! 

I could gush more but I think this is enough. Just play it. It's not that long. And it has a lot to tell you about lard-furnaces, fate,  and the status of your conclavity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281478061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1643746817}
review: The game is short but really sweet. I Hylic's is a game that is extremely fun and I think its greatest strength is it's art, music and exploration. When I played this game I wanted to search every corner find every secret and find every companion (there are only 3). I've seen reviews of other people and they said they have missed two or one companion, that being said if you don't like to search or look for secrets a lot of Hylic's value is gone. The game has a very cool death system, and finding spells is very rewarding (Legend of melting and calibration are some examples). All in all for three dollars this game is extremely worth it and personally I'd say is worth much more than that the characters are cool and while the story is weird, I feel that many of us come to our own conclusions about it, which makes everyone's experience with the game different. I reccomend using a guide if you get stuck for a long time but don't read ahead cause it ruins some of the magic in the game.

Still though incredibly solid game with abstract ideas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034910640', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1642378970}
review:
Mi mamá es de un pueblito de Sonora y yo pasé gran parte de mi infancia ahí así que uso muchas palabras que, sin saberlo, son únicamente populares en esa región. Lo impresionante es que, muchas veces, estas palabras sí son reales y se utilizan pero muy rara vez o en el pueblo se le da otra definición diferente. Una de estas palabras es alferecía, que de acuerdo a mi mamá es cuando tienes mucha fiebre y empiezas a alucinar y tener pesadillas y hasta convulsiones, siempre resultado de la alta temperatura en el cuerpo. La definición del diccionario es, sorpresivamente, parecida pues hace referencia a la "aparición de actividad eléctrica anormal en la corteza cerebral, que provoca ataques repentinos caracterizados por convulsiones violentas y pérdida del conocimiento", pero no parece ser relacionado a la fiebre.

Hylics es básicamente la cristalización de la alferecía en todo sentido: alucinaciones por la fiebre, convulsiones violentas, y una palabra que para muchos no significa nada porque casi nadie la usa pero que, si le buscas, te das cuenta que no solo es real sino que tiene mucho sentido.

y pienso que eso es hermoso.

review:
what a fantastic little experience. the visuals, obviously, are fucking insane, and the story is incoherent (somtimes it's unclear whether there really is a story), and sometimes it's unclear what you need to do in the first place, but this game as a charm to it that i can't get rid of. it's such a sweet title, and even if hylics 2 is an improvement on pretty much all fronts, this is still worth playing. not to mention the influences are pretty clear, too, tons of inspiration is taken from older JRPG titles such as FF7 and the Mother series (mostly Mother) but it also feels like you'd pick this game up on floppy disk at some 96 year old dude's yard sale for $0.06 and completely forget abut it for 15 years, then try to track the guy down and find his son and he says "oh yeah i made that when i was a kid, my dad played guitar although he isn't very good at it."
in other words buy this game

review: The pearlecent reflections of joy in the monitor are, in fact, reminicent of the emotions the user has to describe. A creative jet subtile opera of clay dreams, caresed by rough pixels and hot burritos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987367278', 'num_games_owned': 549, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1641122346}
review: Great soundtrack, Intuitive gameplay. Animations were fantastic i couldn't stop laughing at Wayne's honking legs flopping around whenever he ran. I actually went into this not knowing the dialogue was randomized and was wondering what the honk mason lindroth was on when he was writing the script. That being said, a lot of the actual scripted moments were nice, and the world of Hylics was engrossing and left me wanting for more. I almost soft locked my game grinding for meat early on and the 4th fella wound up being born with glass bones and paper skin. I think thats all i wanted to say. I guess this game is worth $3.30, the only downside being that it ends so soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198392958126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1630164518}
review:
クレイアニメ風のとにかく癖の強いビジュアル、独特なBGM、翻訳してもなおよくわからないテキストなど、あらゆる部分が独特なゲーム。それでいて、程よく行先を暗示してくれるマップ、序盤は即死だが少しずつ倒せるようになる敵たち、一見強敵だが倒し方を考えればそこそこスムーズに倒せるボスなど、RPGとしては非常によくできている（システムは若干粗削りなところがあるが）。

PVやレビューを見て少しでも惹かれる「何か」を感じたならばとりあえず遊んでみて欲しい。クリアするころには、きっとあなたも指パッチンしながら足をばたつかせて街を徘徊したくなるだろう。

author: {'steamid': '76561199072317544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1642906604}
review:
If I could describe what this 5 or so hour game is in one sentence, it would be "If clay-mation and the 60s were basked in LSD, it would be Hylics."
Hylics has got to be one of the best RPGs, let alone one of my favorite games of all time. The janky yet charming walk cycles of the four main cast brings a smile to my face while the nonsensical, but enticing music has me interested within the world's bizarre atmosphere. The game does has its fault like the repetitive nature of getting each party member back to the TVs so they too could get the same moves as you and how the RNG gets spiked up at random points which threw me off during my first play-through. Since then I've grown accustomed to these things and rather than just cry about it or say "THIS GAME IS SO BAD" or "WHAT WERE THEY THINKING"; I embraced it and use it to my advantage (For the most part). There may be some stuff I've left out and/or forgotten about, but as of now, I think the creator has created an enjoyable and trippy game everyone should experience once. Best part of all, it spawned one of the greatest sequels of all time. 9.3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198082757859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1639881043}
review:
This game is one of the best examples in favor of the argument that games can be art. It's a simple and quick RPG Maker game, but what Lindroth has done in terms of combat design, world design, and more importantly music and visuals elevates this game far beyond the pixel trappings of it's engine. 

It's not for everyone. It will take you about 10 minutes just to figure out what the hell you need to do, and you'll keep having to just tough out some sections. The combat can feel static, party members only learn unlockable spells if they're IN your party when you reach a TV, and the last boss can be cheesed just with items and maybe two gestures at most. 

But aside from those minor flaws, (which are fixed in the sequel) I do believe that this is one of the most video games of all time. And one of the best, at that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198318849902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1648003717}
review: Eu sou um pai de 45 anos, provavelmente uma das pessoas mais velhas a jogar este jogo. Sou pai solteiro criando meu filho, que agora tem 17 anos. Meu filho ganhou este jogo de aniversario em agosto, de seu tio, então o instalamos em seu computador e ele começou a jogar. Até o final da semana ele tinha 24 horas neste jogo. Isso foi horrível para mim, pois já era difícil encontrar maneiras de passar o tempo com meu filho, pois ele está sempre com os amigos ou apenas assistindo ao YouTube. Então eu decidi fazer uma conta no Steam e pegar esse jogo para ver se eu poderia jogar ao lado dele. Eu comprei o jogo, escolhi minha classe e raça e comecei a jogar, mas eu estava preso no que você deveria fazer na nave. Pedi ajuda ao meu filho e ele organizou um jogo para eu participar com ele. Adorei, pois foi o melhor momento que passei com meu filho desde que minha esposa morreu. Desde então, esse jogo aproximou eu e meu filho novamente e agora passamos um tempo juntos fora de casa também. Este jogo me lembrou que há diversão em tudo, e trouxe muitas lembranças felizes para mim e meu filho.

author: {'steamid': '76561198851984046', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1649883694}
review:
Just cool as hell. I have no idea how else to talk about this game.

The art style is absolutely incredible and one of the most fresh, individual things i've seen in gaming, the characters are likeable, even when most of their dialogue is auto-generated, the auto-generated dialogue is silly in a great way, I loved making strategies and planning ahead with the spells, and it's a dynamic game that stays interesting throughout its admittedly short run-time.

My only gripes would be:
- The music is... really something. Sometimes it kind of works, sometimes it's bizarre but kind of funny, sometimes it's straight up grating and bad. I personally think it adds to the entire feel of the game, but it really did piss me off in places.
- The characters are pretty large compared to their environment, so when you're trying to do fiddly things, it can be really irritating. Looking at you, ladder puzzle
- Collision is weird. Some things can be walked through and some can't, with very little telegraphing what can be walked through. You're often walking in environments where it's fairly unclear what you can walk on or not. This was annoying at times.
- You have to be in very specific positions to interact with certain things.
- The game provides almost 0 handholding or pointers or tutorial whatsoever, and I would have given up and got nowhere if I didn't have a friend who had already completed the game. There's also very few walkthroughs online. This might not be an issue to some, but it was kind of a pain for me.

Overall, these are minor gripes at best, and detracted very little from the overall experience of the game. Maybe not perfect for people who want a polished RPG experience, but if you want something fun, creative, and a little silly, then I 100% recommend,

author: {'steamid': '76561198338276898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1639809705}
review: The game is definitely made out of love, and the visuals and music are amazing, but the game was super difficult and kind of boring since there's no story. the only text is autogenerated, and as others have said, it's old quick. I couldn't finish the puzzles of the first island. If exploration and some fights are your cup of tea, the games perfect, but if you expect something a bit more structured this may not be something you want.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151383683', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1639217881}
review:
とりあえず THE ENDと出たので。詰め要素はまだあるけど…

まず有志の方による日本語化パッチがあります。
（本当に助かりましたありがとうございます。）
英語に自信ニキ以外は入れましょう。コミュから行けたかな？

OFFみたいな感じかな～と思い始めましたが、どうももっと深刻？で
作者の意図までは到底たどり着けない風邪の時の悪夢みたいな印象でした。
世界観、言葉のチョイスも独特ですがBGMが特に耳に残っています。

本編クリアまでは短かかったです。５時間くらい？
難易度も易しい方かと。３ターン状態異常無効を切らさなければ大抵大丈夫。


まあ興味があったら如何でしょうか。
どちらかといえばポジティブ
★★★☆☆

author: {'steamid': '76561198188555447', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1639215076}
review: Hylics is a very unique game. Although it wears the vestments of an RPG, no familiarity with the genre is required. Its world is crafted with clay and yet feels like it always existed. The music is fantastic and atmospheric acid rock and complements the game well. It is short, but if that puts you off a game then Hylics might not be for you. somsnosa best girl btw

author: {'steamid': '76561198119688777', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1703355085}
review:
[h1]At-A-Glance:[/h1]
[b]Game type:[/b] Action
[b]Genre(s):[/b] JRPG, surreal fiction
[b]Art:[/b] Claymation
[b]Length:[/b] Very short (2-3 hours)
[b]Pace:[/b] Slow-paced
[b]Tags:[/b] Nightmares, surreal, great soundtrack(?), questionable everything, unique art
[b]Computer requirements:[/b] Low-end


[h1]Notes:[/h1]
[olist]
[*] This game plays like a headache feels.
[*] The music could have been purposefully made to continual brown notes.
[*] Weirdo, surreal JRPG kind of experience where dying is a functional mechanic for fast travel and leveling up.
[*] You play Wayne, a dude with a [i]waning[/i] moon for a head, and his party of fellow messed up creatures.
[*] Though most of the text is randomly-generated, the text that [i]isn't[/i] implies this is a post-apocalyptic world that follows an "accretion" event, whatever that might be. Is [i]Hylics[/i] the way it is because that's how the world just happens to be post-accretion, or is it just how Wayne perceives it to be and everyone else's perception similarly differs from one another?
[*] In gnosticism, "Hylics" refers to completely-material creatures that are at the world's metaphysical lowest and are completely of the Demiurge. Given this is a Claymation game...
[*] Nice. Nah man, nah.
[/olist]

author: {'steamid': '76561198954974485', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1639796334}
review: Weird. As. Shit. Definitely a game that people who hate generic RPG combat may have trouble sitting through, but the game play itself isn't the reason you should go into this game, and especially not the story either (the story itself is practically nonexistent btw). you should go into it to experience the environment itself. This game is a work of art. It's grungy and abstract design is incredibly unique, unlike anything I've ever seen. And although the visuals leave a strange feeling in my stomach every time I see them, it's an experience I think everyone should see.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038474970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1641744536}
review:
전혀 돈 아깝지 않음. 전투는 전형적인 턴제 jrpg 느낌이고, 죽어서 사후세계를 가는게 필수 진행 요소라는 점이 굉장히 특이함. 갈수록 쉬워지긴 하지만 나름 머리 써서 싸워야 하는 구석은 있어서 재밌었음. 게임 볼륨은 작다고는 느껴지는데 가격 생각하면 아쉬운 편은 아님. 스토리는 솔직히 말해서 도저히 뭔지 알 수가 없는데, 이유는 잘 모르겠다만 어쨌든 최종보스를 잡아야 한다는 목적 자체는 있음. 마지막 최종보스 잡으러 가기 전 궁전에서 다 때려부수는 연출이 쓸데없이 소년만화 후반부 같아서 특히 좋았음.
기괴한 그래픽이랑 어딘가 나른한 OST 덕분에 게임 하는 내내 기묘하고 편안한 느낌을 받을 수 있음. 이런 기괴한 아트스타일은 어딘지 모를 공포스러움을 함유하고 있는 경우도 종종 있는데, 이 게임은 딱히 그런건 없고 전체적인 화풍이 제법 유쾌한 편이라 느껴졌음. 게임은 불친절하지만... 아무튼 기비가 나쁜 짓 했겠지 하면서 겜 하면 어찌 되든 상관 없다는 느낌이 듬. 치밀한 스토리의 인과관계나 엄청난 대서사시, 쌔끈빠끈 여캐 근육미남캐 정통 RPG 뭐 이런거 좋아하면 안 사는게 맞는데, 이게 뭔 겜인가 트레일러 영상까지 다 본 다음에도 굳이 이 게임을 사는 사람이라면 취향에 안 맞을 일은 그닥 없을거 같음...

author: {'steamid': '76561199211883083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1636657190}
review: En lo personal, un excelente juego si te gustan los rpg como earthbound. su estética surrealista lo hace muy memorable, y su música da todo el pego con un mundo tan extraño. Me gustaría que estuviera disponible en más idiomas, por suerte se ingles, pero mucha gente se pierde de una buena experiencia por las barreras del lenguaje

author: {'steamid': '76561197993217891', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1708462912}
review:
РПГ с пошаговыми боями, где главный герой противостоит тирании лунного лорда. Игра хорошо проработана, обладает отличным визуальным и музыкальным оформлением, а так же интересным геймплеем. Почти все объекты в игре интерактивны, есть прокачка в виде изучения магии через телевизоры и поиск  амуниции, так же можно найти спутников, которые сильно увеличивают шансы на победу в сражениях.  Сами сражения хорошо сбалансированы, много уникальных противников. 
  Игра не длинная, но определённо даёт игроку намного больше чем иные высокобюджетные проекты.

review: Wow, what a trip. It's like trying to understand hieroglyphs written by an ancient Egyptian stoner 6000 years ago, but the hieroglyphs want you 6 ft under. If you have at least 3 spare hours and 3 spare dollars it's an absolute recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054608922', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1635630314}
review: O corolário da forma ser o conteúdo é que o conteúdo é parte intrínseca da forma. Por mais que o visual em claymation de Hylics seja fascinante, se ele não é acompanhado de uma desconstrução ou execução inesperada das mecânicas e narrativa de seu gênero (RPG), seu pretenso surrealismo estará para sempre incompleto. O resultado é um jogo que não se parece com nenhum outro RPG que você já viu mas se joga como qualquer outro RPG que você já jogou.
