author: {'steamid': '76561198056350187', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 430, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1635595331}
review:
Pros:
-Unique art-style that's claymation
-No penalty for dying. it'll actually help since you can spend the meat you got from fights to get more health.
-No proper level up. Just equipment and items that boosts stats.
-No random encounters and enemies don't respawn so every victory makes the journey easier.

Cons:
- While getting Flesh and Will for the party is simple enough, if you don't have a full party, they won't have the benefits that you have and miss out
-Despite the surreal art and dialogue, the story is basic and the characters are engaging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011629593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1634278280}
review: A weird game. Hylics looks like an rpg, and it is, but it isn't. Hylics is a joy to look at, pleasant to play, hard to understand. I'm sure there is a deeper plot underneath the absolute bizarre dialogue that reads as gibberish and the locations that are barely comprehend-able, but I didn't find it. But Hylics was interesting, and I think rewards the investment you want to put into it. If you like weird, avant-garde games, this is for you.

review:
It's like a fever dream, basically. Pretty short but understandably so for the price.

It's nice, looks gorgeous really, with some weirdly enjoyable music.
Now as for the story it won't really make much sense because most npcs dialogue is just random stuff, except for the important folks, but you can figure out what's going on mostly.
Didn't really like the whole everyone can learn everything except what they already knew thing, but since their stats are just different enough it works well.
If you like weird stuff chances are you'll like this, it's just a basic rpg.

author: {'steamid': '76561198421163511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1634173094}
review:
A very strange, yet very fun experience of a game.
The game does a lot of fun and interesting things to vary up the gameplay beyond just a surreal JRPG.
From the environments, to the the characters and items, Mason's unique and trippy artistic flair is all over this thing.
Treasure hunting, puzzle solving, bug squishing, music playing, vegetable farming (no farming simulation) and frozen burrito warming are just some of the other activities this game has to offer.
While I will admit the random-generated dialog was not very interesting to me, this game does have a fun sense of humor in places. Make sure to read the descriptions of items, as they will tell you about them as well as occasionally have something funny to say!

For three dollars, this is quite the steal, and I look forward to playing it's sequel in the future.

Thanks, Lindroth! Rock on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071271537', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1700740582}
review:
[h1][b]奇ゲー入門者にうってつけ[/b][/h1] 
[b]＊2022/4/9に内容を刷新しました（論旨は変わりません）[/b]
『hylics』はいわゆるオーソドックスなシステムのJRPG。

本作の特徴は奇抜なアートワーク及び世界観だろう。一般に雰囲気が独特と言われるものの多くは夢や妄想がベースになっておりこの場合、ある種の不気味さや生理的嫌悪感を想起させるデザインも多く出る。本作はそういった部分を丁寧に除去してありプレイ時の印象は常に良いものだった。
RPG部分については敵キャラのグラフィックやゲームバランス等が妙にピーキーな所もあるが、馴染みのあるJRPGのシステムなので、とっつきはいいだろう。奇ゲーで忌避されがちな部分にフォローが利いているので入門者にも優しい作りになっている。

難点としては奇ゲーの中では突出したものがない。サウンドやアートワークは素晴らしいが、それは雰囲気ゲーの特徴でもある。奇抜さを求めるプレイヤーに何かプラスαがあれば尚良かった。

[h1]まとめ[/h1] 
良作。PVが気に入ったのであれば元は取れる

想定内の奇ゲーということで、ディープな層には物足りないだろう。
しかしながら、このジャンルは個性を求めるが故に入門者用の作品が手薄であり、架け橋を担うには十分な品質があると思う。

author: {'steamid': '76561198212668601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1633598472}
review:
So Hylics is definitely a game that follows the style over substance approach, however, Hylics also raises the question about why this is generally seen as a bad thing. Sure, at its core the game is a very simple RPGmaker turn based RPG that has such little coherent story that the majority of the dialogue is randomly generated, but seriously, look at that presentation. I find this game really interesting for the way that it essentially proves that going down the route of purely focusing on gameplay is far from the only possibility when it comes to making a satisfying experience, since this clearly has a much greater focus on the aesthetic side of things.

What makes this so cool is the fact that every facet of the way this game is designed feeds into its surreal atmosphere and vibes, there's nothing this has that goes even slightly against that core vision of what the game is trying to achieve. The most prominent of these elements is definitely the art, not only having basically every element of any given scene being abstract shapes that only vaguely resemble anything in reality, but with the art itself essentially being digitally rendered claymation models. This gives everything a slightly uncanny feel to their animations, with their movements feeling far closer to reality than they should by all rights, yet also having the tendency to completely decompose into a pile of squishy plasticine. The music also adds a lot to the imagery with its profound vagueness, often feeling extremely hard to define or pin down, with it being hard to even say whether or not one could find it atmospheric or simply just strange. You get hints of something more conventional underneath it all however, whether it's the spacey guitar that's a staple of some of the more expansive overworld areas, or the unpleasant yet catchy synth melodies of the shop theme, the music of Hylics straddles the line between fun and bizarre perfectly.

The gameplay itself is pretty simple and very easy once you get the hang of things, but this wasn't really a negative at all due to the fact that it feels clear that the game is more interested in having the player explore this surreal world and experiencing all the pure creativity put into each location. I mean, one of the first lines of description for this game is "A recreational program with light JRPG elements", so if that doesn't imply that the combat and gameplay itself was used as a vessel to further express and elevate these ideas and atmosphere, then I don't know what does. Highly recommend checking this out if you're a fan of totally surreal (and incredibly creative), genuinely nonsensical content and can get behind some pretty simple JRPG gameplay. It's only a couple of hours long as well, so it's a very concise, digestible experience that you could easily finish in a sitting.


8/10

review: A weird game, something everyone would tell you, and it does get confusing to visuals and direction, but looking through the bizarre clay animated enviornments (to some okay surf guitar music) you get a giddy sense of adventure. One bit of advice if this art piece RPG seems entertaining, be prepaired for thesaurus talk. Non of the NPCs make sense unless you use a thesaurus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256584967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1673845709}
review: I've always had a hard time really getting through RPGs. I might learn to love and get into RPGs more so because of this game. This game has been really fun to play and I am for sure planning on getting the second one eventually. The music is awesome to listen to. It's interesting to hear someone put together a soundtrack when there isn't much traditional music theory behind it. It comes out very refreshing because there is way less reference and way more experimentation. With the clay I would want to compare it to the game Neverhood but the feeling of everything is very different. This game was a real treat to play!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973289335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1631665677}
review:
If you've ever wondered what early 90s MTV cartoons would be like as an RPG, here's your answer.

The surprisingly solid & at times unique RPG mechanics don't get in the way of the trippy and awesome visuals; they are a background that is meant to drive the experience.

Claymation art assets, and randomly generated yet not entirely nonsensical texts, progresses a story that will take completing the game to completely understand... if it's meant to be understood at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321267267', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1625191415}
review:
No existe lo raro, solo lo incomprendido

Hylics es una expresión artística muy curiosa y única, la historia no es su fuerte, ni tampoco su enfoque, lo cuál debemos considerar a la hora de reseñar o juzgar al juego

El objetivo principal de Manson con Hylics es presentar un experimento, un mundo diferente y con conceptos y comprensiones muy distantes al nuestro. Me hace recordar mucho a El Planeta Salvaje (Fantastic World/La planète sauvage), un estilo semi-tenebroso y sin forma a primera vista, el cuál va tomando sentido por cada minuto que le buscamos comprensión

No me extiendo mucho, solo es un experimento de 4 horas de juego, así que nuestra presente redacción culmina aquí.

author: {'steamid': '76561198180947355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1662230090}
review: I love this game so much. There is a single low point in the game for me where you have to run through a sort of tight corridor with a bunch of statues chasing you and they kill you instantly when touching you but that is quite literally the only thing I did not like about this game. The art style is weird and fun. The music is incredible. There's a certain power called "Calibration" where I would sometimes use just because I liked the way it looked and sounded. Same with using the item "Vegetable".  I didn't really understand the story until after I finished the game but I didn't even care because the journey was just so interesting and fun. I wish it were longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274388111', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1630415653}
review:
дико переоцененный проект, что-то вроде еще одной такой же псевдо-культовой поделки на рпг-мейкере - lisa: the painful
"уникальный" визуальный стиль начинает раздражать примерно спустя 15 минут после запуска
ну а если это "интерактивная арт-инсталляция", то непонятно, зачем нужно было делать ее на основе одного из самых убогих с точки зрения механик игровых жанров - жрпг. наверно можно было как-то обойтись и без всего этого каменного века в духе attack/guard/item, нувыпонели (а игра примерно на 80% состоит из гринда однотипных энкаунтеров). как вообще кто-то кроме самих японцев до сих пор может выносить это без рвотных позывов, ума не приложу

лучшая часть игры - генератор случайных реплик. действительно что-то интересное

author: {'steamid': '76561198008329904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1629823131}
review:
Surreal, short, incredibly well-crafted game. The music is fantastic and fits the environment very well. One of my biggest gripes with the average RPG is the need to grind, which is nonexistent here. Every character can learn every spell and equip most things, and the game doesn't shirk you for useful items.
The concept of a "plot" in this game is a bit lacking I will say, do not expect this game to be super story-rich. Any interactable NPC that doesn't give hints will jabber nonsensically, so you won't really get any sense of lore.
I definitely recommend this if you're into abstract games.

You can also play as a band, so that's neat.

author: {'steamid': '76561199112713191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1629541033}
review:
This is the weirdest game I've ever played and I loved every minute of it. It's a little bit hard to figure out, but if you stay for nothing else, the atmosphere, art style and the soundtrack make this game a work of art

As far as the actual gameplay goes, it's quite forgiving. You have a chance to level up every time you die, as long as you make an effort to grind for materials and items. Most of your time will be spent roaming around trying to figure out where the next step of your journey is, but the unique characters make it a delight to play through

The soundtrack is also a highlight of the game, and it adds a lot to the general mood of each stage. It's almost as if the game was made to show off Mason's rad claymation animations and soundtrack 

Honestly I could try my best to explain the game to you, but my love for it is as abstract as the game itself -- play it out of curiosity and stay for the trippy ride

author: {'steamid': '76561198085826318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1629272612}
review:
One of the most creative low budget games available on steam. It plays like a standard RPG, though you're more than likely not going to stick around for the gameplay, but instead for the crazy world Hylics is set in and all of it's audio and visual delights. 

You don't see shoegaze soundtracks very often in games either, so anyone into the genre should check out this game's music at the very least.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077368605', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1628445226}
review:
Although I appreciate the unusual visuals and music, the actual game play is not fun.
The battles are too easy, and exploring the world isn't engaging. I particularly dislike the large percentage of characters who speak in randomized gibberish. I know they have nothing meaningful to say, which makes me not want to bother even talking to them. Not wanting to talk to people in an RPG is not good.

author: {'steamid': '76561199077529668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1629246326}
review: A stylish and entertaining RPG. Even death is enjoyable in this game as it presents an opportunity to return even more powerful than before with only minor setbacks each time. The battle animations are endlessly entertaining to watch and the digitised clay model style is really distinctive. The surf-rock soundtrack works as an excellent background for the album cover-like visuals. Although it is somewhat limited by it's engine, I love this game and wish it were more well-known. If you like RPG games, I'd definitely recommend buying this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198374330982', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 868, 'last_played': 1689823834}
review:
my new favorite jrpg.
the lack of levels makes it an enjoyable, nonstop gameplay experience where you can let your mind wander into this world and its settings without worrying about grinding, it is definetily one of the big reasons why i had such a fun time playing it even though it was a short experience.

the music isnt the best to listen to without the actual game, its made more to complete the ambience rather than to be a good audio only experience, and with its purpose being to set moods, it absolutely excells at it.

the game rewards exploration in a fantastic way by putting unlockable skills in tvs in the overworld you can interact with, the sage tokens, and funny little easter eggs or tips for fighting certain hard enemies, that being said, the tv skills system tends to get annoying when you start gaining more party members, as you have to keep backtracking to said tvs for the new partners to actually learn them like the rest, it's fixed in the 2nd one but i haven't played it yet, so i cant say if its been fixed properly or not.
this is, and i mean this, my only complaint with the game. and its quite amazing how even though its something i find tedious, the upsides of it outweigh the downsides by a landslide.
the skills, too, are extremely well thought out and feel rewarding when obtained since most if not all give you a moderate advantage in battle if you went out of your way to get them. this especially applies to most powerful skill in the game, "the legend of melting", which if set up correnctly can maybe make the final boss a bit too easy (if you're sweaty enough like me). still, it's a reward for exploring everything there is to explore for these tokens, and so i feel like this is a fair advantage to be given.

the equipment you can buy is absolutely phenomenally balanced, but it can take you a while to find a combination that you like using as there's some restrictions to powerful items (example: takes up 2 equipment slots); you also gotta go out of your way to grind for "meat" to actually unbalance the items and equipment and be broken, but then there's a finite amount of enemies in the overworld, so you can't just buff yourself up to infinity, indicated by corpses left behind in their old spawn-tile. the equipment, also, allows for IMMACULATE, character playstyle customization, especially on the main character, wayne; i made my wayne fill a more healer/support role, while my other friends made him into a more full offensive tank or a glass cannon, you can make him an all rounder, its your choice! 

i'm usually not a big fan of jrpgs that aren't pokemon/pokemon-like, since i end up dropping them due to them being way stupidly difficult, or just straight up having boring combat or characters, but hylics, atleast for me, somehow keeps all of that from happening. it's not too difficult if you take your time to think of what you're doing or if you just explore for resources, the characters are interesting looking, with a really cool and unique visual style to the game.

and the COMBAT, i believe is something out of the world both visually and gameplay-wise. you dont even gotta strategize too much, you can just make yourself bulky, strong builds and beat everyone to death with your bare psychic hands (though i personally don't like that too much, so i made my team around support wayne being able to back everyone up) just, carefuly obviously, its an rpg, the bosses aint punchin bags.

speaking of bosses, i had very little actual frustrations with them, they all felt beatable and when i usually died it was because of an overworld obstacle, the enemies widdling me down, or me stumbling upon a boss im clearly not supposed to face yet (obviously i still did die to bosses but not as often as me not being careful). still, they didnt feel like pushovers! just a proper challenge that i had to carefully overcome.

this game is a solid 9.5/10 for me, i think it's a must play for people interested in unique visuals, fun combat, good balanced rosters and an overall bizarre atmosphere in their games.
i wholeheartedly believe this game should be way more popular than it is, it's just such a unique experience, nothing i've ever played, watched or seen with my own two eyes had ever managed to capture the strange, uncanny and bizarre feeling that hylics manages to provide.

hylics is an especially unique experience, made by an especially talented and creative man.
thank you mason, for releasing this amazing piece of media for the world to enjoy.


support our boy mason, because he deserves all of it.

thanks for readin'

(9.5/10)

author: {'steamid': '76561198199865643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1701692206}

author: {'steamid': '76561198082219425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1623799032}
review:
Hylics isn't much of a game. The jrpg elements are there but are bare-bones, and the enemies don't pose as much of any challenge.  However, Hylics is quite the experience. Hylics offers a unique and bizarre artstyle that never got old. Everything from the sounds, music, characters, and visuals add to the oddity of the game. It's like Toe Jam and Earl but more outlandish. Hylics does a very well job at making you feel lost and foreign in its world. Some bits of comedy are given too to add onto the game's charm.

If you're looking for a story, the game doesn't give one. If there happens to actually be a story, then it's cryptic.  My guess is that it's hidden within dialogue and the messages whenever you sleep.  There are no clear objectives given to you; you must discover what to do on your own. Also, the game gives some optional stuff that are well worth doing like extra party members, loot, and experiencing the world.

Hylics is a very short game taking me 3 hours to do the main and optional activities. You may be disappointed if you're
looking for a jrpg to play rather than a trip. If it looks interesting for you to experience, try it. It doesn't cost much anyway and it's well worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025973515', 'num_games_owned': 746, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1628212414}
review: [i]Hylics[/i] is a mad phantasmagoria of color and sound, that drops you into an inexplicably surreal and otherwordly experience. Discordant and confusing to start, the eccentric claymation art style and dissonant soundtrack become oddly soothing. Standing proudly alongside its ilk ([i]OFF[/i], [i]LISA[/i], [i]Space Funeral[/i], [i]Yume Nikki[/i], [i]Earthbound[/i], [i]Undertale[/i], [i]Oneshot[/i], and [i]Omori[/i]) [i]Hylics[/i] more than deserves every second you spend with it.

I'll always love my moon man and his band.

review: The weirdness was the main draw, but what kept me playing were the interesting and useful abilities, the emergent "roles" each character fills (support, DPS, etc.), the ever useful powers the simplicity of progression, and the rewarding exploration. Even if the visuals are off-putting, give it a try if you want a great turn-based RPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028095332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1622000190}
review:
tl,dr this game is strange and a little tedious but I generally like it. Looking forward to seeing what new ideas are in Hylics 2.

I did a complete playthrough which you can watch here:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLBJVs5UQ4mIq_y75CM4yZo_pf8YBGX0N9

What I liked:
* Unique and interesting art style with low-bit claymation images
* impressionist dialogue gives a weird tone
* occasional strangely direct humor (warm burritos, etc)
* rotoscoped crazy hand symbol spells
* enemy permadeath means you're always progressing at least a little bit
* death/resurrection and leveling systems are appropriately strange and convenient
* music is very fitting, though sometimes the guitar distortion can get a bit grating over the longer stretches. I still get the shop music melody stuck in my head and I like it.

What I didn't like:
* you can feel the rpg maker at times, particularly with overworld movement and combat
* when you strip away the generated dada text and absurd designs and the strangeness wears off, the overall game is a pretty standard rpg with gathering party members, learning spells/leveling, tackling dungeons, and fighting bosses. None of that is necessarily bad, but I think the two elements could have been meshed a bit better. 
* the graveyard felt like a bit of a slog
* sometimes the dialogue is giving you very straightforward directions, and at other times is just spewing nonsense. The generated text almost starts to feel coherent, like certain words might have some allusions to a plot/worldbuilding, but after a while started consciously ignoring it because it didn't have any impact on the gameplay/progression.

Overall I think the strengths of the game outweighed the negatives. The dev definitely has a great art style, music, and command of tone, and I hope the gameplay can match. To date I've played Hylics, Muldulamulom, and a couple of the flash games and have purchased but haven't started playing Hylics 2, so I'm looking forward to seeing how the dev progresses as a designer.

author: {'steamid': '76561199006145573', 'num_games_owned': 60, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1626974760}
review: Unlike most other RPGs, this game is what I can only describe as "funkyee". The atmosphere of it all is strangely calming, and the visuals are the definition of eye candy. I just bought it not too long ago and it's already one of my favorites. (And it's only $2.99, come on! With this much quality it should at least be $5.00, man...)

author: {'steamid': '76561198312642789', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1626560300}
review:
Hylics è un RPG fatto con RPG Maker con una grafica psichedelica quasi privo di trama. E' la "storia" del girovagare di Wayne in un mondo futuristico dove gli umani sono estinti. La sensazione che si avverte, da giocatore, è un esplorare una galleria d'arte, dove l'artista è l'autore del videogioco, fino a raggiungerne la fine divertendosi almeno un po'. Potrebbero dare fastidio i dialoghi insensati, ma tutto sommato non c'è male.

Mi è piaciuto? Sì, abbastanza. Non è un capolavoro, ma è molto carino.
Lo consiglierei ad altri utenti? Dipende.
Se siete alla ricerca di un qualcosa unico, molto insolito (alle volte anche un po' troppo) questo gioco fa per voi;
Se invece cercate il classico RPG con trama, che vi faccia affezionare ai personaggi e abbia un finale sensato, allora puntate ad altro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146154051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1614526262}
review:
O que mais gostei e Hylics, foi o visual único - misturado com o fato do jogo ter sido feito com massinha de modelar -, psicodélico, surrealista e a música.

O jogo é tão estranho, que chega a dar medo em alguns momentos. Cada boneco é bem bizarro e você se depara com alguns que conseguem ser piores ainda. As lutas são baseadas em turnos e em status de efeito, o que leva um tempo até você pegar a manha de como derrotar aquele boneco chato, que já te matou umas 500x. 

Apesar de ter finalizado, não entendi a história e não curti o processo, mas minha avaliação é positiva justamente pela arte, que me encantou. Pelo preço, vale a pena se você quiser ficar louco, sem precisar usar drogas e nem sair de casa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124227720', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1626401679}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992880692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1626399900}
review:
Hylics gameplay wise is a simple, basic, fairly mediocre JRPG. You run around in an overworld and in cities, and when you meet a hostile creature, a turn based battle starts. Over the course of the game you also get a few characters that join your crew. Your characters have HP and mana for abilities, you decide their equipment, there are status effects like stun and poison. Its actually competently made, nothing is broken, it all works and scales. But it does feel very been there done that.

As you probably noticed from the screenshots though, style wise it is anything but mundane. The game uses a mixed media art, including a lot of claymation. Most creatures in the game look like someone took an action figure and heaped some clay on them, then took a picture and compressed the crap out of the file... and I'm not entirely sure that isn't exactly what happened. The music and sound effects are equally cheap, strange, crappy, and unique. What I wasn't expecting though is the utter nonsense of the story and dialogue. Most of the text you are given is incomprehensible, randomly generated word salad. In the screen shots text is featured that makes sense and is funny. That is the exception. The vast majority of text you get is like "The People hoist in Gland. The convexity must be stopped above a mountain". The story, if there even is one, makes no sense and is impossible to follow. You run around and hope to find the next area, maybe a shop or secret along the way, that's it. 

It would be easy to dismiss the art and style of this game as random nonsense... well a lot of it really IS random nonsense. But its somehow cohesive. It reminds me, of all things, of being a teenager in the 80s or 90s growing up on MTV. Everything looks off, and deep-fried, like the edgy stuff on MTV before the internet. You heat up a lot of frozen burritos, you learn moves from TVs, the watercoolers you find are strange and mysterious but you can learn to use them eventually, some of the backgrounds appear to be parking lots... it all somehow fits in. It all screams juvenile and being stupid for the fun of it.

The other side of the coin is the contemporary art angle. The deconstruct meaning, reject logic, what even is beauty approach. Which is, of course, often pretentious and crap. I'm not sure to what extent the creator was setting out to make art and make a statement, but there are at least some clever designs and quips that you can at least ponder it while playing. Is this pile of squiggles representative of man's suffering? Or is it just dog poop? You decide.

Its a unique experience and since it is very cheap, I guess I will recommend it. It helps to be familiar with RPGs and be open minded to unconvential art though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992125809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1495949830}
review:
I'm normally not one for short reviews, but frankly, Hylics defies description. On the bright side, most of what you're getting, you can see! Litterally. Graphically Hylics is incredible, and if you're into the willfully bizarre, Hylics has you covered there too, with the majority of design work in the game being extremely abstract, and with most of the text effectively being a random word generator; I later learned this is a part of the plot, but it doesn't change the fact that you won't understand a word anyone is saying.

One might expect me to give the game grief for is combat, but honestly? It does alright. I wouldn't buy the game for the combat, or anything, but it's not a mash attack fest either.

Ultimately? Great game, if you can get into the vibe it's putting down. If you look at the trailer and aren't interested by the graphical style, it likely won't do anything to change your mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083856285', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1053, 'last_played': 1695256643}
review:
No sé si será mi gusto por las cosas extrañas mientras no me encuentro lúcido o la incesante búsqueda de juegos cortos y atrayentes que logren acallar temporalmente mi alma gamer sin tiempo libre de adulto pero Hylics ,desde su trailer, me atrapó tal red de araña sobre mi inocente mente de mosca que luchaba por escapar; inyectando ese veneno paralizante para permitir a mi cerebro la total libertad de fundirse en una amalgama de elementos visuales e incongruencias surrealistas, que logran cuestionar la física de las cosas convencionales, para finalmente ser digerido por mi subconsciente y exclamar "Woah, estoy demasiado dr0g*** para jugar esto." *COMPRAR*

Hablando del juego, te gusta o no te gusta lo que miras. Es choqueante, no te avisa lo que debes hacer y dentro de tu curiosidad deberás armarte la historia en un particular lugar que si no nos ofreciera los elementos básicos del RPG ya estaríamos ante uno de los puzzles más extraños que puedes encontrar como videojuego.  Esta obra de Mason Lindroth personalmente hablando me recuerda bastante a los elementos de la televisión infantil y sus experimentos en animación que podrían ofrecerte programas como Kablam! de Nickelodeon o aquellos CD de videojuegos de los '90, que gozaban de extravagancia y colores explosivos, que dan un caracter único y danzante a Hylics en su entorno como en las batallas que lo separan de los clásicos RPG y su estética fotográfica fija.

Ni pienses en la ayuda de los NPC, primero que nada necesitarás tener un manejo del inglés para contextualizar tu situación y segundo, todo lo que te dirán serán incongruencias (en su mayoria) por lo que tu mejor guía será la curiosidad y el querer concluir este viaje para ver que le deparará a Wayne, nuestro insipiente y callado protagonista.

Para concluir y por ese precio,  darle la oportunidad a una de las creaciones más extrañas y psicodélicas que podrías experimentar fuera del alcance de lo ilícito --¿o dentro?, allá tú-- es una forma de enfrentar a tus concepciones y limitantes de lo que esperarías fuese un juego común y corriente que espero, despierte esa ansia de querer más porque joyas como esta no se encuentran todos los días.

¿Qué más agregar? Ah si. Tiene una de las mejores secuencias "Game Over" que haya visto.

review: Quite possibly the most bizarre game you'll ever play. Despite there being barely any comprehensible dialogue to help you along, the plot is pretty easy to follow and the art/animation makes everything worth exploring. Got absolutely destroyed by the enemies at the start but since dying is basically a mechanic and allows you to raise your max health, even losing doesn't get annoying. Plus, the soundtrack is boppin. Pretty chill and I'll definitely be playing the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118053906', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1636626359}
review:
Hylics is without description.
I'm not even sure how you're suppose to discuss it. I'm not sure how I'd go about recommending this to people.
Did I even like this game? I enjoyed it, I think?

It expertly toes the line between what does and doesn't make sense. I never in my life thought there could be an uncanny valley of things making sense, but that's where we're at right now.

e: I think that's truly the beauty of Hylics 1, is that it's a game that doesn't have deep themes, it's nonsense with the implication of greater meaning making people think really hard about it to figure out what it's trying to communicate - in other words, its deep theme is not having a deep theme. Pareidolia and stuff, we as humans find meaning in places where there isn't any, and to me, that's the meaning, as I as a human tried to find meaning in Hylics.

It's a very short game. The JRPG traditional turn-based combat is actually quite engaging for what little time you have to play with it, with many strategies to discover and enemy formations that challenge you and force you to adapt. 
Hylics 2 is much tighter in this regard all around, though I will say that Hylics 1 is more "focused", and I believe has a lot more possible routes one could take. You can do a lot of things in a lot of different orders.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985235696', 'num_games_owned': 1927, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1624733035}
review:
RPGMaker games are prrt prrt, well there's always some expectations to the rule. Hylics is one of them and think unique is very fitting description for it. Colourful and sometimes pixelated clay world with it's meat melting denizens are pretty wacky to look at and it gameplay is pretty simple with arrow keys/esc/spacebar -> navigating/going back/doing stuff.

There's some kind of story going on with in three acts which took bit over 4 hours to go through and did visit all areas of the game, though pretty sure didn't use at least two of the water coolers, as didn't have paper cups for them. There is city, pair of houses, plains and enemy filled areas in the world map to go through. To get all three companions Wayne needs to either help them or beat them or something in line of those two thing along with gaining access to the areas. They do help quite much in combat especially with beefier boss guys who are there in some number and ghosts which are quite annoying to deal with.

Basically if you have played Lisa it's pretty similar concept in combat and then having different kinds of armor/weapon/buff items to give to the team to use. Television around world give new magic skills for everyone to use and there are steroid kind of things to buff melee dmg, water coolers give more will to use magics and in death there is progress by meat whacked out of enemies and throw in grinder to get own health pool higher. Basic health/magic/revive and likewise items are included for combat use.

Basically very simple and easy game to get in, but quite unique style in art and doesn't punish one for failing instead pushes back a bit to go at it again after taking a nap meat smoothie and nap on sofa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279580858', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1624770855}
review:
[h1] 재밌냐고 물으면 평범했다고 답해주고 싶은 게임. [/h1]

스토리와 그래픽을 빼면 평범한 JRPG작품이다. 난이도도 매우 쉽고 게임오버 자체가 없다...
그래도 완전 못할 수준은 아니었기에 따봉을 누른거지 절대 무언가를 기대하고 플레이할 게임은 아닌거 같다.

2000~2010년대당시 난해한 쯔꾸르게임이 유행했고 이 작품도 그쪽 부류인듯 하다.
이런류를 좋아한다면 재밌어할지도 모르겠지만 당신이 2020년대 게임에 익숙하다면 그냥저냥한 쯔꾸르게임일 뿐일거다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025488540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1624693634}
review:
what an unfortunate release date hylics has: october 2nd 2015, just seventeen days after the release of undertale. it is an unfortunate competition they two unwittingly found themselves competing in, though only one even aware of it at all. the public can really only handle one type of hyper fixation on a release of its genre/medium at a time as far as discussions go, and undertale was a ridiculously long lasting one--hylics didn't stand a chance. yet it is interesting to see both in the context of what toby fox has previously said on his making of undertale: he thought of it simply being a Cool Little Indie RPG destined to obscurity to all but Cool Little Indie RPG Playing People. this didn't happen, and it was instead hylics' fate to sit on the same trophy shelf as barkley: gaiden and space funeral.

but none of this is a bad thing as long as every devs' bills were paid. as far as art goes, there's a space for both. hylics certainly wields a unique aesthetic unlike just about anything else bar the few other claymation focused video games. it's that clay aesthetic meshed with the mspaint binary brush that creates very interesting, captivating environments and designs. the world only gets weirder with those that inhabit it, both you, spontaneous bathtaker and couch sitter that you are, and the enemies, npcs, and companions scattered around. you look weird--they talk weird. the sort of incomprehensible waxing of incomprehensible poetry happens quite a lot throughout hylics, and it serves to complement the times in which the game loosens its shoulders a bit and plays a joke completely straight.

hylics has a good sense of humor, and it's got an even better combat system. just that it works, really, and is more mechanically stimulating than space-bar-to-win off or the forgettably standard system of aforementioned space funeral, or the complete absence of any system at all like a la ib. you've got an array of spells that can be expanded on the more and more you... watch television, and there's a number of strategies you can pursue to take on enemies (or i assume, anyway. there's a lot of spells. i just kind of used the sleep one a lot). the actual pacing from enemies beating you down to you beating them down to then a good middle ground of eventual but distinguished progress until finally becoming a beat down champion is... really, really good! so good that the game doesn't drag its heels even once, the moment to moment happening at just the pace you want it at.

that said, not all of my thoughts are glowing. while the writing is a balancing act of mostly gibberish and occasional surrealistic zings, it's also all not really too interesting. there's never any sense of stakes or even a "thing" that hooks you. the cast of hylics sort of do things arbitrarily until it's the end. maybe that fits the overall feel of the world, but it's also kind of boring in itself and leaves you feeling nothing much post ending.  i don't know, it was just a general sort of "well, i guess that's it then." compare and contrast with, say, barkley and the absolutely insane buildup to its conclusion, and said conclusion being delivered via pure chaos. meanwhile, hylics is... again, just arbitrarily over. perhaps the most offensive part of the game is its real lack of character from the characters! as in, no one in your party says a damn thing once they join your crew. actually, there's one moment very early on in which a character [i]does[/i]... and then never again. that sucks, man. paper mario: ttyd had this shit figured out. barkley had it figured out. final fantasy games older than any of these had it figured out, jesus. have them talk.

hylics is definitely captivating besides the missteps in writing. my eyes glazed over at the top steam review going "lololol drugs" because hylics is genuinely just bursting with creativity of its own right and really doesn't deserve to be dude weeded. it's smartly designed, appropriately paced, and you feel like you got something cool out of it even if the finish line only comes and goes.

4/5

有志の方が日本語化Modを作成されています。

author: {'steamid': '76561198246278600', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1604282830}
review:
This game truly is special.

Hylics is a RPGMaker shortventure set in a desolate world. You play as Wayne, a yellow crescent-shaped man on a quest to kill Gibby, the lord of the Moon. Sound intriguing? It certainly is. 

The first thing you will notice about Hylics is the art style. Rough claymations of bizzare amalgams and dithered images of real objects fill up the world of Hylics. The feeling this style creates is second to none in terms of uniqueness and eclectic-ness. It's almost like the game presents you with a visual challenge: can you determine what you are looking at? Are they human digestive tracks? Fleshy poles? Or just lumps of lifeless matter strewn about? Much is left to the imagination, and that improves on the game's theme: nonsense.

You see, this game actually has very little story apart from the little snippet of information above. NPC dialogue is randomly generated and never makes any sense. Only other party members and Gibby speak in somewhat sensible dialect. I personally feel like this is the weakest point of the game, as I prefer more story-intensive RPGs, but this barely affects the player's experience. The point of the dialogue is to immerse you in this dream-like world, and it succeeds in doing so.

The RPG gameplay is also standard, though I have to admit I enjoyed the different characters and abilities they wielded. Each attack has an animation that is always very pleasing (and usually weird) to look at, and this made combat fresh. So no complaints.

The absolute crowning jewel on this game is the soundtrack. My god. Never before have I heard such shoegaze/LoFi/noise rock executed in such a way as the stuff on this soundtrack. The subtly of House, Map 1, Tomb, and Ruins compliment the nonchalant, laid-back mood of the overworld. The frantic-ness of Messy Song Boss, and Theremin and Drums hypes the player up for many quirky battles against otherworldly foes. The beauty of Afterlife brings to mind a sunny summer morning, where the light shines through the windows and you have no motivation to do anything. And the crowning jewel of this soundtrack is the final boss battle music, Gibby. A motivating melody is interwoven with rough electric guitars and off-tempo drums to create a song truly representative of this game. It's perfect.

I think the main reason why people tend to dislike this game is because they expect a game. However, Hylics is so much more than that. At a playtime of <2hrs, and a low price point of $3 USD, this game is an experience that will stick with you for many years. Mason Lindroth has created something truly magical here, and I urge many people to play this game.

tl;dr: good

review: Hylics looks like the result of a third-grade art class being given an unlimited supply of modeling clay and psychedelic drugs. It's weird, it's oddly terrifying at times, it makes absolutely no sense, and it's one of the best games I've ever played. Not just because of the gameplay, but because of the spectrum of reactions from just joining a discord call and letting people try to comprehend the sheer absurdity that they're watching. 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198197388428', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1606659932}
review:
Une très bonne surprise si vous appréciez les J-RPG ! Ne vous laissez pas intimider par son aspect surréaliste, car si l’univers est complètement à l’ouest, les mécaniques restent assez classiques. 



Pour l’univers justement, que ça soit au niveau des environnement, des ennemis, des musiques ou des dialogues, on est face à un délire onirique (voire psychédélique) intrigant et relaxant. Et le tout est fait à partir de sculptures en argile numérisées !

Les animations d’attaque (très jolies) sont faites en rotoscopie, et les poétiques dialogues sont générées aléatoirement, à l’exception de ceux nécessaires à la progression.



Quand au gameplay, son aspect old-school est nuancé par de quelques petites particularité, tel que : 

- Le système de progression (que vous découvrirez vite) qui rend obsolète la notion de farming et d’échec.

- Le (très) petit “open-world”, juste ce qu’il faut pour avoir à explorer, mais qui permet de facilement deviner la prochaine destination par élimination.



Hylics, avant d’être un jeu est une expérience, dans le sens ou ce n’est pas un jeu qui vous occupera des heures, ou qui nécessitera de l’investissement. C’est pourquoi on le fini à 100% en 4 heures, ou que la mort n’est pas punitive. 

A côté de ça il nous propose une aventure zen et surréaliste, mais sans jamais être au détriment du gameplay, et une fois arrivé à court d’idée, il se conclut sans essayer de rallonger la sauce inutilement.

On écoute alors une dernière fois la musique de l’écran-titre, la grave dans notre mémoire, puis on désinstalle le jeu, en se disant qu’on a passé un bon moment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198226397792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1654545583}
review: Short and sweet, Hylics is definitely worth the price. Its charming claymation visuals and surreal setting make it interesting from start to end. There really is not any point in the game where it feels like you have to grind, which I find to be one of the worst parts of any RPG. Encounters are engaging, and the unique systems of strengthening your characters are refreshing and enjoyable. For three dollars, Hylics is definitely worth it. I will be playing the sequel when I get the chance!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005107781', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1621115949}

author: {'steamid': '76561198123981788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1620918160}
review:
독특한 그래픽에 기묘한 배경 음악, 그리고 뜻을 헤아리기 어려운 대사와 내용을 가지고 있습니다.
본인은 괴랄한 형태의 게임을 좋아하기에 크게 부담없이 재밌게 플레이했습니다.
내용물은 전형적인 턴제 배틀 JRPG의 형태며 어렵지 않은 퍼즐을 가지고 있습니다.
난이도는 쉬운 편이며, 플레이타임도 빠르게 직진으로 진행하면 2시간 정도 나오므로, 가볍게 즐길 수 있습니다.
그래픽이 마음에 들지 않는다면 당연히 구매하지 않겠지만, 그래픽 때문에 기괴하게 느껴져 플레이에 거부감을 느끼시는 분들도 있을 것 같습니다.
게임보단 작품... 즉 시각적인 즐거움이 좀 더 있는 편입니다.
흔들거리는 것에 예민한 경우, 다소 멀미를 일으킬 수 있는 연출과 배경이 많으므로 플레이 시 주의하시길 바랍니다.

review:
A great game. Short and sweet. Engaging visually, with likable characters and good gameplay. I particularly love the music, which is strange yet enjoyable and complements the game perfectly.

Hylics 2 is the popular one, but you seriously should play this one first. It's great in its own way. It really adds a lot to the story and characters and made my experience with the sequel that much better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208905663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1653190286}
review: For the price and the time it takes to complete. It's pretty worth it. Some of the battles at the start can be kind of annoying until you get more than one character. The status effects are hell at the beginning. I think the devs were aware of this and add a special attack to help with this, so the battles become pretty chill. I don't think its main focus was the rpg elements. Its focus is on the surreal aesthetics. This is where the game really shines. If you're looking for a unique and surreal experience, you should give this game a go.

review: Hylics is truly an experience, the unique art style, soundtrack, and dialogue though odd at first, grabbed my attention and forced me to finish the game in a single sitting. Although short, the turn based combat and quirky nature of the game will probably draw me back to it from time to time. The detail in each level and the commitment to such a unique aesthetic screams how passionate the developer was in creating Hylics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017289101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1618364343}
review: It's exactly as advertised, and such a  low price I'd have a hard time arguing against buying this game if you're even slightly intrigued. Hylics is mostly an atmospheric game with very light jrpg mechanics for good measure. You explore the bizarre and compelling claymation world while searching for new party members, gear and abilities. The jrpg elements provide some added incentive to explore the world, the rest will come from your desire to explore the strange environs that Mason Lindroth crafted. It's short, sweet and to be honest better experienced as blind as possible. If it looks at all interesting to you just take the plunge and experience it for yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561199006318708', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1632443296}
review: A short and sweet rpg experience. Loved the unique visuals and soundtrack, really gets you immersed into the world. Enemy encounters can get a bit repetitive and tedious, but they can be dodged and overall its really fun to explore this weird world.  Definitely worth the 3 dollars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074984307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1618103085}
review: This game is like if someone really wanted to make a game that played like Earthbound, but dropped acid right before they started the process. If there is a real story, it's hard to find it, but it doesn't matter because it's more about the tone and atmosphere of the world. You're essentially playing through a fever dream like world with a great soundtrack, fun combat, and truly unique visual style. For $2.99 this has to be one of the better deals I've seen on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198357137800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1616041722}
review:
This game still holds for my absolute favourite style in any game i've played. Although it was very short, somewhat confusing with the story, and just missing a lot in general due to being made in RPG maker, it makes up for it with it's amazing battle animations and art. The music is very strange, which is perfect for the game's style and atmosphere. Yet another amazing indie RPG to appreciate for it's really creative style, as well as the small details put into everything, which is why I think it still holds up today.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198122031050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1616862488}
review:
10 коробок сока из унитаза из 10
Удивительная игра, забавная, очень атмосферная благодаря психоделическим ландшафтам, персонажам, так же музыка кайфовая, любимая сцена в начале в ванной с двумя тараканами, музыка, непередаваемые ощущения. 
На счет текста, я понимал от силы 50%, но это не помешало получить удовольствие от игры
Еще понравилась боевка и как скилы визуализируются

author: {'steamid': '76561198336737684', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1605635952}
review:
El juego es bueno~, pero es un gusto adquirido, por así decirlo, dudo que si no tienes interés en el juego o las cosas surrealistas te llegué a agradar, aparte de eso, el juego cumple lo que ofrece, lo más notorio es su trabajo artístico, el juego se ve bastante bien y tiene efectos muy interesantes, aparte de tener una gran cantidad de animaciones in-combat que lo hacen más entretenido de jugar y hablando de eso.
El combate esta mejor pensado de lo que uno esperaría, no es el combate más complejo ni profundo, pero las peleas te hacen pensar por la poca ventaja que tienes y cumple más de lo esperado, eso sí, el jefe final es un chiste, jaja
Y el texto aleatorio esta curioso, pero a veces no sabes que hacer o cuando te dicen algo significativo, pero igual es difícil perderse, el mapa el bastante sencillo si acaso se hecha en falta un botón de correr, pero tampoco es la cosa.

Si te llama la atención seguro que te lo pasas bien, pero si buscas jugar un rpg más convencional probablemente no te llame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034896378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1606704034}
review:
This game reminded me of art school in the worst way possible. Visually, this is an rpg game that cannot be topped. I'm sure that the developer spent virtually no time writing randomized, nonsensical, pretentious reddit-speak into the dialogue boxes compared to the amount of time spent on the animations, claymation, and artistic direction. So I can appreciate it for the art. But besides that, the music was quirky to the point of "I'm not like other girls" and the game itself had no significant narrative devices whatsoever. I couldn't focus for even half an hour. It means nothing, it does nothing, it's just flashy performance art. 

It's sad because I genuinely went in with the intention of liking this game. But gosh it is hard to like when I paid for it and it gave me nothing stimulating at all, and there are games in the rpg world like OFF which are FREE and I replay often, just to relive the experience. Fancy graphics don't make the game, that's all boys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198955424380', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1614445177}
review:
Chrysippus of Soli was a Greek Stoic philosopher. He was a native of Soli, Cilicia, but moved to Athens as a young man, where he became a pupil of Cleanthes in the Stoic school. When Cleanthes died, around 230 BC, Chrysippus became the third head of the school. A prolific writer, Chrysippus expanded the fundamental doctrines of Zeno of Citium, the founder of the school, which earned him the title of Second Founder of Stoicism.

Chrysippus excelled in logic, the theory of knowledge, ethics, and physics. He created an original system of propositional logic in order to better understand the workings of the universe and role of humanity within it. He adhered to a deterministic view of fate, but nevertheless sought a role for personal freedom in thought and action. Ethics, he thought, depended on understanding the nature of the universe, and he taught a therapy of extirpating the unruly passions which depress and crush the soul. He initiated the success of Stoicism as one of the most influential philosophical movements for centuries in the Greek and Roman world.

Chrysippus threw himself eagerly into the study of the Stoic system. His reputation for learning among his contemporaries was considerable. He was noted for intellectual audacity and self-confidence and his reliance on his own ability was shown, among other things, in the request he is supposed to have made to Cleanthes: "Give me the principles, and I will find the proofs myself." He succeeded Cleanthes as head of the Stoic school when Cleanthes died, in around 230 BC.

Chrysippus was a prolific writer. He is said to rarely have gone without writing 500 lines a day and he composed more than 705 works. His desire to be comprehensive meant that he would take both sides of an argument and his opponents accused him of filling his books with the quotations of others. He was considered diffuse and obscure in his utterances and careless in his style, but his abilities were highly regarded, and he came to be seen as a preeminent authority for the school.

Chrysippus died upon witnessing a donkey eat his figs, while watching said donkey consume these figs he burst out into laughter. He laughed for so long he eventually fell over and began foaming at the mouth, later dying.

author: {'steamid': '76561199047584100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1613964191}
review:
Masta-piece
It's not too terribly often when I find a game that captures and engrosses me from moment one till the very end. Hylics does this in spades. It's not necessarily the hardest game, the longest, nor the most groundbreaking. What this game does do, however, is give you an unforgettable journey with wacky, funny writing and visuals that will keep your jaw dropped. Don't even get me started on the soundtrack, I will be listening to it for the next few weeks at the very least. I can't wait to see what Hylics 2 has in store for me. Mr. Lindroth, I would give you a hi-five for the awesome game you've made.

author: {'steamid': '76561198979703013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1594792829}
review: As a person who doesn't enjoy very many RPG's, Hylics is one of the most impressive and wonderfully quirky games I've ever played and finished. What really sells this game to me and I think many others is the art style. I can't think of very many other games with this same creative clay look. Hylics truly feels unique in the realm of simple computer RPG's. The music and dialog also contributes to the zany world of the game, in the best way possible, it feels like a fever dream. If you enjoy turn based RPG's, I recommend Hylics all the way. It's a gem that needs to be seen.

review: One fever dream of a game, but a good one. For as long as it lasted, one of the most refreshing and intriguing games i've played in a while. The difficulty is low and dying more of a useful mechanic (fast travel and 'leveling') than punishment, making this more of a relaxing experience than a challenging game to beat. Due to its heavy focus on visuals and OST, his 'recreational program with RPG elements' could also be described as a playable piece of art.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031752003', 'num_games_owned': 645, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1613272734}
review:
Incredibly weird and strangely compelling. More polished than it looks. Short. Save anywhere. My only complaint is that it doesn't seem to support controllers.

If the Butthole Surfers and Mr Bungle collaborated on an RPG in the mid 90s, it might've turned out like this.

review: i feel like this game was made just for me. it captures everything i love about art... its so weird and colourful and WEIRD. it reminds me of the film Fantastic Planet... its my most favorite thing ive ever witnessed as a person... its all incredible. the art, the music, the story.... nothing will ever top this for me. i will also say, i actually prefer this game to Hylics 2. there's a special charm about it being less polished. rough around the edges. i. just. love. it. good day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100964309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1613031019}
review:
I honestly have no idea of how this game got on my radar, but if you've managed to find it, chances are you're already the kind of person who wants to play it. Hylics combines claymation, abstract art (also made of clay (mostly)), and free-form music and poetry, with a turn based combat system to create a vibe that reminds me of artists like CBoyardee or PilotRedSun. In other words, this is an interactive piece of abstract art that includes video game mechanics as a feature.

I could never live with myself for giving an insane indie game like this a negative review. But to completely honest, I just fuckin' hate abstract art and prose. I seriously can't bring myself to play even another minute. Sorry Mason, but it's just not my cup of tea, and this is one unique brew to say the least. 

However, Hylics is really far from bad- it knows exactly what it is, and it's made well enough to never annoy you with bugs. It's also incredible how the dev managed to make a majority of the assets from clay and import them into the game without making them have the usual janky appearance that rough clay artwork has. 

So if you like feeling weird, looking at a bunch of weird clay shapes, and reading weird dialogue that doesn't really make sense most of the time and uses a bunch of weird words that you've never heard before and cannot really discern the meaning of because the definition of those words is confusing in of themselves (seriously what the fuck does "ablative" mean), then Hylics is definitely for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198497543120', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1611848545}
review:
Hylics is self-described as “a recreational program with light JRPG elements.” I can firmly say that the “recreational” descriptor is 100% accurate; this game is the most surreal experience I’ve had in gaming thus far. Although the game can purportedly be beaten in 2 hours, I took my time exploring and my final feelings are that of bewilderment and longing for more. For a mere $3, this is certainly an experience worth the entry fee. 



[h1]STORY[/h1]
It is difficult to describe the story as: [list]
[*]There is very little actual plot

[*]The game is quite short 

[*]It is all told in ornate gibberish

[*]Said gibberish is randomized every time you reload [/list]

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2361082179
To start, the game opens up with gibberish exposition and mentions “Gibby, King of the Moon” who is a tyrant and is doing something. You are Wayne, a yellow creature with a horned head, clad in what appears to be a black leather biker outfit. Wayne is a mostly silent protagonist; you get a bit of a sense of his personality in dialogue choices and his descriptions of items/ actions. 

The “story” that follows is Wayne's adventures. You will meet the strange denizens of the world and eventually make your way into various dungeons, make allies and explore the world map. Only important NPCs talk regularly to give you some info, but they are rather far and few. Everyone else speaks in very sophisticated yet very meaningless word salad. The other gibberish Act title cards all convey that Gibby is continuing to do this... thing. Actually trying to rationalize the story is an exercise in pungent futility as the vocalization of wind concludes the north. Just sit back and enjoy caressing the clavicle race of fleeting branch oceans and trusty seats, Wayne.  



[h1]GAMEPLAY[/h1]
Hylics’ gameplay is like that of a traditional RPG- you explore the world, beat enemies and beat the Big Bad at the end. Nonetheless, its weirdness also seeps into this part. To start, you do NOT gain experience in this game, only money at the end of battle. Thus, getting stronger is all about increasing your Meat stat, which is your HP, and Mightiness, your Attack (other stats have equally weird and more esoteric meanings). 

Meat is increased by buying and/or equipping better armors and certain equipment. OR you can harvest the Meat from your felled enemies and die. Upon regaining consciousness you can grind said Meat in The Afterlife, increasing your total HP. Death is the only way you can “level up” and you lose nothing upon death. For convenience, there are various teleportation crystals scattered through the world; you can teleport to any one of these from The Afterlife provided they are activated. Mightiness is gained from some rare-ish items and equipping stronger weapons.      
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2361074009
Combat is pretty generic turn-based JRPG fare you’d expect, but it is all incredibly outlandish due to the art direction and design philosophy. Your attacks are based around hand gestures and creating strange clay figures to cast spells (Powers). For example, a basic attack causes the hand to snap. Spells are learned by watching TVs and everyone in your current party learns the skill. Status effects are very powerful in this game and bosses can be affected as well. The standard stuff is all here but under weird names (damp= silence). MP can be easily restored so using all your abilities is highly encouraged. The game actually isn’t terribly difficult apart from the very beginning when you are essentially naked. The only real challenge is Gibby but that is to be expected. Encounters are finite- defeating an enemy symbol on the map removes the encounter from the rest of the game. Battles go at a pretty fast pace so there is a nice balance between adventuring and combat. 

Exploration is pretty standard- you have an overworld map and can enter points of interest. Dungeons are pretty standard with very light puzzles (if any); they are mostly a spectacle/ set pieces as a result. There are some obligatory insta-death obstacles that chase you but can be easily outmaneuvered. There are quite a few secrets in the form of collectables and secret paths but none are necessary for beating the game. Overall, gameplay is mostly just a way to immerse yourself in the world through exploration and confrontation with enemies.        

It took me around 3 and 1/2 hours to finish the game including secret digging but again, the game is often quoted at around 2 hours. 



[h1]VISUALS[/h1]
Hylics uses impressive digitized stop-motion claymation for most of its world and character models. A lot of bright and warm colors are used to create a very calming yet psychedelic feeling. Darker colors are usually reserved to making a specific thing pop, set a mood or for contrast/ shading. Each clay model has a very distinct personality and profile- it is hard to mix them up and each is quite striking. Clay animations are very smooth and give an extra layer of wonder and magic to the game. Much of this game’s appeal can be attributed to the creator, Mason Lindroth’s, distinct style. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2376148974 
Combat is a thrill due to all the various enemy models and animations that play. Battle backgrounds can vary from a digitized photo of what a appears to be a parking lot to more Earthbound-esque undulating and warbling colorful, abstract backgrounds. Using an item in combat also has a unique accompanying animation in Claymation as well. This led me to just use an item for the heck of it and enjoy a quirky and well-done animation. Despite all the weirdness of the world, everything feels very internally consistent art-wise and it is easy to get lost (in the good way). 



[h1]AUDIO[/h1]
Music can only be described as “yes” when asking about it. It is equal parts discordant, melodic and just plain weird. There is definitely a variety of “genres” and instruments available, but it doesn’t really matter when all are good at drawing you into the weirdness of the world. It really feels like you are going on a “trip” and makes it all the more gripping. There aren’t any sound effects except during battle or when you interact with something that makes the music almost like a character accompanying you on your journey as well. It takes a while to get acclimated to the music, but it really does give you a taste of a condensed Hylics adventure. Sounds effects are pretty standard fare but the weird ones are especially noteworthy. 
  


[h1]PERFORMANCE[/h1]
I had no issue just launching and running the game. That being said, as an RPG maker game, the amount of graphical and audio options is severely limited. While definitely disappointing, the game can be enjoyed as-is easily. 


[h1]OVERALL[/h1]
I honestly only heard whispers about this game when I found it and I can confidently say that “this isn’t a game, it’s an experience” as cheesy and predictable as that is. It honestly felt as if I were gazing into a surrealist painting and it pulled me into its world. From its bizarre characters and landscapes to its unintelligible story, I had a fun time once I gave into the weirdness. 

Although a short game, I will definitely remember it fondly. If you like surreal games or games that offer little guidance, the Hylic journey is worth it. Granted, while this sort of thing isn’t everyone’s enclave of marmalade, the zesty drawers of this game might just leave you begging for more.       


[h1][b] 7.5/ 10
SOLID RECOMMENDATION[/b][/h1]


[quote][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/7871885/]Follow our curator page,[b] OCG-Curations[/b], if you like and want to see more reviews like this one.[/url][/quote]

review:
It's a very cool game with wacky character designs, badass bgm and a very cool artstyle. I was a bit lost when I started the game but once you finally started doing tasks, that's where the fun begins. I love how dying is essential to the gameplay, that's a pretty cool and unique mechanic which makes you not actually get irritated when you die cause you benefit from it as well. I'm a bit saddened that the game was relatively short but pretty impressed cause it was made by only one person. Pretty inspiring!

10/10 Great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198352151094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1611466501}
review:
Love the surreal aesthetic sense of the game. The musics, the claymations, dialogues, interactions, designs, all contribute so well to the cool and weird surreal feelings of the game. Story and well, mostly everything is a little bit confusing but that is the point. The game mechanics revolve around classic turn-based RPG and using level system, but in my subjective opinion, you really don't really need to grind anything at all, gives you more time to enjoy the game.

TL;DR If you love RPG maker, scifi and surreal games, highly recommend Hylics. Going to try out Hylics 2 as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561199043468609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1611698798}
review: This game is amazing, literally one of the most fun games I've ever played, the combat is some of the best in a turn-based RPG. The weird surf rock, post rock, no wave, swans-like, rock, post-punk, ambient type soundtrack is amazing and adds such a huge vibe to this game. The clay models looks really cool and each character has their own personality even if they don't say much at all. Honestly one of the best experiences for a game I've ever had. Worth the extremely cheap price tag too. Amazing game

author: {'steamid': '76561198256935421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1611487725}
review: Completely bonkers. Full of innovative visual ideas, incredible artwork, a fantastic soundtrack, and really iconic characters/ideas, all in a palatable ~5 hour package. If you go in expecting a game with subversive gameplay or really meaningful subtext, you'll be disappointed. But, if you enjoy the typical RPG Maker gameplay format, there's a wealth of originality (and genuinely funny writing!) to be found here. Absolute must-play for anyone really into short indies. Also, it's $3, like seriously this is a steal.

author: {'steamid': '76561199124375995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1611629611}
review: Hylics is a incredibly experimental and abstract RPG this game is beyond insane it is indescribable its sooooo bizarre and weird which is absolutely great! The artwork is soooo cool you be walking up to stuff you touch it and it just melting in front of you so crazy. The plot and way characters talk is very cryptic and mysterious leading you to not really know whats going on and piece it together yourself. The game play is interesting because you don't gain XP at all and enemy's don't re spawn your stats are completely determined by the gear you have equipped except for your health which you can increase by getting meat from enemy drops, I love all the animation in combat for casting spells its super weird and cool! The music is great and really sets the tone of the game fantastically. Overall this game is just insane I highly recommend this game i'm definitely going to be checking out the second game!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198258038411', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1611538297}

author: {'steamid': '76561198230453480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1611201982}

author: {'steamid': '76561198383133678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1596244746}
review:
Had very little idea about what was actually going on a lot of the time, but it seems like there's an actual story in there (probably) so if you're the type of guy that likes to analyze these types of games, then this is for you! If you're not, it's still pretty fun, the art is great and the characters are endearing and cute.
I did feel in certain places that there'd be more to the game, and you might unnecessarily backtrack, but for a small game you can't really ask for more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029075979', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1608935705}
review:
[h1]It all runs together and never makes sense, but that's how we like it.[/h1]

"The Hylics walk" is literally a running gag between friends at this point.

The only game where talking to NPCs will confuse you more than give you any info, and where some guy will ask for money in order for you to borrow his bathtub for like 2 seconds not even.

Hylics 2: Coming soon to a Steam library near you.

review:
How happy is the bluish moonlight!
Down, down, down into the darkness of the moonlight,
Gently it goes - the dark- blue, the bluish, the chromatic.

I cannot help but stop and look at the nimbus cloud.
Does the cloud make you shiver?
does it?

I cannot help but stop and look at the zany daydream.
Does the daydream make you shiver?
does it?

author: {'steamid': '76561198095997869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1605554961}
review:
Hylics is a short and cheap game that is dwarfed by its sequel: Hylics 2. It's hard to say if Hylics 2 would have existed without the existence of Hylics 1, even if one is vastly superior to the other, so it would be hard to discredit this one. This game's soundtrack is odd, but there's a few in there that are nice to listen to, and the mechanics are simple, but served as a good foundation to what's ahead (according to what I've observed, I haven't gotten my hands on Hylics 2 yet).

It's quite a trip/10
