review: A surreal short RPG Maker game. This game has the most unique artstyle I have ever seen in my life. It consists of pixelized and digitized surreal claymation and frame by frame digitizations of photographs. The dialogue is nonsensical and it may be difficult to know where to go at first.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028711579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 284, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1594848735}
review:
As always, I wish Steam would allow for an in-between, but alas, I have to go for no.

This is a special kind of WTF-game. You know, the kind too-much-substance-abuse-nightmares can be like. WTF am I doing? WTF am I going? What is my objective? And it takes an absolute delight in just making you f_ing confused, and looking god awful while doing it.

It's art, I guess. And somewhat comedic. But it is also a mess that reminds me of everytime I fail at making dinner. It's edible, but no one in their right mind would volentarily eat it by the looks of it. Perhaps by the smell of it though...

I guess it's a matter of taste. This game is everything I tend to wanna avoid in games, because I allready feel confused about what to do and surrounded by ugly things in real life. But obviously, for many gamers this holds some sort of charm that I simply do not understand.

It's frickin' unique though, I give it that.

"If you wanna use the tub it's 25 bucks."
"Nah,"
"You stink!"

author: {'steamid': '76561198048200235', 'num_games_owned': 1264, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1671719040}
review:
Скажу без преувеличения - натуральная форма искусства, форма, заслуженно имеющая свое место в музее импрессионизма.
Хайликс - чрезвычайно специфическая игра, здесь странно абсолютно всё... И в этом ее великолепный шарм. 90% времени мы не понимаем, куда мы идем, зачем вообще идем, что делаем... Но как то это работает. А попутно любуемся великолепным окружением, выполненным из глины и пластилина.

9/10, игра, которую не стыдно назвать художественной работой, искусством. Досаждают разве что некоторые геймплейно-интерфейсные промахи, но они настолько незначительны, что даже не стоит заострять на них внимание.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014787249', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1594774125}
review:
This is the one of, if not the, most bizarre games I've ever played, but it was completely worth it. The story is simple but obscured by the random text generated throughout the majority of the game. In a nutshell: [spoiler]moon tyrant bad, go kill him[/spoiler]. Once you know what's happening, it's a fun sort of meta-game to try to justify story-wise whatever the hell the random generator spits out. The visual style is probably what got you here and absolutely what makes this game worth playing: the majority is some psychadelic claymation with only a few environments and attacks drawn with sprites. It's worth buying just to look at, honestly. The music follows this trend with a sound not unlike it was made by a stoner barely holding onto consciousness as he plucked at his guitar. That is meant in a purely complimentary manner.

The gameplay is one of the simplest JRPG-like formulas I've ever played. There are only three stats that matter: health (Flesh), mana (Will), and attack (Mightiness). When you kill a monster, you get meat to trade for Flesh the next time you die. Once you find a certain party member, you gain the ability to interact with certain world objects to increase your Will. You can increase all of these stats with equipment. You don't actually gain experience points and level up: exploration finds you all of the new abilities you can unlock in the game through watching TV sets, and the Flesh/Will upgrades are independent of any experience system. Death is exceptionally forgiving, since all you lose is however much distance you had covered since your last (generously placed) respawn point.

Overall, the game is absolutely worth the 3 dollar price point. My first playthrough came out to just over 3 hours, and I went through one last time to be a min-maxy piece of shit and trivialize the final encounter for funsies. The whole thing kind of comes off as a bit of a lampoon on the JRPG genre: instead of guiding the player incessantly and telling you where to be, the game drops you into a pastel hellscape and tells you: "Fuck if I know dawg, find your own path." The number-crunchy formula most JRPGs adapt is reduced to three numbers. The useless NPC chatter in the overworld is treated (mostly) as just that: useless chatter.

Honestly, my only regret is that I didn't have anything to trip on as I played through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130759250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1661664572}
review:
Never before have I played a game that made me ask "What in the fresh fuck am I playing?" 
It is so surreal and captivating with its bizarre world. The pastel colors, groovy animations, and chill music keeps me glued to it and wanting to explore every nook an cranny. I'm absolutely hypnotized. The dialogue of the NPCs is really confusing, yet beautifully poetic. 
You play this for the experience. The journey is very much so what you come here for. 
Also, DON'T EXPECT TO WIN YOUR FIRST COUPLE OF FIGHTS! Wonder around for cash, buy some items, and stare at every TV screen you can to get all your moves (and look at the same screens again with every party member you acquire)

If you like bizarre, yet creatively artsy games, you'll definitely love this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064517953', 'num_games_owned': 729, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1620837964}
review:
Juegardo duro.

La estética es muy bonita (bastante flashera), la animación es excelente (todos los poderes, items y ataques son hermoso y MUY FLASHEROS) y la música también, muy rara. Tiene un toque de noise rock ponele (no tan noise) mezclado con algo medio dark ambientoso y espacial. Muy bueno.
La historia es muy rara, sos Wayne un wachin que sale a buscar no se que y los personajes te hablan con frases confusas que supongo tendrán un "significado profundo" (aunque la mayoría de las cosas parece tirada de fruta dura). Las teles te dan poderes que podes usar en batalla y te vas encontrando aliados a lo largo del camino.
No entendiste un choto? Yo tampoco, pero la pase piola.
Es cortito el juego y no me acuerdo cuanto lo pague pero vale la pena seguro.
Hasta te podes armar una bandita indie y pegarla en el antro mas cercano.

Le doy un puntaje de 4 cuatro personajes raros sobre cinco.

EDIT: Luego de entrar a la pagina de la tienda de Steam leí que una de sus características era "-Overuse of random text generation." lo cual explica que no haya entendido un choto de lo que me decían los personajes, aun así, era interesante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006145534', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1578714127}
review:
Honestly, you travel to space to defeat the authoritarian prince of the moon, since Wayne was just kinda bored one afternoon.

I'm usually pretty jaded when it comes to rpgs, either their too bloated or far too repetitive.
Hylics is different.
Finishing it all in about 5 hours, it's a packed experience. Every turn had something new and interesting to show you.
Creative animation that looks like it was painstaking to make, this game is a labor of love.
Add some chill music with some mind boggling visuals, creates one of the most attractive games for me in awhile.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987685698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1594495634}
review:
Hylics is a standard JRPG-style game with turn-based party combat. It isn't particularly difficult and it isn't intended to be, with the game taking roughly 3 hours to beat. As you might have guessed from the other reviews, screenshots and tags - this game's substance is supposed to be found in its surreal nature. 

You might think you're in for some sort of out of this world experience, similar to an acid trip, but the only thought that this game invoked in me was 'what'. You go from one place to the next with no rhyme or reason but simply because it's the only way to make progress. There is no story or deep philosophy hidden in the garbled words of the NPCs.

To me, the message of this game is simple; make a game so pointlessly abstract and random that people jump on the bandwagon to make themselves seem deep so that you get an 'Overwhelmingly Positive' review score.

Soundtrack is pretty dope though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115134082', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1594420656}
review:
Hylics is a game, or "recreational program" as it calls itself, that is very unique, if you couldn't already tell. Deep down it's just an RPG maker game, but there's so much going on on the surface level that that alone really sells the game.

Everything in the game is made with claymation; The world, the NPCs, the items, the attacks, everything. And it's weird. Like, really weird. Surreal, even. And that's what makes the game so interesting! The absurdist aesthetics are supported by largely randomly generated dialogue (i.e. gibberish) made to sound as poetic as possible and very experimental, but interesting, music.

I honestly don't really know what to say about this game. It's just kind of an artistic experience and not a game-changer, but it's great at that and dirt-cheap anyway. You get roughly 3 hours of content for 3 bucks here, but it's really fun and weird content.

8/10 - Truly artistic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198267772556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1594420581}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035413687', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1594403683}
review:
[h1]"Deceive your creature-government like a lard-theory."[/h1]

Digitized acid. A very lightweight RPGMaker game that banks heavy on being so inexplicable and alien to both profound and straightup obtuse measures. It doesn't tell you what to do or where to go, or offer any kind of explanation or real narrative other than its word-salad mad libs excerpts. You're just a passenger and occasional driver to the raw nonsense-made-pixels on display. This is both a strength and unavoidable flaw, for most of your time will be spent trying to figure out where to go next. The game is probably 2-3 hours long if you know what you're doing without many exploration detours.

[h1]"It's sort of more passion than death now."[/h1]

The RPG aspect doesn't take itself very seriously, neither in its obscure stats, balance, nor items; it's just all there to keep things interactive and spiced while you tour the surreality. It's not particularly challenging, and death holds no punishment. Infact, dying is the only way you can turn 'meat' from dead enemies (who stay dead after killed, no respawns or random encounters) into hit points. Aside from stat-upgrade pickups and stuff better off not spoiled, that's basically the extent of character growth. No conventional leveling.

[h1]"I am its dirt. I am its being."[/h1]

Basically a playable progressive rock album. Short, entrancing, and makes you wonder what the composer was smoking when writing titles. I am convinced this is as incidentally close to cohesively perceiving an alien culture as video games will ever come.

[h1]"Reprimand my unplanned land, my seas and industries!"[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198257438511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1625166411}

author: {'steamid': '76561198079273057', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1593705113}
review:
First things first: it's a JRPG gameplay-wise (figures, RPGMaker is all about JRPG), and I hate JRPGs. It has world map encounters which take you to an improvised arena, vendors with items, some consumables, aaand that's about it. It's not exactly an RPG in a traditional sense.
What it is is just, what may sound corny, an acid trip. Or an acid journey. It's an adventure in a bizarre world, where the world, specifically its visual representation, is the main character. It's fun to explore, it's nice to look at, but it's like a painting. You don't really play paintings, do you? Almost.
Hylics' gameplay, while trivial, still has decent qualities. For example, most of the time you don't even need to fight — just evade the encounters and get on with your business. Almost all of the special abilities you see in the game will be useful at least at some point — they are finely balanced, I'll give them that. Consumables, on the other hand, are unnecessary until the last boss, but still can find some use. Its unusual idea of death being an essential part of gameplay is a cool design all in itself as well.

But what can I say. It was a fun ride, and considering its price, I surely can recommend it.

review:
Fascinating art style, great music and sound effects. Simple but satisfying turn-based RPG gameplay.

It's cheap and it only takes a few hours to beat, so it's a small investment that's totally worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062948437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1594202858}
review:
Love the style and how everything is made out of clay, the music is very atmospheric and melancholic and while the combat system is pretty bog standard RPG. The atmosphere makes up for it along with the nostalgic vibe that the game tries so hard to emulate. Thanks to this it makes this game one of the most unique RPGs that I've ever played. 

It's pretty short and requires the player to do a lot of thinking as not everything is as clear as it could be, but that's the whole point you've just gotta figure out the basic RPG mechanics and you're good to go.

Not bad at all it sets out what it wants to do, I just hope that the sequel streamlines a few things like the equipment sorting and a better sense of direction with leveling, buying and upgrading items. As money is very easy to obtain and leveling is extremely easy too. The difficulty scale isn't very smooth because of this it's either really easy or really hard without a gradual change as the game progresses, most likely due to the lack of direction.

Again it is interesting in it's approach just a bit loose and maybe it doesn't have to be anything more than that. 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198261669486', 'num_games_owned': 510, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1594150701}
review:
It's a short game, but it's got so much charm stuck in there that I still really enjoy all of it. 

The music doesn't make any sense, but it still adds some vibes that still make sense to the area you're in. There's no deep lore, no real character development, but it's all still such a great experience that I'm glad I was able to get for less than 2 dollars. 

If you want to enjoy a nonsensical game that focuses more on it's art-style (but can still draw you in and get you addicted to the end) and it's wackyness, I think you'd enjoy this game and all of the effort that must have been put into it for such a low price-point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088213112', 'num_games_owned': 1213, 'num_reviews': 257, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1594070796}
review:
A bit strange, a bit artsy, a bit obscure. Thhe start is a bit hard, but i gets relaxing very fast. And once you've found out that you shouldn't rely on the "optimize" button but give your guys actual weapons, it becomes a breeze.
I recommend it for the style, but don't expect a deep experience. And I wish the movement was a bit less clumsy: it's a bit hard to foresee the collision, which makes some passages a bit tedous.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059366916', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1595767071}
review: You'll get lost, you'll get confused, you'll come for the art, you'll stay for the everlasting curiousity that edges into you each time you explore further and further. It is really a work of pure art. I am glad to have found the trailer randomly on youtube and I LOVE it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990992075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1594349232}
review: This game hurt my brain so badly trying to comprehend it that it was actually refreshing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171584195', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1631879411}
review:
Hylics is the most unique RPG Maker game I've ever played and I loved it.

Firstly, the game uses claymation graphics as its art style and I really love the abstract feel to it. Also, its music is really hypnotic and calming which I find the most charming about this game. Additionally, the character progression, while it makes challenge in this game non-existent, is unique enough and makes the short 3-hour trip in this game a bit more memorable. Lastly, the story of the game is a bit underwhelming after looking at and admiring this game just from its art style from its steam page but considering that this is only a 2/3-hour game, I guess it's pretty okay.

I'm really looking forward to playing Hylics 2 in the near future once I get the funds for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002814152', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1593734647}
review: Gorgeous game with a very clean, simple turn-based RPG element. It's a beautiful experiment that expresses how you can convey what to do in a game with little to no dialogue. There are some Quality of Life issues, such as not being able to adjust most game settings and no controller support, but the game is short and sweet enough that these issues don't persevere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140591498', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1594016309}
review: hylics is one of the strangest, coolest, and most interesting rpgs i have ever had the pleasure of playing. definitely deserves way more attention than it's getting. highly recommend even if you aren't into rpgs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193424018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1594016678}
review:
O jogo é simples e fácil, mas vale o preço se você gosta de uma experiência diferente. A arte e a trilha sonora são sensacionais e por mais estranhos que os personagens possam ser, você acaba se apegando a eles.

É uma viagem de ácido, com elementos de Salvador Dali, J-RPG, e claro, referências a JoJo Bizarre Adventure, mas que apesar das referências, ele consegue ser único.

author: {'steamid': '76561198417331314', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1594015125}
review:
Hylics é uma viagem surrealista por um mundo pós humanista extremamente alien e que nem lovecraft entenderia.
Recomendo pra todos que curtem jogos curtos, JRPGs, ou tão cansados da mesmice!

author: {'steamid': '76561198279658271', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1594001748}
review:
Eu fico impressionado como esse jogo não tem a visibilidade que merece, na verdade eu entendo a falta de fama dele mas mesmo assim, ele é muito pouco falado, um jogo que mistura duas das minhas coisas preferidas: o movimento surrealista e rpg. É uma obra-prima única e sem igual, eu sinceramente não sabia muito do que esperar dele por ser bem diferente mas no momento que entrei no jogo eu já soube que seria um dos meus jogos preferidos da vida, e realmente foi, os personagens são incríveis apesar de quase não falarem só a estética deles já é linda, os gráficos são simplesmente absurdos, eu nunca vi nada igual, o stop motion que ele usa é lindo junto com as cores e aquele efeito de chiado na tela, as músicas são maravilhosas, os efeitos dos ataques são incríveis, tudo é incrível nesse jogo, não é algo que vai agradar todo mundo, um jogo por turno surreal em 2020 é algo que pouquíssima gente se interessaria, é aquele tipo de jogo que entra para aqueles canais de lista de jogo como "os jogos mais estranhos de todos", e ele não é nada disso, é uma puta de uma obra-prima, tenho certeza que quem teve a curiosidade de conferir não se decepcionou, durante o jogo você tem meio que aquele sentimento como se estivesse num sonho bizarro, bizarro mas ao mesmo tempo maravilhoso.



Ps: a boss fight final virou uma das minhas preferidas, foda demais.

比起二代需要做一些麻煩透頂的跑酷，一代可以更輕鬆的享受作者的藝術風格。

author: {'steamid': '76561198003717113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1593965271}
review:
scratchy transmissions from roland topor AKA moonbound

very mild recommendation. the style over substance argument has limits. there's a lot to love here but tedium killed the spirit after a few hours. the art and music are right up my alley, but the lack of controller support, wonky wall detection make lots of this feel 'cheap' or 'artificially difficult' like you'd get from a 3rd party NES game. after awhile it became clear what i needed to do to beat gibby i just didn't feel like putting in the effort. i shouldn't judge too harshly, its coming from one guy who obviously has a lot of heart behind his projects. this might be one you skip and just go straight to the sequel? don't skip on listening to the soundtrack, though. it will restore your flesh and will.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026234615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1594047016}
review:
有志の方により日本語化MODが配布されました。
気になってましたが読解力がかなり必要と聞いていたので手が出せませんでした。
日本語化のおかげで購入することを決断できました。ありがとうございます。

とりあえずPVを見てください。
・不安になるけどなぜか気になるクレイアートのグラフィック。気になる人もならない人も買いましょう。
・日本語化しても"よくわかんにゃい"な感じですが元々そういうゲームです。買いましょう。
・安心のターン制の戦闘です。難しい操作は必要ありません。日本語化によりスキルの効果がはっきりと分かるようになりました。買いましょう。
・むしろ戦闘よりアニメーションが気になります。何をどうしたらそうなるんだ？買いましょう。
・ゲームバランス？あってないようなものです。始めのうちは三日月のような主人公の死に様をよく見られます。買いましょう。
・定価でも300円以下で購入できます。セール中だと150円とか儲けが出るのかと言いたくなるような価格です。買いましょう。

author: {'steamid': '76561198030424268', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1593907390}
review:
bought it with pocket change (literally $1.63) from selling steam inventory crap and for what its worth its a pretty good product. There are free RPG maker games of the same caliber as this one, but I think Hylics deserves a dollar or two for using only original assets made from the ground up.
You will see this game likened to Earthbound by children with no points of reference (heck every turn based RPG game is victim to this) but it does it more justice to say it's like Eastern Mind or Sluggish Morss as an RPG.

Also the story is told through random text generation, so everyone's experience with it will be personalized and make next to no sense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067118413', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1699929892}
review:
This is probably the most memorable game that I have ever played. Hylics 2 may be more of a 'game', but this is seriously a work of art. I cannot think of something I dislike about it. You play as a vegetable farmer-turned anarchist(?) who seems to either just decide one day or, being a hylic, becomes self-aware just because you're controlling him, and you're off to topple an authoritarian regime by defeating Gibby, King of the Moon. The two characters' names are clearly meant as foils of each other.

The characterisation in this one is much stronger, with each party member having very distinct personalities, whereas I feel all the party members in the sequel essentially speak and act exactly the same as each other.

The music is perfect. This game is perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118553227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1708049348}
review: a very short game - you could finish it all in one sitting. however it's so unique in visual style, sound design, and overall atmosphere that i'd have to fullheartedly recommend it to anyone who's even mildly interested. the battle animations are a real treat to watch - lindroth's claymation style is so intriguing and even moreso in a video game rather than just a stop-motion movie. don't try to understand or scrutinise it too much while playing - i think that could take away from the experience - but just enjoy the whole feel of it, like a wave of playdough washing over you.

review: This game oozes personality. I'd say the only flaw I can find with the game is that there isn't too much to the combat. However, the game itself is fairly short. So for the amount of enjoyment that I got out of the game, I didn't pay enough. Best 1.50$ I've spent this year.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094237987', 'num_games_owned': 481, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1594275203}
review: Hylics is a visual experience, a simple game with generic RPG elements, but with unique visuals unencountered anywhere else. Mason Lindroth's unique claymation style definitely sets this game apart. The text and interactions are silly nonsense in their own good charmful way, and the game is entertaining in every sense, the music is charming, experimental, peaceful, chaotic, and unique.  If you are tired of everything being the same, Hylics is definitely a different experience unlike any other, and for sure an experience worth having for anyone who appreciates art media. Accompany Wayne and his friends in this amazing adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089301995', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1657154846}
review:
This is one of the best experiences I've had on steam in a long while. The weird, but charming imagery is what kept me playing on and on. Let's go over the basics elements of the game:

Story:
The plot of the game is one that's definitely not out in the open. In order to fully understand the story you'll ever have to do some research or spend a lot of time reading in-between the lines. It's filled with a lot of symbolism that I don't really understand playing for the first time. Moving past that, I really enjoyed the parts that I do understand because I am really interested in this universe.

Combat:
The RPG elements were unique in their own way. I was playing the game expecting to gain levels and EXP, but that's actually not how the game works. Instead, you're suppose to get through progression by killing your enemies and using their remains to gain health or other various events to gain other attributes. It's really interesting and it kept me entertained throughout the experience. I suppose the only problem I had was having to go back to each TV every time I gained a new party member. 

Visuals:
This is the REASON I love this game. As I stated before, the clay visuals are strange and I love it. The creator really has a talent with creating a place with pure imagination! From the designs of the characters, to the scenery, and even the battle animations that I completely love, the game had a lot of charm and I can't talk about how much I enjoyed this element of the game.

Finally, the music:
The music was great! There were some really "messy" tracks that added to the strange places. I truly felt apart of this world because of this element. There's a couple of memorable tracks that I can still hear when as I write this review haha.

Conclusion:
Just buy it. Please.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075820042', 'num_games_owned': 3556, 'num_reviews': 454, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1594417796}
review:
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/38287655-Prof.Vaharrak/]Prof.Vaharrak's Curator Group - Almost 30 years of gaming experience at your service[/url]

This game is a cursed edition of Earthbound, made on claymation and on a ridiculous amount of hallucinogenic drugs. Everything is absurd, dialogue is literally random and more than once you will be confused and impressed by the sheer assault of scenes and otherworldly freakish creatures that inhabit the world of Hylics.

And I f*cking love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198420565818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1593448246}
review:
Короткая, не имеющая особо сюжета, однако в контексте самой игры этого и не нужно.
Обалденное оформление, сюрреалистичное, почти на грани абсурда, и все это под чилловую какофонию с акустической гитарой. Не пугайтесь, если не имеете должного уровня знаний в английском, тут хоть и много непонятных слов, они играть не мешают.  
По механике - обычная JRPG, но ее оформление и придает весь шарм, в нее просто играешь и наслаждаешься, наблюдая за этим причудливым миром, напоминающие те самые странные сновидения, от которых вечно просыпаешься с вопросом "Что это вообще было?!".
Многим может напомнить Неверхуд или Mother, и на то есть причины.
Хотите потратить пару часиков на что-то необычное, не напрягаясь и не особо много потратить? Эта игра самое то. Не пожалеете.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080691242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1593378490}
review:
I have never played something so weird yet weirdly enjoyable...it was simply fun even for some one who never played a game like this :D

This game doesn't punish you for dying, dying here makes you stronger (if you manage to kill enemies and get more hp by grinding their flesh in a meat grinder) but after learning that I stopped save scuming and was just able to enjoy this game, to have in combat you need allies which could be kinda easy to miss since I found the first one maybe 1h into the game, bc I missed a big obvious staircase...but after getting that one ally...oh boi is it fun :D

and I managed to kill the last boss with just 3 characters and cameback for the 4th one last xd

really good game for the price :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198002180298', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1636235408}
review:
I've grown up playing weird point'n'clicks, and the brightest one of them is Neverhood. It stuck in my mind, the aethetics, characters, the world itself, the music and basically everything this game could give me i soaked up as a sponge which influenced on me a me A LOT ( If you are on of those guys too go and buy the game without overhinking), and throughout the years I thought I'll never experience like this ever until I played Hylics . I can bet my kidney that developer is also one of those kids with very specific taste in almost everything(?) because of the neverhood and alike games, so big thanks from me for making it.  I feel like this game was made just for me and other weird guys out there. PLASTICINE RULES.
p.s. i don't like jrpgs though but if you'll buy it I'm pretty sure it's not because you miss those gameboy's pokemon games.

review:
Hylics is a really neat game!

It's fairly average when it comes to gameplay but the visuals are really out there. Its made in RPG maker so you know what to expect but there's still so much done wonderfully. The art of this game feels straight out of a foreign film like fantastic planet and I just can't get enough.

Can't wait to play Hylics 2!

review: I love this game due to its bizarre atmosphere, which is accompanied by an equally odd, yet pleasant soundtrack.  There isn't much of a plot to the game, and considering the game's standout and unique art-style, I'd say that plays to the game's advantage.  It feels almost like an extremely abstract art piece, with little rhyme or reason behind it, especially considering that frozen burritos can be a weapon, and a squirrel's skull can be used as an armor piece. Overall, it's a very enjoyable game, and artistically, is one of my favorites.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278733590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1707851074}
review:
Very cool game. Pretty short, but definitely worth the price. I love the look and feel of the claymation art. It's a very mesmerizing style. The gameplay was simple, nothing crazy. But it did it's job and it's a pleasant progression from beginning to end. At least for me. A highlight were the attack animations, they're all really creative. Some bosses took me a few tries, but nothing felt unfair. The music was abstract and all over the place, but I liked it. Psychedelic I guess. The writing didn't make a lot of sense most of the time, but the story itself was simple as it's just "defeat this guy cuz he's making things bad." I'm sure there's more to it, but for me it was just kinda there to push things along. The ending was very abrupt, but I didn't mind. It felt nice.

This game is just a very nice and cool experience that I reccommend to anyone looking for something short, sweet, and strange.

author: {'steamid': '76561198425712731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1707135579}
review:
Em questão de história e de jogabilidade, não há muito o que comentar, é um jogo tradicional de RPG. A premissa do jogo é bem simples, você controla um personagem chamado Wayne (um ser bizarro que tem a cabeça num formato de meia-lua) e é designado à derrotar Gibby, o rei da Lua, que planeja invadir e conquistar a Terra. Nessa jornada psicodélica, você tem a opção de juntar ou não aliados ao longo do caminho, se fortalecer, ganhar novas habilidades, entre outras coisas malucas. O mecanismo de combate é "padrão" para um jogo feito no RPGMaker, a separação no menu para ataques "normais", especiais, para itens e entre outras coisas.

Mas aí é que está. A graça do jogo em si não é centrado nas coisas que você ganha, perde ou enfrenta. A graça está na arte e nas animações. Praticamente tudo no jogo é feito à base de massinha e desenhos totalmente bizarros, tudo isso com a trilha sonora totalmente confusa (algo como Captain Beefheart & His Magic Band conceberia), com guitarras desafinadas e baterias totalmente fora de tempo. As animações quando você acaba executando uma habilidade (ou até mesmo morrendo) são bizarramente bem-feitas, e essa definição pode se encaixar em qualquer coisa do jogo. O visual desse jogo é estranhamente bom de se olhar. É incrível o fato desse jogo ter sido idealizado por, praticamente, um cara, o Mason Lindroth. 

Como eu escrevi uma vez no twitter, esse jogo é se Earthbound fosse feito pelo Alejandro Jodorowsky (tomadas devidas proporções, claro).

author: {'steamid': '76561198169902357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1689020333}

author: {'steamid': '76561198799824247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1593937204}
review:
本月23号续作就要发售啦^ ^赶紧回来打一遍二周目，中文流程攻略也上传至社区了
漂亮的像素点阵、奇诡的粘土角色以及温馨又崩坏的背景音乐，这种嗑嗨了的美术风格谁不爱呢
二周目游玩过程中发现了不少有趣的小细节，[spoiler]比如每增加一个队友，Wayne家就会多出一只小奶猫；Somsnosa家地下室也养着一只猫，样子和Wayne家的一模一样；随着剧情的推进，人物档案还会发生微妙的变化。[strike]虽然也有可能是随机文本[/strike][/spoiler]
最后，希望有更多人能来玩Hylics~

author: {'steamid': '76561197981137890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1591582823}
review: Final Fantasy as imagined by Captain Beefheart.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284347467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1591426702}
review:
Hylics - krótka gra, niezależnego twórcy Masona Lindrotha - to gloryfikacja materii. Greckie "hyle" oznacza materię. Słowo to było używane przez gnostyków w znaczeniu negatywnym, na określenie fizycznej części człowieka i świata, od której należy się uwolnić.

Plaża w hubie pośmiertnym, na której można wznosić i burzyć miniaturowe zamki z piasku to synekdocha całej gry. Głównym motywem Hylics, przejawiającym się tak w mechanice, jak i w środowiskach, które przemierzamy, jest plastyczność materii. Plastyczność zapewnia trwanie materii i zmienność form.

Materia wiedzie prym również w fabule - ona jest główną treścią, ona wytycza ścieżkę postępowania (idziemy tam gdzie materia gry pozwala, bez jasno określonego celu). Standardowe rozwiązania napędzające fabułę w grach są tutaj potraktowane jako żart - teksty, np. wypowiedzi NPC-ów, są generowane proceduralnie, brzmią jak enigmatyczna poezja.

Hylics to udany, spójny, dobrze przemyślany twór.

---
Mój profil kuratora Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33910649/

author: {'steamid': '76561198390675582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1589146787}

enjoy

author: {'steamid': '76561198043383577', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1590868923}
review:
I would not have looked twice at this game if it weren't for a recommendation from a close friend. And wow, am I ever glad they recommended it. This is a splendid example of a game being more than the sum of its parts; the JRPG elements alone are serviceable, the humour is fairly entertaining, and the amount of content at this price point is respectable. However, when everything is taken as a whole this game becomes the best $3 I've spent in a long time. Each aspect of the game builds on the others, resulting in a harmonious combination of surreal entertainment. I cannot wait for Hylics 2.

If you can afford it, buy the game. It is almost undoubtedly better than anything else you were thinking of spending $3 on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219656925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1516721130}
review:
The JRPG Lite subgenre has yet another cult classic among the others.  While it is short, and its story makes no frickin' sense with all dialogue being intentionally written in what can generously be described as word salad, the selling point is the surreal adventure in this claymation looking adventure akin with a psychedelic album cover from the late 60's.  

Very fitting, given how the intentionally amateurish rock soundtrack is.  Like, it sounds like what you'd hear from a pot smoking coffee house filled with hippies and whatnot.  And you'd think that's bad, but not really.  I LOVE it.  The afterlife theme especially has a relaxing hazy electric guitar melody that just fits when seeing your surroundings of claylike canyons and talking flopping fish, with even an old CRT TV set.  

It feels like a love letter to that hippie culture.  Something that's not coherent at times.  But the turn based combat is mechanically sound, the three additional party members have good variations to warrant having them in the game, the towns and locations are pretty memorable, and by the time you beat Gibby, you will likely be as confused as when you began, but you wouldn't regret playing it either because the experience has to be seen to be believed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276224154', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1590397467}

author: {'steamid': '76561198036162044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1628977955}
review:
Hylics is a delightful treat for the eyes, ears, and the mind. 
Visually a stimulating game and with some enjoyable trippy ambient tracks to compliment the clay-mation type graphics. The gameplay for Hylics is very simple turn based RPG with some non-linear exploration and rudimentary item management. 
I'm not sure if there is a complex story in Hylics. I would say it is about a lone shut-in man who ventures into a bizarre world to make friends, defeat cultists, explode the moon, and destroy an alien menace(?). The influence of Earthbound is obviously palpable here.
Very quirky, very silly, the game is very much the product of a post-Napolean Dynamite world of irony and cynicism. Some themes include anti-capitalism, punk rock chaos, and media-washing. 
The random text generation on some of the NPCs lends to the criticism that much of a game is superfluous. In themes like this, Hylics can be viewed as a post-modern video game that daunts fatigue and glibness onto it's medium. However, there are games that communicate critical messages like this more effectively, while implementing gameplay and nuance that compliments these messages better. 
That being said, for less than $5, you could do a lot worse for trying out a self-aware, visually unique, video game. The price makes it a recommendation for anyone who enjoys games like Yume Nikki, Earthbound, Undertale, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142368636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1587160634}
review:
One of the strangest and more unique games I have played.

At it's core Hylics is an Earthbound style JRPG, however everything about is abstracted and shifted to make something that only this dev could have.

The visuals are the most obvious. The game looks like it was modelled from clay (and apparently was rotoscoped from clay? Though I was told that from a Twitch viewer so it's hard to confirm) with an abstract aesthetic, though not so abstracted that it becomes hard to read or understand.
This couples with the music, which often sounds like someone just jamming out. It's a weird vibe, but not unsettling or disturbing, more in a fun way. 

The gameplay is quite open, with little direction unless you count the strange snippets of speech that tell you the story. You will understand next to nobody in this game, but that fits the vibe and the dialogue is funny and still kind of interesting at times.
The lack of direction suits the game, and you get to find your own path through it. This means that at first the game can be quite difficult, but it becomes really satisfying to piece together. The game clearly doesn't take it's combat overly seriously (with one great exception) and gives you a big help if you die a lot. 
The game is pretty short too so getting stuck for a little bit wasn't too much of a problem for me.

I'd recommend this to any fans of unique gaming experiences, but also to fans of more traditional games if they were willing to dive into something short, fun and extremely interesting.

review: Absolutely incredible, one of the most unique and charming games I've ever played. Very fun twists on JRPG mechanics and very cool and surreal art and animations. The pacing of the game is very well-balanced, it doesn't feel too fast or slow and constantly keeps you engaged in exploring the world. Poses some good challenges without being too frustrating. This game is worth every penny, and it'll only take two to three hours to play through to the end. Buy now, you won't regret it.

review:
Definitivamente não é um título para qualquer um, mas eu recomendo fortemente para fãs de animação 
"claymation" e de narrativas nebulosas

Apesar de na sua descrição ter escrito "leves elementos de JRPG" o jogo eh basicamente um JRPG mesmo, pelo menos em sua jogabilidade, porque o resto é diferente de tudo o que eu já vi, e é justamente a sua originalidade o ponto mais alto desse jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173728517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1696047527}
review:
Hylics is a game that I really enjoyed, but used to have a hard time recommending because I couldn't find anything that I could recommend about it besides the art and maybe the combat. When comparing Hylics to other good games that are similar, it is typically lacking what makes them good. OFF had good art and had music that fit well with its tone, similar to Hylics. However, OFF's world and conflict is also interesting. The world of Hylics has a conflict, but the world doesn't function or disfunction, our protagonists don't seem to have any motivations for their journey, and the conflict it does have is very bare bones and may just be a ridiculous (although funny) parody with a lot of the story having randomly generated dialogue. An RPG doesn't need a gripping story or characters to be good, it could just be fun; look at EarthBound. Although I would say Hylics is funny, it doesn't have particularly memorable conflicts besides ones near the end. This isn't because they're bad (the graveyard is tedious, but I wouldn't say its bad), but they typically don't have fun characters or puzzles to challenge the player (except the conflicts near the end).

But it recently clicked for me why I enjoyed Hylics. The game is a great experience rather than a gripping story or sidesplitting comedy. At first, I thought this was just a half baked way for me to say "its an artsy shmartsy game" and to be done with it, which its not. The strength of Hylics is to be a good game to chill out alone with and explore a visually interesting world. The areas, although a lot are lacking a memorable conflict, are different enough to not feel repetitive. Exploration is rewarded with money, strong equipment, and new moves for combat. Besides act transitions, dialogue is typically brief and is non-intrusive. Grinding is deemphasized because your stats don't level up and you are only rewarded with money to buy equipment and consumables (which you can get from exploring), meat that can raise your teams max health AFTER you die, and consumables. Encounters are also not random so you can try to avoid most enemies. Although I'm not an expert, the combat felt more interesting than a lot of games similar to this, maybe because special abilities typically have more use than just a good attack, and the good attacks cost a lot of meter to use. Enemies are also somewhat challenging, especially if you are rushing the game. However, the game doesn't really punish you if you die; it may actually help you because you can fast travel, increase max health, and gain other benefits. Full heals and fast travel markers are also common. However, the lack of punishment helps with the idea of exploration because it doesn't make it annoying to die and it promotes experimenting and taking risks. This along with the hidden rewards and lack of hand holding and grinding makes it enjoyable to explore the environment. The game is also around three hours long, which is short but the game doesn't overstay its welcome. Speedrunning also seems enjoyable because of the short time, lack of grinding, and because there are shortcuts for recruiting every teammate (I would say Dedusmuln's is silly but its there). The music can devolve into loud noise but most of the tracks sound nice out of context as background noise and in game they fit the tone well.

I would recommend playing Hylics alone to take in the experience. I tried showing a friend me playing it and I got annoyed because I was just boiling down the game to its most simple flaws while also poorly rushing it, and all my friend got out of it was a headache due to some of the music and visuals (and the low resolution of the screen share). Maybe comparing Hylics to other games was fruitless because I don't know any other RPG's that have the same appeal that Hylics has. I know its not for everyone, but I thoroughly enjoyed the experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042147053', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1668395317}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050611062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1617670898}
review: I've only played the game for 20 minutes. Immediately I've been in a trance. This is the most beautiful game I've played. It speaks to me on an artistic, psychological level. Reminds me of a Salvador Dali or Francis Bacon painting. The music fits perfectly, it adds to the odd atmosphere the game places you in. Not only this, but there is enough content to last you hours. Nothing has ever inspired me artistically as much as this game. Thank you so much to the creator. Looking forward to playing more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045404688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1578258286}
review:
This game feels like you'd find it on a Disk/Cd-rom in an old dusty bin from somebody's garage sale.

Surreal, Abstract, & Enchanting; the game plays out a short rpg adventure in the likeness of Earthbound, but with a strange sort of 'out-of-this-world' style you'd find from something bizarre & obscure like Eastern Mind: The Lost Souls of Tong Nou.

Oh, & there's a sequel? ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198043840211', 'num_games_owned': 663, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1578120596}
review: Absurdist-styled JRPG with nice art, animations and soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302966131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1578112555}
review:
A super unique and short experience! There is a lot of character to this game, with visual style and combat being the highlights. The game starts relatively challenging, but gets easier as you progress. The final boss was challenging and fun, and I enjoyed the game's basic RPG mechanics.

While I enjoyed this game, the movement was be tricky at times when in tight spaces. I also strongly feel as though some of the instant-kill enemies would be better off as challenging combat or frankly removed from the game. There is a frustrating part in particular where these enemies are very fast and track seemingly infinitely, and it does end up feeling slightly unfair.

If you enjoy the visual style, the surreal, and turn-based RPGs, chances are you will likely enjoy this game. While short, it has a lot to offer and is one of the more memorable games I've played.

review: Un viaje extracorpóreo por un universo extraño y encantador, alienígena e incomprensible. Empuja los límites de lo que puede ser llamado narrativa y presenta al jugador un producto maravilloso que permite perderse en el bizarro diseño artístico y el desquiciado diálogo. Una experiencia imperdible para cualquiera interesado en los estilos artísticos en los videojuegos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262047208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1578351448}
review: I've been looking forward to playing this game for literal years, and now that I'm a wagie I was actually able to pay the $3. As soon as I started, I was in love. I'm kind of ADD so I usually get distracted or bored after playing a game for too long in one day, but Hylics had me hooked. The first time I lasted four hours without even noticing the time had gone by. Not a lot, but a lot for me. The music is wonderful, the art lovely, and the gameplay is fantastic. This kind of stuff is my cup of tea. I can tell there's a lot of work and care put into this, typically with more "artsy" games they're usually lacking in being too engaging or actually challenging, because the focus is more on the aesthetic. Hylics brings me back to everything from earthbound to dreams I never knew I'd dreamed. Big thanks to the developers for this amazing game.

review:
Weird looking trip across a clay world that doesnt have any real meaning (apparently).
I love me some weird RPG maker games so this is a great way to pass the time

review:

100 из 100 каждый аспект. Саундреки, звуки. Он даже изменил ощущение от боевки, которая для рпг-мейкера стандартная!

author: {'steamid': '76561198136535250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1091, 'last_played': 1571785789}
review:
Hylics é um jogo estranho, porém belo, acima de tudo.

Feito inteiramente com massas de modelar, Hylics é o tipo de jogo que te arremessa em um mundo abstrato e alucinante. Da trilha sonora ao design das criaturas, tudo contribui a sensação de se estar em um sonho febril.

Sua estética é um grandessíssimo ponto forte, virando junto consigo alguns atributos do JRPG de ponta-cabeça. Os personagens, por mais simples que sejam, são memoráveis, seja por design ou suas pequenas peculiaridades e suas animações em stopmotion são sublimes, o que parece estar ficando ainda mais forte na sequência que está por vir.

Por outro lado, Hylics toma decisões que podem decepcionar o consumidor tradicional, seja por sua trama nonsense ou a falta de orientação que o jogo oferece ao jogador, muitas vezes gerando frustrações envolvendo o clássico “para onde eu tenho que ir?”. Coisas intencionais que podem impactar na experiência de alguns.

No fim do dia, Hylics é uma daquelas experiências que te lembrará de tempos mais simples. De noites perdidas jogando RPGs no quarto, explorando o desconhecido. Um espelho torto das suas memórias de infância que é familiar, mas igualmente distinto. Uma recomendação fácil pra quem gosta da sensação. Aguardo ansiosamente a sequência.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025298967', 'num_games_owned': 492, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1501212148}

review:
What a fantastic title. 

Though it may be a short game, it is very entertaining. The art style is quite unique compared to other titles of this genre. It could be compared to the likes of Undertale or the Mother series, but more of an acid trip. 

I felt compelled to complete this game, just to see what other weird shit was around the corner.

10/10, would collect meat again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019620750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1565565999}
review: Incredibly overrated. If you aren't sold on the presentation, nothing else in the game will sell you. I get the whole absurdist thing, but taken too far, it leaves the game bereft of useful features like a story, characterization, or a sense of direction. The only time the game is challenging is at the start when you're clueless and have no idea what to do - after that, it's actually better just to avoid fighting altogether. At least I picked it up on sale - cannot recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999899413', 'num_games_owned': 5069, 'num_reviews': 344, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1565127183}
review:
[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/32482033/]Crim's Humble Opinion Curator[/url]

[h1]"Recreational Program"[/h1]
A not to be ignored rpgmaker game based solely on it's artistic presentation. The game play is pretty standard turned based battles with exploration; but the visuals is where this game excels. The almost claymation animations are so surreal and strange that you will find yourself enjoying every odd happening that comes up. There are a nice amount of cool attack animations, fun things to explore in the overworld, and interesting dialogues. Even the character death animation is pretty awesome. 

[h1]The Minor Gripes[/h1]
Surreal and strange games tend to sometimes lack a bit if direction. I don't mean artistically speaking; I mean in the "what do I have to do" field. Hylics has a somewhat confusing first act. Once you get past that it's fairly straight forward what you have to do. I ended up using a guide after dying several times near the start and finding out there are ways to recruit three companions for your journey. Other than that; the game is great.
[code][h1](っ◔◡◔)っ ♥ pros ♥[/h1]
+Original art style and animations
+Surrealism presented very well

[h1](っ>▬<)っ x cons x[/h1]
-Confusing First Act
[/code]

You'll get around two hours for a play through of this one. The art style can't be missed because it's definitely something uncommon in games. It does go on sale but it's still worth the low original tag. 

𝕀𝕗 𝕐𝕠𝕦 𝔼𝕟𝕛𝕠𝕪 𝕋𝕙𝕚𝕤 𝕋𝕣𝕪
https://store.steampowered.com/app/789570/Nepenthe/

author: {'steamid': '76561198118382249', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1565361846}
review:
*JRPG 어드벤처

- 남성 1인 개발. 클레이 애니메이션을 이용한 독특한 디자인이 특징.
- 영어가 어려워서 대사의 1/3 밖에 이해하지 못했지만 스토리와 재미는 충분히 전달됨.
- 전투 연출과 캐릭터 모션이 너무 이상하게 꿈틀거려서 마음에 듦. 보고 있으면 웃기고 기분 좋아짐. 적당한 클리셰 비틀기와 깔끔한 스토리에 잔잔한 락OST까지 모든 게 훌륭한 갓겜.
- 수집 요소와 전투 난이도 무난함. 오히려 쉬운 편. 죽는 것도 공략의 한 방법이 되기 때문에 마음 편히 죽을 수 있고, 노가다 요소 없음.
- 막보전으로 가는 길에 무쌍 연출 어처구니 없고 웃겼음. 2 나오면 바로 살 의향있음.

review:
Honestly, and without a doubt, one of the most bizarre, beautiful, strange and entertaining experiences ever.
The absurdity of it and even some of the imagery reminds me of Yume Nikki, but the fact that the dialogue is automatically generated makes it somewhat of an absurdist experience.
Absolutely amazing. Short enough that it doesn't drag too much, but enough secrets and little tidbits to make you want to explore more and more. Definitely recomended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198072006918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1566777836}
review:
This game produces an interesting effect by creating a dissonance between its parts.
Story-wise, there's no story. The whole thing happens in a Dadaist abstract world, nothing even tries to make sense, and the characters speak gibberish.
Gameplay-wise, it's the opposite: a completely straightforward, easy to understand and play JRPG with clear rules.
Aesthetics are between these two extremes: they make some sense, but not much, and are strange, but charming. I especially loved the idea of sculpting everything in clay, then putting it into the game as low-resolution sprites, with extremely basic visual effects, the kind you could make in a minute with Paint. And the music is lovely.
It all comes together as a short, meditative Thing That Happened.
Hylic recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137728960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1565212698}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000853985', 'num_games_owned': 1245, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1562989459}
review: This game made me feel as though I were about 8 levels of dissociation away from myself. I felt like I was on automatic because the mechanics kept clicking with me in different rewarding ways that, per enemy, kept me on my toes anyway. Normalizing surrealism of this level into your brain like this might not be healthy, but god damn do I love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024506199', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1562781726}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041359963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1562778568}
review: There's a lot to say about Hylics. Probably the first thing you can say is the visuals and art style are unique, or that the writing is almost completely randomly generated. I think the one thing I love to talk about is the feeling and atmosphere of this game. Hylics is a perfect "chill out" type of game. The fact that there is a genuine game here, and not just a "walking simulator" experience surprised me. Hylics gets things right by making sure you're not just looking at the art or laughing at the silly words spoken by the terrifying bug faced clay people. Exploration, building stats, party members all of the typical JRPG staples are in here. It's not a terribly long game, but the experience is going to stick with me a lot more than an eighty hour JRPG with fifty dungeons and ten party members. If you want to play a game and just feel mellow during a hard time in your life Hylics is the perfect option for you. (Plus, it's only three bucks!)

review:
A surreal quest to stop a tyrannical moon-king, featuring beautifully strange stop-motion claymation art and randomly generated dialogue.

This is a fantastic RPG Maker game, and it only costs $3. It'd be a crime not to buy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059046683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1680389199}
review:
I'm really not sure what to say. Hylics is one of those really weird late-night pizza- or melatonin-dreams you very slowly wake up from and you're not sure whether you want to write down everything you saw or try to fall back asleep in the hopes you can get back into it.
   As a game, it's forgiving enough and the map is small enough that dying doesn't really set you back, but challenging enough that you still need to strategize to win new encounters.
   Narratively, it's just... Weird. And goofy. It's weird and goofy and I love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268158774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1559932757}
review: Я люблю jRPG!!! И эта игра является довольно занятной из своего жанра. Главной изюминкой этой игры является СТИЛЬ. Стиль, созданный с помощью игрушек, пластилина и пикселей. Из этого стиля состоят противники, главные герои, транспорт, NPC и предметы. Он смотрится довольно интересно и странно (Что не является минусом), как и сам юмор и сюжет. А музыка для этого несуразного мира, довольно расслабляющая и хорошо подходит. Да и вообще, автору заявляю большую благодарность за отличную игру и хорошо проведенное время! P.S. Жду с нетерпением Hylics 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165733672', 'num_games_owned': 37, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1619217683}
review:
Beautifully bizarre. Everything is low resolution, which would be bad, but it complements the art direction. The animations are incredible most of the time, really *melting* with the visuals. The soundtrack is very raw, experimental and amateur, though sometimes serene, like a rock garage band. It may not be for everyone, but it's definitely something I enjoy. The characters are incromprehensibly charming, with interesingly abstract designs.

The battle system and mechanics are fairly simple; a good distraction from the exploration, where the game truly shines.
The game is short, but it has plenty to offer, and replaying it is interesting as well, thanks to sequence breaking and additional upgrades spread through the worlds, aside from the curiously crafted procedurally generated text.

It is now one of my favorite games, and I`m be eagerly waiting for the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198829150033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1700360895}
review:
A Friend recommended this game to me, and I hecking loved it. The surreal atmosphere, the unique visuals, the bizarre world, the incredibly satisfying progression. This game nails everything. Its like stripping away grid of reality and staring straight into a psychadelic dreamscape. All the complaints I have can be argued against, apart from two. Its only around 4 hours long (I would still be complaining if it was 60 hours long), and that one area where you have to dig graves and avoid the ghosts.

This game has brought me an immense amount of joy, and with it on sale for a single pound, there is no reason for anyone interested in atmospheric surrealism not to make this an immediate purchase.

This game is solid and if the style interests you, then there's no reason not to try it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259967353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1572059670}
review: Hylics is a beautiful yet creepy and abstract little RPGMaker game, with a beautiful art direction both visually and musically. The game is easy to pick up, not super long, and gives you lots of freedom to roam wherever you want, although it does leave a want for more. That want may yet be fulfilled soon, because a sequel is in the works currently, and it's even more ambitious than the last. I recommend this game more for the visual and auditory statement rather than the gameplay itself, but the character design is golden too. This is also the best RPGMaker title I've ever seen/played. This game also has the best walk cycles in any game ever made no question.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015812910', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1553960772}
review:
Ставя положительную оценку, формально присоединяюсь к общим настроениям, но на самом деле каких-то восторгов не разделяю. Hylics - не игра и ни к одному из заявленных в тегах жанров не принадлежит. Поэтому любая попытка описать его (её/это) в рамках привычного, привитого еще какой-нибудь "Манией Страны Навигаторов", шаблона (геймплей, сюжет, итого) моментально разваливается.

Да какие-то абстрактные характеристики растут, компаньоны по мере продвижения присоединяются, а в боях даже есть какая-то тактика и её стоит придерживаться. Но говорить ни об одной составляющей подробно не получится. А история, персонажи? А зачем? Буквально самые-самые основы соблюдены и этого вроде как оказалось достаточно, чтобы придать интерактивности этому пластилиновому галлюциногену.

И вот в качестве последнего Hylics хочется рекомендовать, благо относительно безопасно и совсем недорого. Прекрасно справляется как с тем, чтобы показать под весьма неплохой stoner rock (или это psyhodelic?) чувство легкой эйфории, так и последующей за этим неизбежной ломки, когда, бегая по одним и тем же местам, пытаешься понять, что же дальше нужно делать.

Но на это жаловаться, полагаю, тоже не стоит: отсутствие логики, связности повествования и вообще сколько-нибудь внятной мотивации тоже часть качественного трипа. И покажется ли вам происходящее на экране необычным или странным (да между этими словами есть разница) - будет сильно зависеть от вашего настроения. Ведь всё, что можно было (образ, описание, фразы, даже имена) сделать "искаженным" - сделано таковым.

А вообще вскоре вроде как должна последовать новая доза и остальным знакомство стоит попробовать начать именно со второй части. Её трейлер обещает значительно более красивое (забористое) и разнообразное путешествие сразу с целой кучей допфишек - от платформера до dungeon crawler'а. Так что жду, но очень осторожно - не верится, что хоть одна из этих механик будет доведена до логического конца.

В любом случае Hylics врезается в память, пусть даже частично как отрицательный опыт.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993399611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1571706919}
review:
I've seen people describe this game as an "art game" or an art gallery masquerading as an RPG and I don't think that's totally right. This game is definitely experimental, doesn't take itself seriously, and is an abstract parody of JRPG's, but beneath the overwhelming weirdness there's also a solid, short, open-world RPG. The overwhelming sense I have is the spirit of play and creativity and fun. It's not constrained by marketability or genre constraints or a need to being taken seriously, it's just an unconstrained little video game that lasts for 3 or 4 hours.

There are things to criticize: it plays at an extremely small set resolution that looks ugly when played at full screen, which is a shame because some of the art in the game is aesthetically really cool. It lacks documentation, which means figuring out how to set up a controller or how to make the game play full screen are harder than it should be. I actually lost about 10 minutes of progress at first because I misunderstood and thought the crystals all over the world were save points - they're not, you save from the menu. Also, the very beginning of the game before you figure out what your best abilities are and when you're still weak is a little too grindy.

It's still fun and very creatively inspiring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033936787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1495939674}
review: Imagine there was someone who had no idea what video games were at all. Not that they had never played one but they never have even heard of the concept of one.  This is because they spent all of their time sculpting their dreams out of clay. One day you decide to try and describe what a video game is and they decide to make one based on your description. Hylics is that game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202573992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1549407537}
review:
A strange, surreal experience.  Definitely worth the price for what you're getting.
I feel as though I should warn some of you that the combat is quite shallow, but besides that, the game's presentation and exploration is wonderfully odd and sometimes unsettling.  Take a look and enjoy the fever dream that is Hylics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040426516', 'num_games_owned': 951, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1572041460}
review:
What a surreal yet comfy experience. Hylics is that perfect kind of weird, mixed with some actually really fun JRPG mechanics. The characters are bizarre, the visuals are jaw-dropping, and the adventure you go on feels expansive. I don't think I've ever played a 3 and a half hour game that I could say felt expansive and vast. Hylics is an enjoyable non-linear RPG, full of gorgeous digitized claymation, and plenty of interesting dialogue. There was so many times when this game just made me giggle at how ludicrous it got sometimes, haha. This is a game where you can buy horse food for 5000$ and then give it to a horse, so that you can add him to your inventory. Wonderful. 

Highly reccomended. If you're looking for a weird RPG, or just a general trippy and cozy ride, Hylics is your best bet. Can't wait for Hylics 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041216112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1674105666}

review: Big yes for this, seriously fantastic visuals with the whole "scans of clay with digital coloring" aesthetic and some pretty lovable mix of noise rock and synthesizer heavy music. There's enough small considerations and detail on top of the basic JRPG combat that keeps it going for its brief length gameplay-wise. The story is pretty vague, it's hard for me to get the whole picture, but hopefully on a replay or in Hylics 2 I'll be able to get that all. Something about the villain wanting to "abandon science" who has a bunch of cultist worshippers.

review:
Игра охуенная. 
Выглядит охуенно, звучит охуенно. Играется, ну, если вы любитель джрпг, а необходимость самостоятельно вьезжать в правила игры вызывает лишь интерес, то играется тоже охуенно. 
Но даже если вы не любитель столь экспериментального экспириенса, это не страшно, ведь пробежать Hylics можно буквально за пару часов. Ну или часа за 4, если исследовать её на 100% (Элементы эксплореринга присутствуют). 
Получив при этом [b]массу[/b] удовольствия.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273942705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1539982429}
review:
This game is intensley alien. So much so that I felt genuinley uncomfortable, unlike an kind of uncomfortability I've felt before, when seeing the trailer for this game. From that point I knew I had to play it to know more, to understand just why it was so uncomfortable. I loved every moment.

This game feature a weird kind of language. All the words are in English, but, jumbled. However, there are enough cases of repition in syntax and diction, that it is clear that this language was in fact thought out and does in fact mean something. Or at least a good deal more effort than expected was used to make it seems like it does.

The art is phenomonal and abstract to an extreme degree, I highly highly reccomend it to those who are a fan of abstract art and/or claymation

Give it a try. It's less expensive than your lunch was to buy, and for a play time of 5 hours with minimal glitches, that's pretty dang cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198343256816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1545764535}
review:
UNA OBRA DE ARTE.

Duración media: 4 hrs
Idioma: Inglés

Hylics es una aventura surrealista, absurda y fuera de lo común. 
El arte es increíble, con solo ver las capturas del juego podrás notar las horas invertidas del desarrollador al mezclar gráficos de plastilina y colores pastel.
La música es extraña pero no tediosa, hace una increíble amalgama con los gráficos que derivan en una experiencia sublime para los sentidos.
¿La historia? algo simple pero eso no importa ya que para llegar al final tendrás que atravesar muchos lugares y situaciones.
El humor es extraño pero al final de cuentas divertido, los npc hablan con poesía y puedes asesinar enemigos con un burrito congelado.

Definitivamente debes de comprarlo, en días de descuento lo encuentras en $17.99 MX

--> En espera de Hylics 2 <--

author: {'steamid': '76561197960961932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1570350325}

author: {'steamid': '76561197990447580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1545593046}
review: I would put this as a maybe. From a visual perspective, its neat. I don't think the game is traditionally "fun" but I also don't think it sets out to be. This is ok, but I can't say that I ever found myself getting pulled in, unlike other games in the same vain (e.g. LISA). I do like the death mechanic though. It is interesting. The sequal looks really promising, though (not out at the time of this writing).

author: {'steamid': '76561198324784931', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1562104890}
review:
У тебя куча игр в библиотеке стима, но не во что играть? У тебя просто  Hylics нормального не было. Все хотят сюрреализм, не выдумывай
Цена смешная: 80 ( 40 на каждой распродаже) рублей и сломанная нахер психика
 
рандомный текст
очаровательные боссы
рпг

и котя с головой полумесяцем!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052658169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1553330227}
review:
I love this game.

It's clearly inspired by EarthBound, which is my favorite game of all time. It's basically a super artsy EarthBound on steroids while "overdosed" on hallucinogens, but sadly much shorter and far more nonsensical in a good way. Even despite the short length and despite only being marketed as a mostly recreational art piece/set game, it manages to be a fun and humorous game that will probably weird you out in an amusing way.

I am told that the normal game length for this is about 3 hours. I beat it in 5 due to extra exploration and generally taking my time to just take it all in.

Despite what I said earlier, do NOT go into this expecting EarthBound. It is clearly its own game and very unique. It's a good game, in my opinion, but I understand that this really won't be for everyone and is probably super niche. If you were to ask me if it surpasses EarthBound, I would have to say no and that while it doesn't, it manages to come a little close to EarthBound's level.

Aside from the graphics/visuals (I love the art), the quirkiness and the weird characters- What I liked most about this game were the crazy battles as well as the strange world.

Get this game if you like really weird *bleep*.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092347813', 'num_games_owned': 592, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1559865090}
