author: {'steamid': '76561198120338845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1540853079}
review:
As a fan of indie RPGs like Yume Nikki, OFF, Middens, this game was just a delight. Its got a really unique art style that really continues to intrigue you throughout the game without ever losing its charm. In terms of surreal-ness it reminds me alot of Middens with a bit of humor thrown in. It's relatively short (took me about 4 hours to get through) But for the amount of work and love that was poured into this game paying full price ($2.99) is no big deal at all for this experience! 

also 10/10 gotta love the soundtrack. :'D

author: {'steamid': '76561198384667515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1618001902}
review:
Apesar de praticamente não ter um enredo, hylics é uma experiência bem diferente de tudo. Um mundo totalmente diferente do nosso onde tudo é bizarro e não faz o menor sentido, seja nas falas, visual ou sons. 

O game contém um combate simples e divertido além de uma trilha sonora fora do comum como toda obra.

É estranho falar dele quando acabei de zerar, pois até agora fico pensando no quão louco deve ser seu criador. Principalmente pelas poucas piadas que percebi durante a jogada, o humor dele é inesperado, sério. 

O único ponto negativo que realmente me incomodou foram alguns mapas do jogo que eram muito bagunçados. Você só encontra algumas saídas de dungeons depois de explorar muiiito em alguns casos. Defeito que também ocorre por conta do design bizarrão que o jogo contém. Mas é um defeito pequeno perto da diversão que ele pode propocionar. 

Resumindo: curte jogos com um enredo muito elaborado mais que o gameplay e atmosfera? Não compre. Quer uma experiência bizarra que usa como base as mecânicas de jogos do rpg maker? Compre agora. 

Ansioso pela sequência, o trailer está incrível.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072377993', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1542317570}
review: I didn't know this game existed until I've seen the trailer for the second game. Mason's work with clay is surreal and something that isn't done in games anymore. The RPG resembles as some sort of anti-game because the game has almost no story and strange music. And I love it.  The characters who have nearly no lines of dialogue yet I fell in love with them. I am excited for the new game (To be released the Summer of 2019) because it will incorporate 3d elements, better visuals and beautiful anti music. I definitely recommend this game to anyone who is willing to try something new and has 4 hours to kill.

For the price, even undiscounted is more than a fair asking.

review: While Hylics is certainly not an especially good game, its JRPG elements make it engaging enough that a playthrough doesn't feel like a slog. Its surreal and absurd looks, plot and music give it a unique feel that makes it really worth it to play the game. A unique short and sweet experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994144145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1557086830}
review: Hylics is a nostalgic game, not to say you’ve playing anything like it before. Its reminds one of those mid-summer lazy days playing with clay and imagining all sorts of things. You’d make up nonsense characters and the nonsense things they’d say and do. This game is beautiful and weird. I’m glad I’m able to see something like this exist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105210365', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1538910833}
review:
There's a lot of things I can say that the disparate elements of Hylics are akin to - gameplay like Dragon Quest, music like Bill Orcutt, visuals like Bill Plympton - but that's not very descriptive of the experience of Hylics itself.
Go on, try it. It's cheap, can be beaten in four hours tops, and you'll never quite play anything like it again.

review: One of the best RPG like games i have ever played, great unique visuals that are all surreal and creative paired with subtle inside jokes scattered throughout the game. There very little to no story to this game, so that leaves room for you to make one up! This has more role-playing than your typical self proclaimed "RPG" though it still is not an RPG. The game is an example of how modern art doesn't have to be bad, i can't wait for Hylics 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561198275238295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1537262522}
review:
Description at the store page is quite correct: this really is more of a recreational program than actual video game in common interpretation. [b]"Animated art gallery with great psychodelic soundtrack wrapped in interactive form"[/b] is how I would describe this game.

Gameplay is mostly what you expect from game built in RPG Maker, but with weird surrealistic flavor of mechanics that author brings on top of game carcass. Meat of your enemies converted to your flesh (hp) in your afterlife instead of experience points, afterlife mechanics that encourages you to die again and again and so on. These are rather doubtful choices for your usual evening entertainment video game, but in Hylics, these things play beautifully.

Text and script are just supportive aspects of this piece, providing tips and playing with overall atmosphere of the game, but it could be possible ridden of all dialogues and do not lose almost any sense.

Graphics, music and sound design are what makes this game really stand out. Almost any praise you hear or see this game receive is revolved around it's visual style and soundtrack, which really isn't suprising at all. Mason Lindroth really is an [b]Artist[/b]. Not only does everything in this game look weird and surrealistic, but everything looks [i]beautiful[/i] and [i]harmonical[/i] with everything else. It isn't just weird shapes and animations thrown in and blended together, it's a complete harmonical composition where every piece of art plays great with others, be it monster sprite, battle soundtrack or casting animation.

If you are into that sort of art and looking for one evening entertainment for 3 bucks, this is the thing to get. I would also recommend searching other free games of this author: they have similar art style, but different genres.

I am looking forward for sequel: it's trailer looks like the game would be even more amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117208889', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1535575571}
review:
чудесная игра, от которой я получила большое удовольствие!
несмотря на несколько агрессивную экстравагантность графики, hylics - это на удивление расслабляющий опыт с незаурядным и неназойливым чувством юмора.
сильно впечатлили стиль и анимация: не ожидала, что графика может быть полноценной причиной для создания видеоигры, а не наоборот. нарратив, геймплей и саундтрек охотно подчиняются желанию автора создать виртуальное арт-пространство и не перетягивают на себя внимание.
очень понравилась философия death positivity в сюжете: дать игроку после смерти возможность восстановиться и построить парочку замков из песка - очень простой и неочевидный способ углубить ощущение расслабления от процесса игры.
i feel refreshed

author: {'steamid': '76561198027035640', 'num_games_owned': 1715, 'num_reviews': 315, 'playtime_forever': 3996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1709918633}
review:
Hylics, c’est tout simplement un - oserais-je dire – JRPG à la Final Fantasy. 

Sauf que ce n’est pas juste une copie, Hylics a une identité propre. Et une sacrée identité... 
 
Pour l’expliquer, je vais simplement vous conter l’histoire de ma vie. Ou plutôt de ma mort. 

Wayne (notre personnage) a été tué par 3 cultistes l'ayant atomisé à coup de doigts,et se retrouve dans les limbes. Après avoir parcouru les escaliers du temple tout en esquivant les dauphins sur les marches, je fais l’agréable rencontre d’un homme-lune en poncho vert dans une caverne, me demandant le plus gentiment du monde des explosifs. Comme j’en avais en ma possession, j’étais heureux de faire une bonne action. La bonne affaire, l’explosion a pu ouvrir un passage menant à une télévision diffusant un programme m’apprenant la Calibration. Une fois fait, je repartis au temple pour activer un Crystal me permettant de retourner chez moi, dans le monde des vivants. 
 
Vous commencez à comprendre, non ? 
 
Mais ce n’est pas tout ! 

 Hylics a aussi une identité visuelle assez particulière. Tout a l’air fait de pâte à modeler, de scans de jouets et le tout assemblé en stop motion. 

 
Je vous laisse un aperçu : 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1474960713 

 
Le jeu en lui-même est assez perturbant parce que rien ne nous guide. On peut parler aux PNJ qui nous donneront des informations (forcément, les dialogues sont tout aussi bizarres que le reste du jeu), nous pouvons explorer librement le monde, … Et tout ressemble plus ou moins à un trip sous acide au festival du village du coin. Mais c’est bien. 

 
/!\ ATTENTION /!\ 
 

Le jeu n’est pas traduit, la seule langue disponible est l’anglais. Alors comme les dialogues sont vachement perchés, attendez-vous à des maux de têtes pour d’une part traduire les mots, et d’autre part comprendre le vrai sens des phrases, vous êtres prévenus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004915682', 'num_games_owned': 932, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1640829663}
review:
More of an art piece than a true RPG, HYLICS exhibits beautiful claymation graphics with a Mars Volta-esque soundtrack and simple combat. There is no exp or levelling system, you simply get stronger from the items you equip. And if you die you can throw meat (collected from dead enemies) into a grinder to permanently buff yourself.
It's quite weird.

All of the NPC dialogue is randomly generated to create nonsensical conversations, and there is no clear goal in the game.
Even taking my sweet time I beat the game in about 3.5 hours.

But I definitely recommend the game for being a unique experience, or even something small to pick away at when you're taking a break from another game (heck, I was mostly playing this game during loading screens from larger games).

With interesting visuals, a trippy soundtrack, and easy gameplay, HYLICS is an oddly intriguing yet easy-going game.
Highly recommend picking this one up

author: {'steamid': '76561198051650126', 'num_games_owned': 531, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1594274144}
review:
[i]Earthbound[/i] by way of [i]Trout Mask Replica[/i].

Let's be clear: Though there is a good JRPG skeleton in here with innovative mechanics and it's a good deal more challenging than [i]Space Funeral[/i], the other "surreal vaguely-terrifying RPG" du jour, this still isn't a game you'd play for "fun" in a normal RPG sense. The plot is deliberately incoherent, with nearly every character speaking randomly generated senseless poetry. I beat it in about 3 hours, and that's from choosing to "grind." (I say that in quotes because there isn't XP or levels to speak of.) There's one town that sells equipment that never changes, so once you've kitted out your characters there isn't really much need to go back; there are hidden items and abilities you can get by solving psuedo-puzzles, but they're largely not necessary. Once you've beaten it, there's nothing else to do short of finding those aforementioned hidden items that are now useless because, well, there's nothing else to do.

But what makes [i]Hylics[/i] so compelling is just how committed it is to its atmosphere. The graphics are an almost disorienting mix of claymation, sprites, photography, and video all filtered through a semi-glitchy aesthetic. The music is loose and spare, mixing excellently with the visuals and "dialogue" to create a dadaist, alien feeling that still vaguely rhymes with tropes and structures of typical RPGs. Those tropes and structures are used as guides to lead you through exploring the world, giving just enough familiarity to not overwhelm you in sheer bizarreness, but still not enough to really make sense of what's going on. 

It's weird and stark and intentionally opaque, but it's an extremely original aesthetic experience, and I'm very glad I played it. If you've got an open mind about games, or just really liked [i]Space Funeral[/i], [i]Hylics[/i] is worth immersing yourself in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076453885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1525292870}
review:
어떻게든 게임 상의 모든걸 꼬아놓아야 겠다는 의지는 스팀 상점에 걸린 몇 장의 스크린샷을 보는것 만으로도 충분히 느낄 수 있습니다. 제작자가 사소한 것 하나까지 혼자 만든 의도적으로 열화시킨 기묘한 색감의 캐릭터들과 애니메이션과 전투 효과와 배경들, 제작자가 직접 작곡한 마치 애니멀 콜렉티브가 15년 전 환각상태로 대충 합주하고 영원히 잊어버렸을듯한 음악들, 마치 초현실 부조리 시를 읊는 듯 하지만 사실 랜덤하게 바뀌는 아무 의미 없는 소리를 하는 NPC들. 이 모든 기묘한 재료들과 독창적인 아이디어가 더해져 만들어진건 전형적인 알만툴식 게임입니다. 아이러니 그 자체.

그렇다고 완전히 알만툴식 기본 RPG 게임은 아니고 게임 자체로도 어느 정도 꼬아놓은 부분이 있습니다. 적당히 죽는게 게임을 진행하기 훨씬 더 수월한 시스템이나 캐릭터의 성장 방식이 그렇습니다. 게임의 분량은 짧지만 게임 초반 이후로 계속 난이도가 낮아지는 이상한 난이도 곡선 덕분에 스피드런 등 다양한 파고들기식 플레이로 더 즐길 수 있어보입니다.

어쨌든 게임 전체가 정성들여 수공예로 깎아낸 깜짝 상자입니다. 몇 프레임 정도 즐길만한 요소에 온갖 노력을 쏟아놓고 정작 게임 상으로 중요해야 할 부분은 무심하게 만들어진 부분도 있지만 그게 전혀 단점으로 느껴지지 않는 정말 특이한 게임입니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035644453', 'num_games_owned': 1096, 'num_reviews': 328, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1529962520}
review:
A bizarre journey through a claymation fever dream. You play as Wayne, a moon headed creature as he journeys across the strange landscape to do... something? The game is very unclear about its goals, but the journey is at least interesting to look at.

Unfortunately it's marred by its low resolution (even on fullscreen) & clunky controls. Its tone, artstyle & animations are very cool; but the game is a chore to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971154053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1529899846}
review: Half game, half acid trip. Explore a world of strange glyphs, obscene structures whose brickwork is wriggling clay intestines, and dark, moist caves where fleshy monstrosities lurk. Battle cultists, speak to the wizened Sage of Computers (and his brothers), or just jam out with your friends in a rock concert. Mason Lindroth has taken up the onus of consuming psychedellic substances so you don't have to. Expand your mind. Play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159228128', 'num_games_owned': 9, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1501919497}
review: Absolutely loved this game. Spend a whole 7-8 hours after I had JUST installed it and already beat it all. I can NOT wait for Hylics 2 to come out!!! (If you haven't already seen the preview on youtube from Mason Lindroth you should!!) The graphics and animations are beautiful and extremely unique, not a lot of games look like this, which makes me love it even more. I wonder if this is what it's like to be high. It's definitely not your average game, it's waay more than that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019768799', 'num_games_owned': 963, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1529638517}
review: I love this game. I think the art style is very charming and very fitting for the world the game is set in. Unfortunately, the color schemes and clay style are an easy to blame the game and everything in it on drugs. But that's a disservice to the game that's underneath it all. The mechanics are very solid, reminded me a lot of Earthbound, and it doesn't hold your hand. You're free to explore the world to learn the game and see what it has to offer. And oh boy, what it has to offer. Short, I was able to finish it in a 4-hour sitting, but I can take comfort in knowing a sequel is on the way. I got it on sale for $1.50, but even at full price, it's only $3. What do you have to lose?

author: {'steamid': '76561198170177399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1538873690}

review: ништяк

author: {'steamid': '76561198100129794', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1587166230}
review:
What a pleasantly tranquil and otherworldly experience. The surreal atmosphere and gorgeously refreshing claymation art is what you're paying for when you play this. You might expect the gameplay to lack but it's surprisingly very forgiving if it proves itself too difficult for you. If you do get stuck, it's no big deal to look up online where to go even if you're afraid of spoilers, because the story is almost seemingly non-existent outside of a few lines of dialogue and sequences.

The controls can be a little janky sometimes and you might get lost when you start the game, wandering into the wrong area and getting frustrated when the enemies are too tough. 

Can't wait for the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045189718', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1703391581}
review:
Don't buy this expecting a conventional game.  Like it says, "Recreational program with JRPG elements."  Now, the main chunk of what the game is is a sort of Earthbound style RPG with claymation MS DOS-looking animations and scenery.  The dialogue is usually non-sense and it has a delightfully cheeky sense of humor to it.  Keep in mind it is only 3-5 hours long--which isn't necessarily a negative.

IS HYLICS WORTH IT?  
Do you want a game, or an experience?  

-If you want a game, you'll only find a surrealist proto-game that MAY charm you so hard you'll love it; even if it's barebones.  
-If you want a charming and delusional interactive art piece, then corrode ablatively against the  dampified Wayne.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050072837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1664259294}
review:
Sadly has a game-breaking bug with keyboard that makes it unplayable.
There's keyboard remapping that lets you remap SHIFT to G and such, which is highly confusing, limited and does not include the trouble arrow keys anyway.
Couldn't get past the intro. Refunded.

EDIT:
The problem turned out to be GlovePIE and it only shows up on very few titles (made in RPG Maker VX specifically). Uninstalling it fixed the issue, though I'm sure changing some configuration could have done the same, but I wasn't using it anymore.
Rebought!

review:
Hylics non è un semplice gdr fatto con RPG maker.

Hylics è un esperienza che quando la porti a termine, ti lascia cambiato, probabilmente con mille domande ma con un unica certezza: non si è mai giocato a qualcosa di simile prima.

Una perla di assoluta bellezza: 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198383730811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1568078602}

author: {'steamid': '76561198196924683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1568685540}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014182958', 'num_games_owned': 727, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1526477399}
review:
Having just finished Hylics I can say that it should be perceived as a piece of art rather than a game. The surreal visuals paired with perfectly fitting sound design are excellent and bizarre world of Hylics is interesting to explore.
Gameplay can be a bit frustrating at parts, story is not very gripping, yet the game itself encourages the player to just enjoy simple little pointless things like playing in a concert or building sand castles at a beach and enjoy the journey itself - the destination doesn't even matter.

All in all the game is definitely worth the 3 bucks it goes for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079269666', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1624750874}

review: This is one of the most beautiful games ever made and Mason Lindroth is a master at surrealism. Incredibly fun and inspiring. I highly suggest playing this game, especially since it’s so criminally cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072558090', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1573933919}
review: An extremely stylized RPG that will take you on a surreal, confusing adventure. Don't be afraid to look up a guide, you'll probably need it unless you already know what you're doing. Easily some of Lindroth's best work, and with an even more promising sequel on the way, it's a good time to buy this extremely underpriced and amazing RPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198293321109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1525899440}
review: it's a game about friendship.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154889191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1525727319}
review: Hylics is a beautifully abstract game, yet has very solid RPG mechanics. The ways in which your character becomes stronger are very unique and interesting. I also have to give the game credit for not being obtuse in what you have to do. There are no cryptic puzzles or anything that would cause you to look at a walkthrough. You feel a sense of progression from beginning to end. Both the aesthetics of the game and the gameplay have equal polish so there is no reason not to get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020438964', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1501415818}

author: {'steamid': '76561198080246207', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 167, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1712326595}
review: Less of a game and more of an experience. I've never done acid before, but between the claymation, the art style and the psychedelic music, this is probably the closest I'll get. Don't go into it expecting revolutionary plot or gameplay mechanics, though. If there was ever a game (or "recreational program" as it likes to call itself) that should be described as "not for everyone," this would be it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198579835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1523507494}
review: Hylics is a surreal RPG Maker game where all the visuals are made of clay. The aesthetic is incredible and beautiful, and is truly what makes the game special. There isn't a lot in the name of story, and the vast amount of dialouge is literal nonsense, but I still did not have much trouble figuring out where to go or what to do. Some people may also find the music repetitive or annoying, but I found it incredibly calming. I beat Hylics in about three hours and it was a relaxing, enjoyable time. There isn't really a game out there quite like Hylics, and I recommend it to anyone with basic RPG knowledge, especially at a price of only a few dollars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198187703227', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1592783087}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198083093010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1647154289}
review: Collect vegetables to heal. Equip toliet paper as armor. Give a man a paper cup to recruit him. Melt into a puddle of clay when you die. Unbelievably stoked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151505867', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1563885443}
review:
WOW!
I love this so much, and I can't really explain why.
Maybe because it's so different and special. I love the art, the broken soundtrack, the fights everything!
Even the fact that there's not much of a plot here is really adding to the weird and surreal atmosphere.
I wish the game was longer, I finished it in like 3-4 hours. I think it's too short but other than that - perfect!

I recommend everyone to try this game! it's cheap, fun, unique and really good!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971992910', 'num_games_owned': 1806, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1522604011}

review: Hylics is a RPG game where you control a crescent moon guy running around, attacking enemies, and making friends. Classic JRPG style game, but the setting and dialogue are so surreal that it feels like that time you took LSD and played some JRPG. You remember nothing of that night, just that it was weird. Hylics helps you recreate that experience just for $3!

author: {'steamid': '76561198116073285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1510780523}
review:
Hylics is the kind of game you should try if you're looking for the comfort of a simply structured game (it has the skeleton of a jRPG), but want to be pleasantly surprised by everything else about it. 

The art is, well, it's clay, and pointillated hands, generally interesting and different.
The music is surprisingly pleasant, and ranges from having a hint of otherworldliness to being 'off' in a way that fits the mood. If you like guitars as much as I do, you'll definitely enjoy it.
From the way you 'level up' (grinding enemy meat, but only when you die), to the randomly-generated NPC lines and the way you reshape the clay of the world with your hands during battle, the game doesn't take much for granted, which is only a good thing. 

Overall, it's a very enjoyable experience that's definitely worth an afternoon of your time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198022092299', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 831, 'last_played': 1543971341}
review: Extremely fun recreational program with light JRPG elements. Visual masterpiece that acts like a bad fever dream in all the right ways. Could use some polish but that's exactly what the sequel looks like.. looking forward to Hylics 2. 8.5/10

Definitely worth the money. Check it out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198114576143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1519783842}
review: Hylics is an experience. It's two hours of pure clay, awesome tunes, a bizzare, yet entangling art, and many neat little things to enjoy from randomly generated text. It's worth the bucks to support an artist like Lindroth, because the game is weird art like no other.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025286003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 348, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1519615033}
review: The game starts off confusing and no guide has been written yet, so heads up. It's a confunsing game, but that's not a bad thing. It's like little I've played before, It falls in with other wierd rpg maker games, but this game just has so much more claymantion wierdness then anything I've seen. There are some light rpg elements but the art is front and center here. The music is hit or miss for me, it's very much under that artsy side of electronic/rock/jazz style. Overall the combat is odd and without spoiling much, the first parts of the game untill you can find a companion is frustrating. It's worth the price for 2-3 hours of odd fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031713009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1562972218}

author: {'steamid': '76561198117984809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1526844177}
review:
I saw the trailer and i instantly fell in love with the art-style of this game. Something unusual and incredibly inspired. The game itself is very playable, and that surprised me since i thought initially that only the graphic compartment would be good. There are some issues, all fixable with little effort. I can not wait for the second game.

Check it out also the web page of the author, Mason Lindroth: he is a genious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064164574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1553433317}
review:
На самом деле Hylics - это нечто совершенно новое, нераспознанный гений, глоток свежего воздуха.
Пластилиновая скитлз-блевотина, из которой не хочется выныривать. 
Сначала все очень непривычно и странно, но потом этот трип превращяется в оригинальное путешествие по миру осязаемого и материального. Все сюрреалистичное становится родным, и пластелиновая еда кажется съедобной а голова Вэйна совершенно нормальной. 
Невероятно вставляют архитектура, ландшафт и графика в принципе.
Отдельно порадовали ушедробящая музыка и бессмысленость текстов (которые, к слову, рандомно выпадают).
В общем, незабываемые ощущения или "нечто совершенно иное" - это сюда.

P.S. Дорогой Мэйсон Линдрот, пожалуйста, оставайся таким же креативным чудаком всегда. С любовью.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058558112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1519243576}

author: {'steamid': '76561198122983060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1689638736}
review:
A well-priced game that is actually pretty fun to play! Although the story was conveyed to me through randomly-generated phrases, it didn't matter because the graphical style is simply awing. Combat is pretty fun, too, the attack/skill/item animations are mesmerizing. The experimental music is also a joy, fitting right in with the graphics. I typically forget I'm playing an RPG Maker game, this is done so well.
VERY excited for the sequel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013759974', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1544335916}
review:
Ill be brutally honest, i had less than one clue as to what i was doing the entire time i played this game. The story was confusing if there was one, and i didnt quite know what my goal was.

but in some way the game makes this work.

even though i had no clue WHAT i was doing, the game always presented itself well as to WHERE i was going. though open, the game directs you so you know what your partial goal is at any given time. If you dont know what to do, exploring will almost always reward you with a way to go.

-The health and mana system, being Flesh and Will and how they are upgraded, are both very unique and well executed

-the humor is surreal, so if you like that sort of thing youre going to dig it

-the game looks incredibly unique with its pseudo claymation style. visually its pretty compelling, especially in the fights

-the combat itself is very tight and the special skills feel great to use

only downside is one time i did get very lost and had to google what to do next, but as far as weird surreal rpg's go this is pretty standard. The game felt like it curved well in difficulty, but was fairly easy to get through for the most part if you buy the right items. 

If you like strange RPG's like Off, Lisa, and Space Funeral. Get Hylics. I think the next one is coming out this year sometime too, so thats exciting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037253388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1659131342}

author: {'steamid': '76561198012310051', 'num_games_owned': 608, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1689344802}
review:
The world of Hylics is the closest thing to an alive Dalì painting in a videogame. The main core of Hylics is an old school JRPG, with turn combats, a world map full of secrets and vehicles to explore it. But Hylics is also an experimental, bizarre and unique game.

Almost every object can be examined: not always will give an item, but for sure will be an interesting animation. Trees of different shapes will shrink, trash bins will smash, baths will fall throwing strange masses, sand can be used to build castles, and everything with gorgeous clay animations.

The magic system also spreads innovation. The characters will learn new abilities interacting with televisions hidden around the world. For example the main attack will hurt the enemy just snapping the fingers, while using the dynamite will cause an atomic blast.

Everything is a new discovery and a surprise in the surreal and whimsical world of Hylics.

Full review: https://surrealandcreepy.wordpress.com/2018/02/02/hylics-a-surreal-painting-in-claymation/

author: {'steamid': '76561198012534073', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1678138063}
review:
Short and cheap game that's both got a surreal art style and offers a neat twist on traditional JRPG mechanics. It doesn't hold your hand, and that makes figuring out the strange world even more satisfying. The art is beautifully weird, and the music is chill. In some ways, it is more of an art showcase than a game.

The game is open-ended, has a finite amount of enemy encounters, and doesn't have a traditional levelling system. Your party members mostly start out as blank slates (they have 1 spell to start out with) who can fill certain roles depending on what items you use on them.

My only complaint is that they don't make it clear that you should save some of the items that permanently increase stats (namely meat, paper cups, and muscle appliques) until you gain more party members. It would be nice if Lindroth added an NPC that advises you to save them for later or something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041877545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1605937804}
review: One of the most bizarre gaming experiences ever. While it's not gonna be up everyone's alley, I highly recommend everyone still check it out at least once. Super surreal and incredibly odd, but that's what keeps you coming back for more. Very Mother-esque in its battle mechanics, but just take the absurdity that series has and crank it way past the max. It's like the insane fever dream you want to keep having. It frightens you and excites you all at once. It's also dirt cheap, so what other excuse could you have NOT to play it?

author: {'steamid': '76561198289647353', 'num_games_owned': 38, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1520660311}
review:
[h1]なにこのゲーム、意味わかんない。[/h1]
仮にあなたが英語を学習していて、英文はスムーズに読めたとしても、このゲームの文章を読めばそんな言葉が口をついて出てくるはずだ。
大半のNPCの発言が[b]ランダム生成[/b]。(ランダム生成で喋らないキャラは、話しかけるときモヮワヮワみたいなSEがならない)
格好悪くドタドタと腕と足を動かしながら歩いていく主人公Wayneとそのご一向。
冷凍ブリトーは敵に投げつけるもの。しかしレンチンしたアツアツのブリトーは回復アイテム。[spoiler]なんでアツアツのブリトーがトイレ調べると見つかるんだよ[/spoiler]
トイレットペーパーとかごみ箱のフタを装備できる。
通常攻撃は指弾き。剣とか振り下ろさない。
スキルはテレビを見ることで習得する。[strike]それなんていうビデオ教材[/strike]
[spoiler]Wayneのパーティに参加する紅一点のSomsnosaが、虫を調べることでなぜか攻撃力が上がる[/spoiler]
[u]何を言ってるかわからないと思うが、実際ゲーム内ではそうなのである。[/u]

しかしこのゲーム、やればやるほどSAN値がじわじわ減っていきそうなグラフィックをしていると同時に、かなりハマってしまうのだ。唯我独尊唯一無二で独特なBGM、SEも相まってじわじわとプレイヤーの脳はHYLICSの世界観に侵食されていく。
気付いた時には時すでに[strike]お寿司[/strike]遅し、もうプレイヤーは完全にHYLICSのとりこになってしまっている。


そんなキテレツなこのゲーム、なんと通常価格298円。コンビニで麺類等一個を買うのを我慢すれば十分買える。
しかも続編、HYLICS 2の発表もされている！HYLICS 2は今作よりグラフィックも進化し、2Dゲームでありながらさらに立体感を含めたものになっている。(レビュー執筆時までに公開されたスクショ参考)

[h1]さぁ、なんの因果かこのページを開いたそこの誰か。HYLICSを買おう！[/h1]


*ここからは初心者ガイドになっております、ネタバレが含まれますので全部伏字*

[spoiler]ゲームを始めたら、主人公Wayneの家を調べ尽くそう。家を出ると緑色のオブジェのようなものが生えているが、一応回復アイテム(Vegetable, これのどこが野菜なのか、なんの野菜なのか見当はつかないが)なので調べて収穫。
近くの街に移動。クリスタルがあるはずだから調べよう。これで死んだあと同じ色のクリスタルを調べることで、町からリスポーンできる。店の中を通ったりして上の方に行くと、モンスターがうじゃうじゃいるエリアに行ける道がある。最初はフルボッコにされてもいい。3回死ぬと死後の世界の右下の通路を通してもらえるようになり、オノがもらえる。
モンスターのいるエリアにテントがある。その中にDedesmulnという緑色の絵の具をチューブから出したような顔をしたキャラクターがいる。彼のためにエリア内に落ちた砂漠のあちこちを調べて紙コップを捜そう。テントの中にある不思議な機械を調べてスイッチをオンにしたままテント内のベッドで寝ると、砂漠のどこにコップがあるのかわかるヒントがある。[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197988374218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1514620322}
review:
Short and sweet and utter nonsense.

Like old school RPGs, Late 80s MTV animation, and don't care too much if you have no clue what's going on? Buy Hylics.

It's one of those art games, and its goal is mostly to make you confused. It's also kind of okay as a game.

Nothing in this damn game makes sense, but that's kind of the point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073467397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1540209394}
review:
Занимательный психодел, с интересными идеями по механике, для игры созданной на RPG Maker. Притом боёвка не представляет собой сплошное щелканье по самой сильной атаке весь бой. Ещё есть несколько забавные моменты, а бывала и крипота (После того лабиринта со статуями я теперь знаю, что будет преследовать меня в кошмарах). Респект Мэйсону Линдроту, креативный же человек! И ведь не сложно самому подобное придумать, сядь да и начни сочинять и продумывать. Однако именно он этим и занялся, и подошел к этому делу соответственно! За это он и заслужил уважения!
 Минус только один - коротковато. Но, черт возьми, возможно оно и к лучшему. Бывают вещи, которые надо принимать в строгой дозе.
 В любом случае, если вы любите психодел или хотиие попробовать сыграть во что нибудь странное - вы пришли по адресу! Да и цена не кусается. Единственное НО - Без знания языка не суйтесь! Русификаторов нету. 
 9 тёплых буррито из 10 котеек с моей рожей, когда младший брат показывает мне какой то клон Minecraft.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150003483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1574624141}
review:
Hylics is worth buying at full price, though I bought it on sale. It's truly unique, and even better a playing experience than it looks in the trailer. Not only is it an interesting and gorgeous looking game (with one of the best death screens ever) but it's also a pretty fun rpg. It's not too hard, and not too easy (the hardest part is probably figuring out what to do, since you're not really given much instruction), which makes it perfect for a casual afternoon game (I left mine running by accident, which is why it says 6 hours, but I finished it in about 4, having fought everyone and gotten all the items/powerups - I'm a slow player, so one could probably finish it in two if they were going faster. But I like to relax and enjoy the weirdness :) ).

All in all, well worth playing, whether you're a fan of jrpg style games or not. Easily worth the couple bucks, and definitely an unforgettable experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219687381', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1514097758}
review:
It's a pretty game.

Review
-----------

Art/Graphics 10/10

The art of the game is very abstract and has a unique style, to the death animation to attacks everything is animated very well. I love the character designs, enemy designs and way everything moves.

Music 8/10

The music in this game is also very abstract. From mellow to smashing a guitar this game has some very weird but good songs in it to listen too. If I could buy the soundtrack I would in a heartbeat.

Gameplay : 6/10

The gameplay is not really the focus for this game. It's put on the side to have more focus of the abstract elements of this game. I do enjoy the attack, item and enemy attack animations and the collecting aspect of gaining more skills as you go. But it is very limited though and the game just ends after the last boss. Movement can be awkward at times as well.


Overall : 7.5/10

It's more of a recreational program than a game. Even Lindroth states this and thats exactly what you should expect in this game. It's a trip basically, go into this one expecting some weird stuff. One of my favorite games out there for sure, even if the 7.5 looks low it's just cause it's less of a game and more of an art piece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083713710', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1546230434}

author: {'steamid': '76561198134256916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1512797482}
review:
閱讀以抽象無道理的詞彙推砌而成的異化幽默世界，
每個場景交換都佈滿著前衛元素，透過睇電視習得戰鬥技巧，並觀賞戰鬥動畫扭曲的美學。
美妙的BGM，幽幽的節奏迫使自己必須探索這團荒謬的平衡究竟建立於何處。
然而死亡沒有懲罰，生命如此不值，恣意地死去變得理所當然。
於是乎探索成為一切，可以討厭它帶給你無限輪迴的無意義，但也無法否定此詩意的型態。

遊玩經驗類似LSD:Dream Emulator，
微妙的體驗，在於投入了什麼而不斷有所得失的回饋。
可能得到實在界外之惆悵卻得以滿足。
亦或是從頭到尾地持續發笑，擁抱這種陌生的安全感。

author: {'steamid': '76561197996672007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1663879586}
review: Feels like a real art game. Just fiddle about a strange world for a little while and listen to odd but relaxing music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113264796', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1511927747}
review:
Pros:
- Absolutely no instructions on what to do or what stats do
- Game doesn't tell you to avoid battles early on, and your first fight WILL kill you probably
- Being dead is its own level, with items to find, characters to talk to, and ways to boost stats
- Dying is literally a game mechanic and a good way to get around
- Some NPCs casually talk about death and how invonvenient it is
- Game doesn't tell you to save your stat boosting items until you have all party members
- This means your last 1 or 2 party members will be horribly underpowered for the final boss fight

These are positives because games hold your hand too much imo, and this is a nice change of pace. It has a very similar feel to old open-world RPGs where you could go anywhere and fight any monster at any level, forcing you to learn by trial and error. Once you get the hang of how the game flows, however, it's an amazing experience.

Only con:
- It's really short. You can finish it in a day.

I really hope the creators continue with this saga, or these characters. I've never had so much fun with an RPG game in a long time. This game scratches a super specific itch I didn't even know I had.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068036359', 'num_games_owned': 748, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 984, 'last_played': 1622685540}
review:
You're underpaying for it.

Hylics is beautiful and strange. Death is strongly worked into the game as a mechanic rather than punishment, without compromising difficulty you have the opportunity to grow stronger through death. More than the amazing visuals I honestly love this games soundtrack.

Hylics 2 comes out soon and it's gonna hit big, be a fuckin' hipster like me. Hand out the dosh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085378504', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1562586322}
review: Great surreal jrpg similiar to games like Ib, OFF, Gingiva, and Middens. The artwork is pretty and abstract, and the soundtrack is very well done and worth listening to outside of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100910467', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1401, 'last_played': 1692325067}
review: Fantastic game, visually and has the perfect amount of gameplay for a small RPG game. Definitely recommend if you like surreal visuals and overall strange and vague setting elements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103542400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1704036736}
review:
Hylics truely is a labor of love.
The art style is amazing.
The level design is simple, yet engaging.
Short, fun game.

The only complaint I have, is that the dialogue is pretty pretentious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095981386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1522887161}
review: If you're looking for an RPG that's surreal as all get out and has a great combat system then this is the game for you. The game is somewhat non-linear, has great music, and a bizarre world. One downside is the story is non-existent and lacks any depth, but for its price it is definitely worth it. Can't wait for Hylics 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028135356', 'num_games_owned': 763, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1596045330}
review:
A simple RPG reliant on its aesthetic value.
Relatively balanced progression, not too much grinding required [spoiler](no pun intended)[/spoiler].
Clever and humorous dialogues.
Very original and fascinating visuals.
Inexpensive.

Not very long, but an feast for the senses, no doubt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158543955', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1669167250}
review:
-A relatively short game, but absolutely worth the price. Hylics is hard to describe what it's like, it's just one of those games that you can't put into words, you just play it and enjoy it. The store page by itself describes it as blunt as possible, and needs no further statements. 

-Regardless, I'll try anyways.
The animations used in combat are pretty alluring and are the bread and butter of battles, it keeps them from being bland as you'll find yourself using unnecessarily moves just to look at. These animations are more than just "eye candy" as they give the moves  emphasis or adds intensity to varying attacks, making each feel natural.   

-Words cannot justify the game, everything makes some sense when you launch the game.

[b] -Important to note that any text that IS relative to the story is spoken simple enough to understand, [/b] the rest is gibberish from use of random text generation.

-Overall it's pretty unheard of and I've not talked to many who have known of it, but it's surely worth a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255038307', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1708677671}
review:
An RPG for people that don´t like traditional RPGs
Hylics has a pleasing and creative artstyle alongside a soundtrack that i can only describe as anti-music,all this combined helps to make a short but absorbing experience full of memorable characters and mechanics

All this was made by a single person

author: {'steamid': '76561198035952504', 'num_games_owned': 3218, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1563276315}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970282291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1511155063}
review: Despite almost all text being randomly generated, this game is secretly a well crafted RPG. The art style is something out of Clay Fighter, everything is hand made and fluid, a lot of time went into the visuals, and it looks amazing for it. Its silly, fun, and is extremely creative. You attack by snapping your fingers at the enemy! The music is abstract and almost every new area has a new song to go with it. If this was released in the mid 90s it would have been a cult classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103417005', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1557133971}
review:
I will say that the gameplay is very average, very typical RPG, but that's not the purpose of it.

The soundtrack and visuals are beautiful and make for a very unique experience. Lindroth's other games give me the impression that he likes to focus on the weird and unique visuals. He does a great job here.

After thinking about it extensively the game feels increasingly like a work of art,

author: {'steamid': '76561198062658749', 'num_games_owned': 542, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 1075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1593101495}
review:
即使是在NPC支离破碎的话语下无法很好解释的世界观中，首先玩家也会被特殊处理过的粘土画面所吸引。
在这之下有着王道RPG游戏的玩法，但取消了等级制，提升HP需要从杀死敌人后掉落的‘肉’作材料，并到死后的海边经过碎肉机处理变成HP点数；MP是靠旅途中找到纸杯并到分布在各地的饮水机提升；特殊技能同样找分布在各地的电视机获得。
但是HP和MP是同伴一起跟着提升的，除主人公Wayne外还有3位同伴，所以推荐找齐他们后才提升HP和MP，技能也是同伴需要重新看过一次电视机才能获得。






通关后我非常在意月之王和Wayne之间曾经发生过什么事。

author: {'steamid': '76561197999460600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1508884263}
review: So creative, fun, weird, and surreal.  Mason come out with Hylics 2 blease.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999257290', 'num_games_owned': 436, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1625454060}
review:
Pretty simple gameplay (not in a bad way), with an incredibly good soundtrack. Loaded with interesting design choices, that aren't often seen and are pretty unique, stuff like:
-Attacking stuff has first person animations
-Most things you see is made and animated out of clay
-Really weird and surreal atmosphere that's pretty unique to me
-Death is a mechanic that lets you level up, instead of having to re-load a save and waste time
-Plenty of 'attention to detail' mechanics like making sand castles that don't serve a purpose, that you might not even find unless you're just exploring and messing around with stuff

If the game interests you from the preview video and screenshots, and the stuff I mentioned above sounds cool to you, it's 100% worth the incredibly modest 3 dollars.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975799076', 'num_games_owned': 1742, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1658665216}

review: Very fun. Loved it! The clay and the simple sounds made it feel literally hand-made, a quality that is tough to get across in a digital product. The ocean waves, for example are made out of blue clay with finger lines drawn through them that bend and flex in a simple animation. So someone's hands crafted your graphics. :-D

author: {'steamid': '76561198024376854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1504404708}

author: {'steamid': '76561198058469527', 'num_games_owned': 529, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1504320064}
review:
edit: vote hylics for the defies deception award!

nice little cheap adventure; took me a little under 4 hours in game time to finish my first playthrough (although i'm pretty slow at rpgs), wasn't disappointed. if you're expecting a really in-depth rpg in any aspect from gameplay or story, you're looking at the wrong game, it's more of an art showcase set to music (i'd dare to label a genre like prog rock but that's barely my alley) featuring interactive landscapes and characters.

hylics is built with a version of rpg maker so anyone whose played an rpg maker game before (LISA, for example) will feel somewhat at home with the mechanics but many are stripped barebones and are super simplified if utilized at all. the combat isn't much, but it doesn't take away from the game. there's a nice variety in this game's items and equivalent to 'magic' in other rpgs; afaik many of the possible stats an instrument (weapon) or wearable object can have don't have any significance or bonus at all, and some have separate bonuses that aren't made obvious or are mentioned in the item description instead of as an added status effect, or something.

game isn't extremely hard but i died a lot; frequently at the start trying to get my bearings (so don’t be discouraged), by trying to avoid instant-death enemies (more-so intentional obstacles), and intentionally not taking the time to heal or take care of my characters because death has almost no penalty

every time your party dies, you’re taken to a hub where you can pick one of eight activatable checkpoints to transport to that you find throughout the game, and you’re thrown right back in and can go refight (or avoid) whatever killed you from full health/will (MP). this is also where you ‘level up;’ killing enemies gives you ‘meat’ which you can take to the meat grinder in this after-life hub to gain more health; initially making you stronger every visit back.

you can become stronger and gain more bonuses (some of them nearly essential for fighting certain enemies) by buying items at shops, although, there’ll be almost next to no need to revisit shops, and there’s very few across the entire game, so it won’t be a huge deal after you’ve bought and found some of the best equipment. special moves that use will (basically MP) to cast are learned from interacting with TVs throughout the map and can all either damage enemies, heal your allies, or remove status effects (although I’ve got no clue what some of them do; the game won’t always tell you, so whatever), and there’s a comfortable amount of variety. i haven’t even found them all, i’m sure

there isn’t really much of a cohesive story and the dialogue is insane and nonsensical; it took me a while to realize it but as far as I can tell most of the dialogue with minor importance is pre-written pieces of sentence interchanged with randomized gibberish (as in, you’ll get a different spiel every time you talk to some characters), which definitely adds to the game’s weirdness factor, already pretty high because of the aesthetic and the music.

the art and the music (which pretty much makes up the core of the game) is likely not for everybody, but if you can stomach the trailers and screenshots and just wanted to know more about the game before you spend all of a little over 3 dollars (canadian), you should definitely pick this up.

also, the final boss’ name is [spoiler]gibby[/spoiler]. fucking [spoiler][url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_cRPk6DXPkc]gibby[/url][/spoiler].

author: {'steamid': '76561198313993254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1492960542}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022305767', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1503439503}
review: This is the best game ever made on RPGMaker.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030974583', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1502221417}
review:
Brilliantly bizarre, endlessly intriguing and full of novel ideas, this short RPG takes everything you'd come to expect from an RPG Maker game and turns it on its head. The claymation aesthetic reminds me of classic adventure games such as the Neverhood (as does the irreverent humour), but with a distinctly Terry Gilliam-esque twist. The music is unfailingly disconcerting, embellishing the quirky world with a thick, slightly sinister atmosphere. The surrealist style is spot-on, and never fails to catch you off guard from the moment you first try to loot a rubbish bin only to accidentally crush it.
The game isn't massively challenging or grindy, and won't keep you going for 100-odd hours with drawn-out melodrama, but it will leave an impact. I can promise you that much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000322297', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1559031797}
review: It is a fun little 3 hour adventure.  Takes some time to adjust at the begning but I soon snapped into it and loved it.  Great character designs and unique art and presentation.  Would recommend it for what it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049391660', 'num_games_owned': 1167, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1501705313}

author: {'steamid': '76561198205894331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1501956414}
review: Like 5 minutes in I found a warm burrito in my toilet

author: {'steamid': '76561198352136600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1504553235}
review: If your a fan of surreal art, indie rpgs, or even if you just have three bucks in your pocket you should give Hylics a go. The story may be a bit hard to understand and some connections are in place without any history on why. But the trippy artstyle, beautiful soundtrack (seriously one of most well-fitting and just overall amazing osts I've heard in quite a long time,) funny interactions and strange mechanics this game has to offer well make up for a lackluster story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105623476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1598077174}
review: This is one of the weirdest games I have played, but it was an interesting experience to say the least. The claymation art style makes it visually appealing and the strange jokes are pretty entertaining. The soundtrack isn't the best but it does fit pretty well into the weird world that you explore. The game doesn't have any tutorials so don't be discouraged if you die a lot at the beginning. Despite the weak story and some other minor problems, everything else about the game makes it worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993218087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1499285425}
review:
This game is very enjoyable nonsense. Basic gameplay that's pushing you along (you basically level up when you die) and does a good job at being relaxing. Very subtle humour. Short. 

It was 65p in the sale.

review: This game isn't for everyone, but if the art style, music, JRPG game play, and unapologetic weirdness seem like fun to you, you'll have a blast.  It's a game unlike any other.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284906481', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1561176780}
review:
Hylics is a series I love a lot. I've spent hours drawing these characters, and browsing animations and fanart. Most of this fondness stemmed from the masterpiece that is the second game, and recently, I decided to pick the first game up again after so many years, and it was exactly how I remembered it, both the good and the bad.

If you are picking this up for a hypercomplex rpg experience, you are in the wrong place. Despite being an RPG by genre, the combat in this game is the least interesting part. And while that may be a huge turn off for some people, I think if everything else can pick up the slack, the game can still hold up. And hold up it does.

The first thing anyone notices about this game is the artstyle. It's all digitized claymation models, and combined with the strange alien designs, it makes for a bizarre wonderful experience you won't see replicated anywhere else. The animations are all hypnotic and leave you wanting to spam special attacks just to watch the clay dance around the screen. The character designs are all vague and open to interpretation, strangely making these characters very endearing and memorable, all from headcannons and interpretation, rather than the game spelling everything out for you. All this combines with the general craziness of the world itself making you want to explore every nook and cranny to find what strange thing hides behind each corner. 

This game is closer to a Yume Nikki than a "real" RPG. The combat it servicable here, but it's nothing special. However, if you just want to gawk at some cool clay, or more reasonably, have some background knowledge to play the second game, 6.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198330043069', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1702967324}
review:
This game is a hidden gem. 

I feel not many games reach this level of enjoyment for me, and only some become gems in game form. some examples being Silent hill 2, and Lisa: The Painful.

All I can say is buy it and try for yourself!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044539233', 'num_games_owned': 1237, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1496033897}
review:
Short absurdist RPG.  Most NPC and plot dialogue is generated randomly and means nothing.  There's some really weird and interesting visuals using claymation and stop-motion techniques.  The music is never quite unpleasant, despite almost always featuring a melting dissonance.  Battle system is fairly simple and becomes trivial once you obtain more party members and gear.  Some other small nitpicks but they become irrelevant due to the former aspect and overall brevity of the game.

Few bucks for a few hours of gameplay.  I wouldn't call Hylics an amazing package but it's very unique.  Maybe try it on sale if you're bored.  Hit Alt-Enter to fullscreen.

review: Hylics falls under the intentionally creepy and obscure RPG game, however sometimes it seems to fall flat or feels like it's pushing too hard for the creepy element. I also find that you have to grind a lot/go into battles VERY well prepared, or maybe I'm too inexperienced for this game. None the less, the visual effects, music, and character design are a feast for the senses and mind. Can't wait to beat it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106152551', 'num_games_owned': 1233, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1491327069}
review:
Hylics è un rpg che presenta elementi molto classici ma che colpisce fin dalle prime immagini per ambientazione e mondo di gioco . Lo stile grafico psichedelico è sicuramente il punto forte del titolo; arte, nonsense, figure in plastilina e sfondi da lsd ci terranno incollati allo schermo senza problemi per le poche ore di durata del titolo.
Personalmente non l'ho trovato un capolavoro, non portando chissà quale innovazione nel campo dei ben noti e trita e ritrita rpg, tuttavia ho apprezzato alcune meccaniche interessanti. Una di quelle che più mi ha colpito è che morire nel gioco non costituirà  un game over vero e proprio ma verremo trasportati in una sorta di aldilà in cui non solo potremo respawnare nelle varie zone di gioco ma sarà lì che depositeremo le "carni" dei nemici sconfitti che forniranno al party bonus PERMANENTI in statistiche. Così facendo la morte del party in alcune aree di gioco sarà una sorta di "transizione obbligatoria" per poter diventare più forti e quindi proseguire nella storia.
Se siete amanti degli rpg stile old final fantasy o se vi ho suscitato anche solo un po' di curiosità con questa recensione allora buttate un occhio su Hylics ! 

-Al

review:
давно такого кайфа от игры не получал
игра на английском половину слов я не знаю, но сюжета там и нет. точнее он есть но его почему то нет. он внутренний твой 
такой вырванный отдельный сюрреалистичный.
мне даж локации настока понравились что я под конец по ним как по родным ходил. Я бы хотел жить как вэйн в странном доме неправильной геометрической формы с котом у которого голова тоже в форме полумесяца и поедать буритто любуясь пластилиновыми кактусами на полях, плавать на катере под кислотные шугейз мотивчики и летать на флаере с острова на остров залипая на архитектуру и разноцветные пейзажи

это второй проект после поллитровой мыши который мне очень сильно понравился от западных чуваков. 
и между ними порой можно провести забавные связи 

вокруг странные рисованные ландшафты
 укуренные диалоги в целом несущие лишь странность данного момента
интуитивные сигналы и штуки погружающие в необычное  состояние
отличная музыка


абсолютно отсутствуют целостная понятная картина происходящего. что мне очень сильно и понравилось!!!!!!!!!

И ещё раз подтверждение что независимые разработчики торчки могут больше выдать годноты чем крупные студии с нереальным бюджетом давно потерявшие внутренних странных и не обычных - себя

author: {'steamid': '76561198053805775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1483146134}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052769359', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1482745288}
review:
Don't buy this if you're looking for an enjoyable rpg or even a decent game.

Pros:
- Trippy aesethetic (which is probably what caught your eye).
- Music is decent.
- Has a couple neat mechanics that could've been great with polish.

Cons
- There's almost no story. Each party member has 10 lines of text each with no motivation for why the join the main character (Wayne) in their adventure (example: first guy joins because you found a paper cup, second one joins because you found his gloves).
- A few characters  seem to have a history together but is never flesh out in any meaningful way. This leads to the inital intrigue generated by the trippy aestethics and the world built on it evaporating within the first half hour.
- The combat is bare bones and is imbalanced, maybe by design. 
Example: There's a skill that allows a party member to heal itself for 30% and costs 25 magic points (each maybe starts with a flat 100), which everyone can learn. There's another skill that heals EACH member for 50% of their health and costs only 35 which EVERYONE can learn. Think about that.
- Due to imbalanced combat, encounters become trivial to the point of irritating, again, maybe by design. I avoided a lot of fights because I had learned how to exploit the system and enemies did not scale well with my progress.
-A majority of dialogue is randomly generated, as such I avoided interacting with most of the npcs and I made it through 95% the game through deductive reasoning.
-The major lack of direction or guidance leads to a fustrating start.

Conclusion: I get the feeling this was Mason Lindroth dipping his toes into the RPG waters or maybe wanted to make an "experience" or perhaps a parody of the conventional rpg. What resulted was a subpar game that feels like wasted potential. 

Honestly I would've paid more than twice as much for just the sound track or maybe an artbook in pdf form.

The biggest thing I've taken away from this is how not to design an RPG or a game in general, so maybe the experience was worth it after all.

I see people comparing this Earthbound and Lisa, but both of those had direction, and not only gave you reasons to keep playing but rewarded you for it, as a game should. This does not.

So, as a (potential) parody, it fails. As an experience, it overstays its welcome and feels like less than the sum of it's parts. But as a learning tool I think it's reasonable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080063743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1482296357}

author: {'steamid': '76561198039774783', 'num_games_owned': 471, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1486093341}
review:
The game is so reminiscent of the ensuing hangover that proliferated the early 90's from the acid rave party that was the 1980's. It wakes up in the mid-afternoon, drenched in its own puke of subdued pastel colors and jaded slacker rock, and littered with wandering blobs that wax poetic with their streams of consciousness.

Hylics is the most 90's thing I've ever played, and I absolutely love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003530570', 'num_games_owned': 1302, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1480977587}

author: {'steamid': '76561198262036917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1687841775}
review:
Hylics is a game where the main focus is on the adventure, and not the ending. It's a very unique game that will most likely confuse any newcomers, but to be truthfully honest, it's a pretty straightforward RPG. A problem I had was that, all of the NPCs speak in randomly generated text. Yes, it's hilarious to see them talking about dirt-prisons and glands and the whatnot, but the problem is that you have to figure out everything on your own. Because of the randomly generated text, the NPCs are rather unhelpful (at least a majority are.) The best point of the game is easily the graphics and animation. Mason Lindroth crafted a beautifully trippy game that, at a price point of about four bucks, will do your game collection no harm, and is a weirdly enjoyable experience,

Also Wayne's head melts off when you die.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007642723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1474186879}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057567789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1480209007}
review:
Hylics is a strange turn-based RPG.  Nothing really makes sense in this game, but it still works, somehow.  

Pros:
-The art style is interesting
-The game has a good sense of humor
-The gameplay is enjoyable
-The music is good, and fits the weird art style
-There are no random battles

Cons:
-The game is too easy
-The game is short
-There isn't much of a story
-Most of the dialogue is nonsensical

In conclusion, it's a fun game that's dirt cheap.  It's short, but you shouldn't expect much for $2.99.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043960909', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1479970922}
review: Great, but somewhat short game for what it's worth. Fantastic music and visuals. Deserves a sequel/prequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053414777', 'num_games_owned': 1215, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1559528787}
review: Hylics is a one-of-a-kind experience. With its beautiful, surreal, and unusual claymation and arts, strumming, lazy guitar soundtrack, and the entire ethereal experience it creates with its quite literally random dialogue, Hylics is a game that shows the flexibility and potential of the video game medium. Although it is short, it has snappy (heh) combat, interesting exploration and secrets, and actually intriguing characters. It definitely is an artistic experience, and one of the few that can make the player feel like they really are in a dreamy, hazy, foreign world. I definitely appreciate and admire Lindroth's creation and found it memorable, thoughtful, and really, really comfy. Definitely worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023061002', 'num_games_owned': 519, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1479931398}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991892563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1467423592}
review: Short but very, very sweet. Worth playing for the music alone. Worth playing for the animation alone. Worth playing for the writing alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198250544284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 8739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8739, 'last_played': 1485161174}
review:
Pros:[list][*]occasionally beautiful clay graphics
[*]some stunning ost tracks
[*]text from npcs and narration may stray from nonsensical to deliver something strange, but profound
[*]no xp = no grinding
[*]odd, but satisfying humor
[*]a fantastically strange experience
[*]neat enemy design
[*]great animations[/list]

Cons:[list][*]a few graphical errors
[*]controls aren't the default rpgmaker controls, and you're not given much of an indication of what's changed[/list]

For me, Hylics was an unexpectedly fantastic experience. A trippy feel, gibberish-spouting npcs, and a nice stray from traditional rpg "musts" have made Hylics out to be a game I won't soon be forgetting. For fans of other [i]odd[/i] rpgs like LISA, Space Funeral, or even Yume Nikki, definitely give Hylics a shot

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198165155743', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1452414726}
review: So if you liked Earthbound but didn't think it was abstract or trippy enough, this is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198318895207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 885, 'last_played': 1688287586}
review:
何となく気になったときにやってみて、それで終わって。
ふと知り合いとゲームの話をするときにHylicsはいいぞ……なんてとりあえず薦めたくなる作品。

ただ万人受けは期待しない！色々と！
どこがええねん！！ってキレられても想定内であるべき。そんな作品。

短い作品ながらランダムテキストのおかげで何回やり直しても面白…い訳ではなく、何回やっても意味はわからない。意味なんてなかった

英語なんだから翻訳使えば楽勝だろ？なんて思ってエ●サイトのタブを開いてナメてかかったらあまりの支離滅裂さに自分で訳した方が納得がいくレベル。
理解はしない(出来ない)けれども。

ただし、グラフィックからBGMまでかなり優秀。
クレイアニメのキャプチャーで作られた世界は粘土なおかげでよく潰れていく。ホントに。
ギターのぼややんとした音がなんとなく現実的じゃないような…説明しがたい。でも好きだ。

総括するとなんかどっかおかしいこの感じは最高にクール。
らりぱっぱな世界をダバダバ歩くオブジェクト破壊神のWAYNEはクレイジー。

わりとシステム周りなんかもJRPGライクなので、半日あれば大体クリアできるボリュームの中にも寄り道要素がある。
ライブとか砂の城とかリスの頭とか。

いわゆる雰囲気ゲーだからレビューとかトレイラーとか、余裕があったらMason Lindroth氏のアートワークとかを見て気になった時点でコレを買うべきなんだろう。

日本人ユーザーも、自分のようにこんなに語彙力が低い人間でも意外と楽しめることを知って、なんとなくやってみてほしい。

author: {'steamid': '76561197960867683', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1623100487}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002432251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1470535250}
review: Hylics can be interpreted as a parody of the JRPG genre, but not in the same vein as trash like the Neptunia series.  It is totally incoherent by design, with most text generated from a collection of random words which could be taken as a comment on the gibberish neo-vocabulary employed in every JRPG used to describe its particular systems.  I'm probably looking too much into it.  As a critique overall, it says little.  I liked the organic, abstract landscapes and creatures crafted in clay and the rare 'action figure' medium.   It is different, I'll give it that.  The music is inoffensive and not memorable.  I could not access one area (past the terminal on foot) or talk to an NPC in the disco area without the game crashing.  Going by the splash image for the game on Steam this probably prevented me from recruiting a party member (not that they were needed).  Only a bit over three hours long and three dollars wide, but not worth your time.
